recreation areas policies governing operation of parks a the city parks are to be used for activities conducted by or under the authority of the city primarily for citizens of the city these parks and facilities may be made available to recognized recreation groups when not in conflict with the department activities fees for the use of facilities are provided under the fee schedule in appendix a to this b applicants for reservations for organizations must provide documentary evidence to the city manager that 1 they represent the responsible organizations  2 the organization will guarantee orderly behavior for special events  3 the organization will underwrite any damage due to their use of the facility  and 4 the organization shall hold the city harmless for any injuries or damages occurring during the event c the city manager reserves the right to cancel or reschedule a meeting time if a special activity instrumental in meeting the community needs is meeting at that time one weeks notice will be given to the group concerned whenever possible d violation of any of the established policies or rules may result in the loss of all privileges    policies for recreational activities a policies for setting fees the city manager will provide comprehensive programs for the entire community and recover direct costs of programming including instructor fees supplies materials equipment and the administrative charges when possible from those who participate fees for services and for use of city programs parks and facilities excluding program and class fees will be assessed as authorized by city council resolution      8152001   1132004   2212007 hours except for unusual and unforeseen emergencies parks shall be open to the public every day of the year during hours to be designated by the city manager the designated opening and closing hours for each individual park or park facility if the hours designated for such park facility differ from the remainder of the park shall be posted therein for public information 2     8191998 rules and regulations no person shall within any public park situated within the boundaries of the city 1 disobey the lawful and reasonable order of a police officer or park employee in the discharge of such officers or employees duties or disobey or disregard the notices prohibitions instructions or directions on any park sign including rules and regulations posted on the grounds or buildings in parks 2 willfully mark deface disfigure injure tamper with or displace or remove any park property or appurtenances whatsoever 3 endanger the safety of any person by any conduct or act 4 smoke in buildings or areas prohibited by designated signs posted by the city manager 5 interfere with encumber obstruct or render dangerous any part of a park 6 enter or leave any park facility except at established entranceways or exits or at established times 7 commit any assault or battery or engage in instigate or encourage a contention or fight 8 act as crier or advertiser media of voice public address system or other mechanical device without written approval of the city manager 9 destroy cut break deface mutilate injure disturb sever from the ground or remove any growing thing including but not limited to any plant flower flower bed shrub tree growth or any branch stem fruit or leaf thereof or bring into or have in such persons possession in any park any tool or instrument intended to be used for cutting thereof or any garden or agricultural implements or tools which could be used for the removal thereof 10 attach any posters fliers banners notices or directional signs to trees 11 possess consume or serve any alcoholic or intoxicating beverages in any park or facility therein unless there has been specific prior authorization by the city council pursuant to a written agreement or resolution 12 be permitted in the park staff office unless authorized by the park staff 13 operate a boat in the gulf of mexico within 500 feet of the beach area or launch boats from beach areas within parks except those areas designated as launching areas and ingress or egress channels related thereto 14 operate a surfboard wind surfer sailboard or skimboard in any beach area in a manner that endangers the safety of swimmers or individuals in or around the water or beach 15 fish from any beach area or lake within any park wherein such fishing is prohibited by designated signs 16 change clothing on any beach or in any vehicle or other place in any park area except in such buildings or structures as may be provided therefore 17 dump deposit or leave any bottles broken glass ashes paper boxes cans dirt rubbish waste garbage refuse or other trash anywhere on the grounds of the parks other than in proper receptacles provided therefore and no such refuse or trash shall be placed in any waters in or contiguous to the parks or beach areas where receptacles are not so provided all such rubbish or waste shall be carried away from the park by the person responsible for its presence and properly disposed of elsewhere 18 picnic in any area of the parks wherein such picnicking is prohibited by designated signs 19 drive any unauthorized vehicle on any area within any park except the paved park roads or parking areas park an unauthorized vehicle in any area other than an established or designated parking area or park any unauthorized vehicle in any park or park area overnight 20 ride a bicycle on other than a paved vehicular road or path designated for that purpose leave a bicycle in any place other than a bicycle rack when such is provided or leave a bicycle lying on the ground or pavement or any place or position so as to present any obstruction to pedestrian or vehicular traffic 21 operate a concession  or peddle solicit sell advertise or distribute any articles merchandise pamphlets or objects of any kind whatsoever in any park without written approval of the city manager 22 pile or maintain any material or debris of any kind against or upon or attach any rope cable or other contrivance to or set fire to any trees shrubs plants flowers grass plant growth or living timber or suffer any fire upon land to extend into park lands or go upon any prohibited lawn grass plot or planted area except at such times and in such manner as the city manager may designate 1a b er ty     8211996   12161998   2212007   12172008 animals  glass containers a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection animal means any living dumb creature glass container means any glass receptacle bottle or dish such objects as binoculars eyeglasses jewelry face masks or any object other than a container are not included owner means any person with the right or duty to control or any person owning possessing harboring or keeping an animal b glass containers prohibited no person shall take into any public park of the city any glass container or be in possession of any glass container in any public park of the city c animals it shall be lawful for the owner of an animal to allow such animal to enter or be within any public park of the city unless designated otherwise providing that the animal must be on a leashed restraint and under owner control at all times that the owner must remove and properly dispose of all animal waste and that the owner is responsible for all actions of the animal animals are not allowed on any city beach or in any playground any person violating this section shall be guilty of an infraction which shall be punishable by a fine of not less than $5000 per violation with each day or partial day of violation counting as a separate offense 1s 1630     9102006 fires prohibited no person shall build or attempt to build a fire in any park within the city except by approval of city council      2212007   3182009 reserved editors note  adopted february 21 200 repealed  2837 which pertained to tennis racquetball and shuffleboard courts schedule of fees see also the table secs 28382860  reserved article iii  conservation and preservation of land footnotes  2  cross reference resource protection standards ch 52 objectives the objectives of the naples land conservation program are the acquisition conservation preservation restoration and maintenance of 1 vital and significant threatened natural lands forest upland and wetland communities  2 environmentally sensitive lands  3 lands that have been altered but are capable of being restored  4 improved or unimproved lands that may be useful  5 interests in lands such as conservation easements scenic easements and any other interests located within and adjacent to the city for the benefit of present and future generations    542005 purpose and intent of article the purposes and intent of this article are as follows 1 to acquire protect and manage environmentally sensitive lands that contain natural upland or wetland communities native plant communities rare and endangered flora and fauna endemic species endangered species habitat a diversity of species significant water resources or outstanding aesthetic or other natural features maximizing protection of unique or endangered habitats  2 to acquire protect and manage environmentally sensitive lands that offer the best human social value including equitable geographic distribution natural resource based recreation and protection of water resources local ecological awareness and enhancement of the aesthetic setting of the city  3 to acquire protect and manage environmentally sensitive lands that serve to recharge the countys aquifers and protect its wetlands and surface water resources to ensure the delivery of clean and plentiful water supplies and provide flood control  4 to acquire protect and manage environmentally sensitive lands containing the most biological value including biodiversity listed species habitat connectivity restoration potential and ecological quality  5 to protect present conservation or preservation lands by acquiring protecting and managing adjacent properties which if not acquired would threaten the environmental integrity of the existing resource or which if acquired would enhance and buffer the environmental integrity of the resource and add to resource connectivity  6 to restore the natural functions as necessary to any impacted and vulnerable habitats which would then contribute significantly to fulfilling this programs goals  7 to help implement the objectives and policies of the comprehensive plan which have been promulgated to preserve and protect environmental protection areas designated in the plan and other natural forest resources wetlands endangered species habitat and vulnerable rare habitats  8 to identify the citys best and most endangered environmental lands for acquisition protection and management by evaluating the biological and hydrological characteristics and viability of the resource the vulnerability of the resource to degradation or destruction and the feasibility of managing the resource to maintain its natural attributes  9 to manage acquired environmentally sensitive lands with the primary objectives of maintaining and preserving their natural resource values and providing appropriate natural resource based recreational and educational opportunities by employing management techniques that are most appropriate for each native community so that our natural heritage may be preserved and appreciated by and for present and future generations  10 to preserve lands that may not qualify as environmentally sensitive but are otherwise worthy of restoration and preservation for the health safety and welfare of the citizenry  11 to acquire and manage interests in land such as conservation easements scenic easements and any other interests that may assist in conservation or preservation of lands  12 to protect natural resources which lie within the boundaries of other conservation land acquisition programs where funds would leverage significant other matching sources of funding for other agency acquisition projects that would not be available without such a local match or which would result in considerably higher funding rank in another program and to enter into interlocal or other agreements for conservation and preservation  13 to cooperate actively with other acquisition conservation and resource management programs including but not limited to such programs as program the state of florida conservation and recreation lands program the land acquisition trust fund florida forever and save our rivers program where the purposes of such programs are consistent with the purposes of this program 14 to provide for acquisition maintenance and preservation of a system of passive parks    542005 definitions the following words and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section acquisition project means 1 or more parcels of land that have been approved by the council for conservation or preservation acquisition proposal means an application for nomination or recommendation of 1 or more parcels of land or interests in land for conservation or preservation buffer land means land which is adjacent to publicly owned environmental land or privately held land permanently dedicated to conservation or that land which is an inholding within publicly owned environmental land and which if not acquired would threaten the environmental integrity of the existing resource or if acquired would enhance the environmental integrity and connectivity of the resource environmentally sensitive land means land which contains natural upland or wetland communities native plant communities rare and endangered flora and fauna endemic species endangered species habitat a diversity of species significant water resources or outstanding aesthetic or other natural features management means the preservation enhancement restoration conservation monitoring or maintenance of the natural resource values of lands which have been acquired or approved for management under this program including provision of appropriate public access natural resource based recreation means all forms of uses which are consistent with the goals of this program and are compatible with the specific parcel such uses shall include but not be limited to hiking nature photography birdwatching kayaking canoeing swimming hunting and fishing nonprofit organization means an organization as defined in section 501 of the united states internal revenue which includes among its primary goals the conservation of natural resources and the protection of the environment target protection areas means larger areas of environmentally sensitive land or other land within which are located specific sites which generally satisfy the initial screening criteria and meet the goals of this program    542005 cross reference definitions generally  12 land conservation trust fund the city council hereby establishes the naples land conservation trust fund the fund for use in acquiring and managing conservation and preservation lands in the city and for any purposes set forth in the naples land conservation program the program the fund shall receive and disburse monies in accordance with the provisions in this section 1 the fund may receive and apply monies from the following sources a all monies accepted by the city in the form of federal state or other governmental grants reimbursements allocations or appropriations foundation or private grants donations for acquisition of environmentally sensitive lands and payments provided for mitigation activity associated with such acquisition activity b all monies from additional allocations as may be made by the city council from time to time for the purposes set forth in the program c all interest or other income generated from the sources identified herein except where monies received have been otherwise designated or restricted d funds from borrowing from any lawful source including without limitation loans or bonds  interlocal or other public or private agreements e to invest any funds held in reserves or sinking funds or any funds not required for immediate disbursement in such investments as may be authorized for trust funds under fs  21547 as amended 2 the fund shall be maintained in a separate and segregated trust fund of the city to be used solely for the authorized purposes set forth in the program 3 disbursements from the fund shall be made for the following authorized purposes a acquisition of properties which have been approved for purchase by resolution of the council b costs associated with each acquisition including but not limited to appraisals surveys title search work real property taxes documentary stamps and surtax fees and other transaction costs c costs of administering the program including any loans from the general fund for funding startup costs until such time as the fund is closed administration of the program may be conducted by city staff or by contract with a private entity d to undertake and carry out studies and analyses of program needs and ways of meeting those needs e to acquire and dispose of real and personal property or any interest therein when such acquisition is necessary or appropriate to protect the natural environment provide public access or public recreational facilities preserve wildlife habitat areas or provide access to management of acquired lands  to acquire interests in land by means of land exchanges  and to enter into alternatives to the acquisition of fee interests in land including the acquisition of easements life estates leases and leaseback arrangements and to make any other disbursements consistent with the purposes of the program f to fund acquisitions consistent with the comprehensive plan or land development code g to provide funding in cooperation with other local regional state or federal public land acquisition programs or publicprivate ventures the city may enter into agreements to acquire lands jointly or for eventual resale to other public land acquisition programs in collier county h to borrow money or the issuance of bonds for the purposes provided herein to provide for and secure the payment thereof and to provide for the rights of the holders thereof i to insure and procure insurance against any loss in connection with any of the trusts operations including without limitation 1 the repayment of any loans to mortgage lenders or mortgage loans  2 any project  3 any bonds of the city  insurance may be procured in such amounts and from such insurers including the federal government as may be deemed necessary or desirable by the city j to engage the services of private consultants on a contract basis for rendering professional and technical assistance and advice k to identify parcels of land that would be appropriate acquisitions l to do any and all things necessary or convenient to carry out the purposes of and exercise the powers given and granted herein to the full extent of the law    542005 administration the program shall be managed by the city manager designated administrative staff the council retains the authority to approve application proposals borrowings disbursements and disposition of property the council may approve interlocal or other agreements for the management of any portion or all of the program    542005 properties eligible for acquisition and management a properties eligible to be considered for acquisition and management under the program shall be only those lands or interests in them described in this article that are available from willing and voluntary participants b acquisition of property shall not be constrained based on the immediate availability of management money c any property not on the acquisition list which is offered for conveyance or donation to the city and is proposed for management under this program shall be evaluated as provided for in this article and may only be accepted and approved for management by the council    542005 criteria for evaluation of lands for acquisition and management a the evaluation of each acquisition proposal shall be based on satisfying at least 1 or more of the initial screening criteria below qualified sites shall then be further prioritized by secondary evaluative criteria listed below under subsection b of this section the initial screening criteria are 1 land with the most rare unique and endangered habitats found in the city 2 land offering the best human social values including equitable geographic distribution appropriate access for natural resource based recreation and enhancement of the aesthetic setting of the city 3 land which protects the most water resource values including aquifer recharge water quality wetland dependant species habitat and flood control 4 land containing the most biological value including biodiversity listed species habitat connectivity restoration potential and ecological quality 5 land which enhances or protects the environment total value of current conservation lands as a buffer ecological link or habitat corridor 6 any qualified land which meets at least 1 or more of the above criteria and has matching funds available is a significant bargain sale or for which program funds availability would leverage a significantly higher funding rank in another acquisition program b those proposed acquisition proposals which are initially qualified under the screening criteria shall be evaluated and ranked by the administrative staff using secondary ranking criteria based on site visit information which confirms or refutes the initial screening criteria evaluation and based on comparative size to prefer larger of similar parcels vulnerability to destruction to prefer most threatened of qualified parcels overall resource ecological quality to prefer highest quality of similar parcels and the estimated feasibility and costs of management to prefer most manageable parcels c the council shall approve and make a part hereof the attached initial list of target protection areas within which are located specific sites which generally satisfy the initial screening criteria and meet the goals of the program inclusion on this list is not a guarantee of any specific purchase all specific proposals will be evaluated and ranked by the administrative staff for a recommendation of approval to the council in accordance with the goals policies and procedures of this article the following list is the first list of target protection areas adopted for consideration 1 all designated conservation or preservation lands on the future land use map of the citys comprehensive plan with predominantly native vegetative cover 2 all natural resource protection areas as shown on the future land use map 3 all undeveloped lands with predominantly native vegetative cover d the city manager shall prepare and periodically update for presentation to the council a naples conservation lands program manual or brochure developed by administrative staff which upon approval by the council shall be used as a guide for implementing the provisions of this article and shall also include the initial and secondary criteria listed hereinabove for evaluating acquisition proposals    542005 acquisition list the overall naples conservation program acquisition list shall consist of 2 specific lists the target protection areas list and the active acquisition list the council shall approve both in accordance with the procedures set forth below 1 the target protection areas list shall consist of lands representing the highest natural resource values such as natural resource protection areas but generally not specific parcels and is initially approved by the council and updated periodically by the council it is established and updated in accordance with program goals procedures and criteria 2 the active acquisition list shall consist of criteriaqualified sites that have been selected from target protection areas as well as qualified acquisition proposals submitted by the public all of which have received positive responses from the property owners the active acquisition list shall be updated periodically according to program procedures and criteria site acquisition proposals that receive the highest evaluations pursuant to the program criteria and for which acquisition is feasible will be placed on this list pending approval by the council 3 once approved by the council the city shall actively pursue acquisition of projects on the active acquisition list all sites shall be pursued on a voluntary basis only without the use of the citys eminent domain powers 4 projects will only be removed from the active acquisition list by successful purchase of the site approval of the next succeeding list withdrawal of positive interest by the property owner or by resolution of the council projects removed may still be considered at a later time    542005 nomination of acquisition proposals and candidate sites a specific site consideration will be given to all individual properties which lie within the target protection areas list and which have generated a positive interest response to a letter of acquisition inquiry sent by the citys designated contact b public and landowner applications nominating properties for acquisition may be submitted at any time during or after the first annual public solicitation meeting described below by any person or organization including the city collier county or other regional state or federal agencies c all nominations shall be made by filing an application with the city manager which will then be forwarded to designated administrative staff for review d there will be an annual public meeting for the purpose of updating the council and the public and for soliciting proposals and applications the first such meeting will take place by the end of the first year of implementation of the program the first annual meeting will be conducted upon adoption of the ordinance from which this section is derived future meetings will be held annually in conjunction with the citys budget cycle e if the applicant has an ownership interest in any real property covered by an application for proposed acquisition such interest shall be disclosed in the same manner as required of zoning applicants as required by the land development code and state law this shall not apply to governmental applicants f if the applicant does not have an ownership interest in the real property covered by an application or if the applicant is a governmental agency the name and address of the owner as listed in the property appraisers records shall be provided with the application    542005 procedure for selection of acquisition proposals for placement on the active acquisition list and subsequent purchase procedures a administrative staff will send letters of inquiry to all property owners within the target protection areas positive responses will be forwarded to designated staff for preliminary review using the initial screening criteria b after the first annual public solicitation of nominations property owner and publicly nominated projects will be forwarded first to city staff for the mailing of inquiry letters designated staff using the initial screening criteria will review all positive responses c nominated properties that do not fulfill the purposes of the program or do not satisfy the initial criteria will not be evaluated further the city manager will notify the nominating person of the decision if the nominating person disagrees with the decision of the city manager that person may appeal the decision to the council by filing an appeal with the city manager within 30 days after the date of mailing of the decision the council will conduct a hearing on the appeal and render a decision which shall constitute final agency action d proposals which satisfy the initial screening are then considered by the administrative staff for secondary criteria review and ranking staff shall consider with each proposal boundary and location maps for each site descriptions of the biological and hydrological characteristics including initial criteria satisfied a summary of its potential for appropriate use development potential of the site and adjacent land an assessment of the management needs and costs the assessed value and any potentially available matching funds this acquisition proposal information shall be the initial criteria screening report e upon completion of the initial criteria screening report the council shall hold a public hearing to consider the recommendations regarding each site the applicants and landowners comments and comments from the public a courtesy notice shall be provided to the owners of properties which are the subject of the hearing although failure to notify said owners shall not invalidate these proceedings the council shall evaluate all qualified proposals using the secondary ranking criteria the initial criteria screening report and public comments then propose topranked proposals for the active acquisition list at this hearing subsequent meetings may be called to complete this task f the council shall vote on whether to approve all or part of the proposed active acquisition list and any additions that may be added to it additions may be added but any additional properties must be subjected to the entire evaluation process g after approval of the list the administrative staff will prepare a project design report for each project including appraisals title research history and purpose of project and program qualifications h the council after approval of the active acquisition list and the administrative staffs recommendations for negotiations will instruct staff to negotiate for purchase for each listed project with optional use of a 3rd party nonprofit organization negotiator as authorized by the council i upon successful completion of negotiations staff will present to the council the proposed contract terms for review and approval staff will also forward the recommendations for contracts recommended for approval and for contracts that should not proceed as negotiated    542005 management plans and use of environmentally sensitive lands a no later than 60 days from the date of acquisition an interim management plan for any property acquired shall be submitted by staff to the council for approval and shall be implemented by the city manager pursuant to the councils direction an interim management plan shall not be implemented for more than 2 years after acquisition of the property prior to the expiration of 2 years either a new management plan shall be implemented or by affirmative action of the council the interim plan shall continue b a final management plan with required review and updating every 10 years shall be prepared for each property and shall 1 identify such management activities as are necessary to preserve enhance restore conserve maintain or monitor the resource as appropriate  and 2 identify such uses as are consistent with the preservation enhancement restoration conservation and maintenance of the resource  and 3 estimate the annual costs of managing the project c if the final management plan is submitted within 60 days prior to closing an interim management plan shall not be required d annually the 10year management plans prepared during the preceding year shall be submitted to the council for review and update each 10year management plan shall be updated at least every 5 years from the last date of council approval and may be amended as often as required e all management plans shall be consistent with the purposes set forth herein all properties acquired or managed shall be managed in accordance with the approved management plan for that property f no use infrastructure or improvement shall be permitted on any property acquired or managed under the program that is inconsistent with the purposes of the program or that is not provided by an approved management plan for the property g the city will seek cooperative management arrangements with other agencies and entities h purchasing land using program funds permanently extinguishes all development rights except those strictly compatible with the purposes and goals of the program i public access is an important element of management and this program examples of permitted uses subject to compatibility with specific parcels include hiking nature photography birdwatching kayaking canoeing swimming hunting and fishing the program will also make the acquired sites available with minimal risk to the environmental integrity of the site to educate collier countys schoolage population and the general public about the uniqueness and importance of the citys subtropical ecosystems and natural communities j passive use parks will be an element of this program    542005 personnel article i  in general secs 2912930  reserved article ii  federal oldage and survivors insurance footnotes  1  state law reference federal old age and survivors benefits fs ch 650 extended to city employees it is declared to be the policy and purpose of the city to extend effective as of  to the employees and officials thereof not excluded by law and where employed in connection with a governmental or proprietary function the benefits of the system of oldage and survivors insurance as authorized by the federal social security act and amendments thereto including pl 734 of 81st congress and by laws of fla ch 26841 1951 and to cover by such plan all services which constitute employment as defined in laws of fla ch 26841 1951  2 performed in the employ of the city by employees thereof in pursuance of this policy and for that purpose the city shall take such action as may be required by applicable state or federal laws or regulations    authority to make necessary agreements the mayor or other chief executive officer of the city is authorized and directed to execute all necessary agreements and amendments to the system of oldage and survivors insurance with the state agency for the purpose of extending the benefits provided by such system to the employees and officials of this city as provided in section 2931 which agreement shall provide for such methods of administration of the plan by the city as are found by the state agency to be necessary for the proper and efficient administration thereof and shall be effective with respect to services in employment covered by such agreement performed after     withholdings withholdings from salaries wages or other compensation of employees and officials for the purpose provided in section 2931 are authorized to be made and shall be made in the amounts and at such times as may be required by applicable state or federal laws or regulations and shall be paid over to the state agency designated by such laws or regulations to receive such amounts    use of city funds there shall be appropriated from available funds derived from general fund and waterworks funds such amounts at such times as may be required to pay promptly the contributions for oldage and survivors insurance required of the city as employer by applicable state or federal laws or regulations which shall be paid over to the lawfully designated state agency at the times and in the manner provided by law and regulation    records of city the city shall keep such records and make such reports as may be required by applicable state or federal laws or regulations for federal oldage and survivors insurance and shall adhere to the rules and regulations of the state agency for the enforcement of such laws and regulations    employees otherwise covered exempt there is excluded from this article any authority to make any agreement with respect to any position or any employee or official covered or authorized to be covered by any other ordinance or law creating any retirement system for any employee or official of the city on the effective date of the ordinance from which this section derives    social security act adopted the city adopts the terms conditions requirements reservations benefits privileges and other conditions thereunto appertaining of title ii of the social security act as amended by pl 734 81st congress for and on behalf of all the officers and employees thereof and of its departments and agencies save and except any of such officers and employees covered or authorized to be covered by any retirement system provided by law on the effective date of the ordinance from which this section derives and further excepting any official or employee who occupies any position office or employment not authorized to be covered by applicable state or federal laws or regulations    custodians withholding and reporting agents designated the city clerk and mayor are designated the custodians of all sums withheld from the compensation of officers and employees and of the appropriated funds for the contribution of the city under this article and the city clerk is made the withholding and reporting agent and charged with the duty of maintaining personnel records for the purposes of this article    secs 29392965  reserved article iii  retirement system footnotes  2  state law reference actuarial soundness of local government pensions fs  11260 et seq division 1  generally established  effective date  merger of systems a the city retirement system is established for the purpose of providing pension and other benefits for certain employees of the city and their eligible beneficiaries b the effective date of the city retirement system shall be  c the retirement program established effective  and as evidenced by group annuity contract gl163 issued by the life insurance company of virginia is merged into and replaced by the city retirement system established by this article d effective  and notwithstanding any other provision of this the accrued benefits of all members of the retirement system who are employed by the city and not participating in the drop on that date shall be frozen the value of each members frozen accrued benefit shall be calculated in accordance with the provisions of the retirement system in effect on  and such frozen accrued benefit shall be payable to the member upon attaining eligibility for receipt of normal retirement benefits under the provisions of the system in effect on that date and separation from city employment for credited service on and after  all members of the retirement system shall accrue benefits in accordance with the provisions of this as amended effective  members of the retirement system who are employed by the city and not participating in the drop on  shall upon retirement be eligible to receive a retirement benefit consisting of two parts 1 the frozen accrued benefit based on credited service prior to  and the provisions of the retirement system in effect on   and 2 the accrued benefit based on credited service on and after  and the provisions of this as amended effective   payable at age 60 with five or more years of credited service or the date on which a members of credited service whichever occurs first e notwithstanding any other provision of this article iii the benefit changes contained in shall not apply to any member who was employed by the city on  and who as of that date had attained age 60 with five or more years of credited service or the date on which a members age to last completed month plus credited service totals 85 years or more and the section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning accumulated contributions means the sum of all amounts deducted from the compensation of a member together with regular interest credited actuarial equivalent means benefits of equivalent actuarial present value actuarial equivalencies shall be calculated using such annual rates of compound interest group annuity mortality tables and age adjustments as are adopted by the board based upon the advice of the systems actuaries beneficiary means any person except a retirant who is being paid or has entitlement to a pension payable by the retirement system board means the board of trustees provided in this article compensation means the salary or wages paid to a member by the city for personal services rendered to the city by a member compensation shall include holiday pay vacation pay longevity pay and pay while absent because of illness compensation shall not include overtime pay uniform allowances equipment allowances travel allowances severance payments redemption of unused sick leave or unused vacation leave and items of a similar nature if any doubt occurs the board of trustees shall determine whether a payment is compensation for the purpose of this retirement system for the purpose of applying the limitations set forth in sections 401a17 and 415 of the internal revenue irc compensation shall include any elective deferral as defined in section 402g3 of the irc and any amount which is contributed or deferred by the employer at the election of the member and which is not includible in the gross income of the member by reason of section 125 or 457 of the irc for limitation years beginning on and after  for the purposes of applying the limitations described in subsection a of section 29128 compensation paid or made available during such limitation years shall include elective amounts that are not includible in the gross income of the member by reason of section 132f4 of the irc credited service means the number of years and months of continuous uninterrupted service for which the member has received compensation or is entitled to compensation from the date of employment to the date of termination final average compensation means 196 of the total compensation paid a member during the period of 96 consecutive months of credited service producing the highest total in the event a member who is employed by the city and not participating in the drop on  separates from city employment prior to attaining 96 consecutive months of credited service final average compensation shall be determined by dividing the total compensation paid by the number of months and fraction thereof of credited service provided in no event shall a members final average compensation be less than 136 of the total compensation paid a member during the period of 36 consecutive months of service producing the highest total prior to  former plan means the group annuity retirement program established by the city in december 1953 and evidenced by group annuity contract gl163 issued by the life insurance company of virginia management employee means any employee of the city who is a direct management report to the city manager or city council member means any person who is included in the membership of the retirement system pension means a monthly amount payable by the retirement system throughout the future life of a person or for a temporary period as provided by this article regular interest means such rate of interest per annum compounded annually as the board shall adopt resolution means a resolution or motion adopted by a majority vote of the board of trustees retirant means any member who retires and is being paid or has entitlement to a pension payable by the retirement system on account of employment by the city retirement means a members withdrawal from the employ of the city with entitlement to a pension payable by the retirement system retirement system or system means the city retirement system established by this article service means personal service rendered to the city by an officer or employee of the city      461994   831994   9151999 staff members to boards and commissions of the city by the city manager  2407 authority and responsibility  composition a the authority and responsibility for the general administration and management of the retirement system and for construing and making effective this article is vested in a board of trustees the board shall consist of 7 trustees as follows 1 one member of the city council or a resident of the city of naples with pension experience or expertise in finance to be appointed by the city council 2 one resident of the city with pension experience to be appointed by the city council 3 one member of the administrative staff also to be a member of the pension plan to be appointed by the city manager 4 one nonbargaining unit member to be appointed by the city manager 5 one bargaining unit member to be appointed by the city manager from a list of 3 bargaining unit members submitted by the president of the bargaining unit 6 one retiree currently receiving benefits from the general employees retirement system to be selected by the current board of trustee members 7 one resident of the city with expertise in financial markets to be selected by the current board of trustee members b notwithstanding any other section of this but subject to any provisions of the state constitution or general law members of this board shall be permitted to serve on any other board duly formed by the city c members of the board of trustees shall discharge all duties 1 solely in the interest of the participants and beneficiaries of the retirement system  2 for the exclusive purpose of providing benefits to participants and beneficiaries  3 with the care skill prudence and diligence that a prudent person acting in a like capacity and familiar with such matters would use in the conduct of an enterprise of a like character with like goals  4 by diversifying investments of the retirement system in a manner that minimizes the risk of large losses unless under the circumstances it is clearly not prudent to do so  and 5 in accordance with documents instruments ordinances and statutes governing the retirement system      5201998   9151999   4212004   4162014  term of office  oath of office a the regular term of office of the trustees provided in section 2981a shall be 4 years b each trustee shall qualify by taking an oath of office before the city clerk prior to assuming the duties of trustee      9151999 vacancies the office of trustee of the retirement system board of trustees shall be deemed to be vacated by a trustee provided in section 2981a2 and 3 if the trustee either resigns from the office of trustee or fails to attend 3 consecutive meetings of the board unless in each case excused for cause by the trustees attending the meeting the office of trustee shall be deemed to be vacated by a trustee provided in section 2981a1 if the trustee ceases to be a councilmember of the city the office of trustee shall be deemed to be vacated by a trustee provided in section 2981a3 if the trustee ceases to be a member or ceases to be employed by the city in a position covered by the retirement system if a vacancy occurs in the position of trustee the vacancy shall be filled by the same means as the former trustee was selected within 90 days for the unexpired portion of the term      9151999 meetings compensation the board of trustees of the retirement system shall hold meetings regularly at least once in each calendar quarter and shall designate the time and place thereof it shall adopt its own rules of procedure and shall keep a record of its proceedings all meetings of the board shall be public the trustees shall serve without compensation for their services as trustees but shall be entitled to reimbursement of reasonable and necessary expenses incurred subject to maximum amount and procedures established by the board      9151999 quorum  vote four trustees of the retirement system board of trustees shall constitute a quorum at any meeting of the board each trustee shall be entitled to 1 vote on each question before the board and at least 4 concurring votes shall be necessary for a decision by the board      9151999 officers a the board of trustees of the retirement system shall annually elect from its own number a chairman and a vicechairman b the city clerk or representative shall be secretary to the board and shall be the administrative officer of the retirement system unless another secretary or administrative officer is designated by the board c the finance director shall be treasurer of the retirement system and the custodian of its assets unless another custodian is designated by the board all payments from the assets of the system shall be made only upon evidence of a specific or continuing board authorization for such payments d the city attorney may give advice to the board of trustees in all matters pertaining to its duties in the general administration and management of the retirement system whenever requested and may represent and defend the board as its attorney in all suits and actions at law or in equity that may be brought against it and bring all suits or actions in its behalf that may be required or determined by the board however the board of trustees in its discretion may employ separate and independent legal counsel for such purposes at the sole cost and expense of the board e the board shall appoint an actuary or firm of actuaries who shall be the technical advisor to the board on matters regarding the operation of the retirement system on an actuarial basis and who shall perform such other related duties as are required by the board the term actuary as used in this article shall mean a member of the american academy of actuaries f when needed the board shall appoint as medical director a physician who is not eligible for membership in the retirement system the medical director shall be responsible to and shall hold office at the pleasure of the board  shall arrange for and pass upon all medical examinations required under this article  shall investigate all essential statements and certificates of a medical nature made by or on behalf of a member retirant or beneficiary in connection with a claim for disability or death benefits  and shall report in writing to the board conclusions on medical matters referred by the board g the board may employ such professional and other services required for the proper operation of the retirement system      6181997   9151999 secs 298729110  reserved division 3  membership and benefits membership a the membership of the retirement system shall include all persons who are in the employ of the city and all persons who become employed by the city except as provided in subsection b of this section b the membership of the retirement system shall not include the following 1 any person whose service to the city is rendered on a contractual or fee basis with the exception of the city attorney who may be on a fulltime basis with the city  2 any person employed in a position normally requiring less than 20 hours work in a week parttime  3 any person employed in a position normally requiring less than six months work in a year temporary and seasonal  4 any person who is covered under another retirement program supported in whole or in part by monies of the city except the federal oldage survivors disability and health insurance program  or 5 the mayor or members of the city council any person who was on the city council and whose pension has vested prior to the effective date of may withdraw upon request the accumulated contributions of such person 6 any person hired on or after  otherwise eligible for membership in the retirement system who has not yet completed six months employment with the city c should any member leave the employ of the city the member shall thereupon cease to be a member d if any doubt occurs as to the membership status of any person the board shall decide the question within the meaning of this article e notwithstanding any provision in this section 2911 to the contrary management employees who are members of this retirement system employed by the city and not participating in the drop on  may elect to discontinue participation in this system and participate in the defined contribution plan such election must be made in writing on a form provided by the city no later than  any management employee member who does not timely elect to discontinue participating in this retirement system shall continue participating in this system and shall not participate in the defined contribution plan      311995   5201998   9151999   9212011 credited service a the service rendered by a member in a position covered by the retirement system shall be credited a member by the board in accordance with such rules as the board shall adopt consistent with this article in no case shall more than one year of service be credited any member for service rendered in any one year b a persons credited service shall be forfeited and no longer in force if the members accumulated contributions are withdrawn from the system if a person is reemployed by the city in a position covered by the retirement system and again becomes a member the member may restore the credited service forfeited by the member by repaying into the system the amount of accumulated contributions withdrawn therefrom together with regular interest from the date of withdrawal to the date of deposit subject to the following conditions 1 the member acquires at least one year of credited service on account of service rendered following such reemployment 2 the member enters into a repayment agreement with the board and completes repayment within three years of the date of the agreement c any member who while employed by the city was called to or entered or is called to or enters any armed service of the united states and who has been or shall be on active duty in such armed service during time of war or period of compulsory military service shall have such armed service actually required of the member credited the member as city service subject to the following conditions 1 is reemployed by the city within the period provided by state or federal law 2 returns to the system all amounts withdrawn therefrom at the time of entry or while in such armed service together with regular interest from the date of withdrawal to the date of repayment 3 in no case shall more than five years of credited service be given for all such armed service rendered by a member if any doubt occurs as to the period to be so credited any member of the board shall have final power to determine such period during the period of such armed service and until reemployment by the city contributions to the retirement system shall be suspended the city may elect to continue the citys contribution to the retirement system upon approval by the retirement board d service recognized and in force under another retirement program supported in whole or in part by monies of the city shall be recognized as credited service under this retirement system for the limited purpose only of meeting the service requirements of this system in no case shall such service be used for the purpose of determining the amount of straight life pension terminating upon death or may elect within the 90day period immediately preceding or the 20day period immediately following the date retirement begins to be paid a pension under an optional form of payment provided in section 29116 in lieu of a level straight life pension b subject to subsections c and e of this section the amount of a members straight life pension shall be equal to two percent of the members final average compensation multiplied by the members credited service the straight life pension for a member with credited service subsequent to  who retires subsequent to  subject to subsection c of this section shall be equal to two and onequarter percent of the members final average compensation multiplied by the members credited service the straight life pension for a member on or subsequent to  who retires on or subsequent to  subject to subsections c and e of this section shall be equal to two and onehalf percent of the members final average compensation multiplied by the members credited service the straight life pension for a member who retires on or after  subject to subsections c d and e below shall be equal to two and onehalf percent of the members final average compensation multiplied by the members credited service earned prior to  and 16 percent of the members final average compensation multiplied by the members credited service earned on or after  a members straight life pension shall not exceed a maximum of 100 percent of the members final average compensation not including any scheduled periodic or onetime costofliving benefit increases the amount of the monthly pension being paid to any retirant or beneficiary who was receiving such benefit prior to  shall be increased effective  to $2500 per month c if a member hired prior to  retires pursuant to section 29113 prior to the first day of the calendar month in which the member attains age 60 years the amount of the members level straight life pension shall be reduced by 025 percent multiplied by the number of months and fraction of a month in the period from the date of the members retirement to the date the member would attain age 60 years d if a member hired on or after  retires pursuant to section 29113 prior to the first day of the calendar month in which the member attains age 65 the amount of the members level straight life pension shall be reduced by 025 percent multiplied by the number of months and fraction of a month in the period from the date of the members retirement to the date the member would attain age 65 years e notwithstanding any other provision of this effective  the accrued benefits of all members who are employed by the city and not participating in the drop on that date shall be frozen the value of each such members frozen accrued benefit shall be calculated in accordance with subsection b above and such frozen accrued benefit shall be payable to the member upon separation from city employment and attaining age 60 with five or more years of credited service or the date on which a members age to last completed month plus credited service totals 85 years or more and the member has five or more years of credited service for credited service on and after  the benefit formula for all members shall be 16 percent of average final compensation multiplied by years of credited service on and after that date f notwithstanding any other provision of this members who are employed by the city and not participating in the drop on  shall upon retirement be eligible to receive a retirement benefit consisting of two parts 1 the frozen accrued benefit based on credited service prior to  and the provisions of the retirement system in effect on   and 2 the accrued benefit based on credited service on and after  and the provisions of this as amended effective   payable at age 60 with five or more years of credited service or the date on which a members age to last completed month plus credited service totals 85 years or more and the member has five or more years of credited service whichever occurs first      6 311995   5201998   9151999   2162000   9212011 optional forms of payment within the 90day period immediately preceding or the 20day period immediately following the date retirement begins a member or former member may elect to be paid a pension under one of the optional forms of payment listed in this section in lieu of a level straight life pension the amount of an optional form of pension payment shall be the actuarial equivalent of the amount of the level straight life pension if a member or former member does not make a timely election of an optional form of payment the member shall be paid a level straight life pension the optional forms of payment shall be as follows 1 option a joint and survivor pension under option a a retirant shall be paid a reduced pension throughout the retirants life with the provision that upon death the retirants full reduced pension shall be continued throughout the future life of and paid to such person having an insurable interest in the retirants life as a retirant shall have nominated by written designation duly executed and filed with the board at the time of election of option a 2 option b modified joint and survivor pension under option b a retirant shall be paid a reduced pension throughout a retirants life with the provision that upon death 12 of the retirants reduced pension shall be continued throughout the future life of and paid to such person having an insurable interest in the retirants life as the retirant shall have nominated by written designation duly executed and filed with the board at the time of election of option b 3 option c social security integrated pension under option c a retirant shall be paid an increased pension to the attainment of social security retirement benefits and a reduced pension thereafter the increased pension shall approximate the sum of the reduced pension payable thereafter and the estimated social security primary insurance amount this option shall be available only to a former members who retire pursuant to section 29114  and b members who retire on or after age 60 years pursuant to section 29113 4 option d lump sum payment where a retirant or beneficiary is entitled to a pension the monthly amount of which is computed to be $25000 or less per month the retirant or beneficiary upon proof of good health satisfactory to the board may elect to receive or the board may elect to pay a lump sum payout 5 option e 10year certain payout a retirant may elect to receive a pension benefit paid out in equal monthly installments over a 10year period and life thereafter  should the retirant die before the expiration of the 10year period the balance of the 10year benefit shall be paid to the retirants designated beneficiary      9151999 refund of accumulated contributions a if a member of the retirement system ceases to be employed by the city for any reason except retirement or death before attainment of age 60 years with five or more years of credited service in force the member shall be paid their accumulated contributions plus an amount equal to the accumulated contributions that would have existed had the member contributed at the rate contributed by the city upon written request filed with the board b if a member dies and no pension becomes or will become payable on account of death the members accumulated contributions shall be paid to such person as the member shall have nominated by written designation duly executed and filed with the board if there is no such designated person surviving the member these accumulated contributions shall be paid to the members legal representative c effective  if an actively employed member has completed at least five years and six months of credited service at the time of death the designated person or legal representative shall receive 100 percent of the contributions made to the plan for that member by the city in addition to a refund of 100 percent of the members contributions with regular interest d if a retirant and option a or option b beneficiary if any die before they have been paid an aggregate amount of pension equal to the members accumulated contributions at the time of the members retirement the difference between the members accumulated contributions and the aggregate amount of pension paid shall be paid to such person as the member shall have nominated by written designation duly executed and filed with the board if there is no such designated person surviving the retirant and an option a or option b beneficiary such difference shall be paid to the legal representative of the last to die of the retirant and an option a or option b beneficiary e payment of refunds of accumulated contributions as provided in this section may be made in a single sum or in installments as provided by the board of the bargaining unit represented by the government supervisors association of florida office and professional employees international union gsaf local 100 aflcio shall contribute ten and onehalf percent of the members individual compensation to the retirement system effective    and five percent thereafter for members hired prior to  for members hired on or after  the member contribution to the retirement system shall be three percent of the members individual compensation b the officer responsible for making up the payroll shall cause the contributions provided in this section to be deducted from the compensation of each member on each and every payroll for each and every payroll period so long as the member is a member of the retirement system the members contributions shall be made notwithstanding that the minimum compensation provided by law for any member shall be changed thereby every member shall be deemed to consent and agree to the deductions made and provided in this section each of such amounts shall be deducted and when deducted shall be paid to the retirement system and shall be credited to the members accumulated contributions c notwithstanding any section in this article any member may contribute to a voluntary deferred compensation irc section 457 plan in addition to participating in this retirement system      311995   5201998   9151999   1012003   4212004   2162005   8152007   9162009   9212011 city contribution fund  city contributions a the financial objective of this article is to provide for annual city contributions which expressed as percents of member payroll will remain approximately level from generation to generation of city taxpayers such contribution rates shall be sufficient together with member contributions to 1 fully cover the value of benefit commitments being made to members for their service being rendered in the current year  and 2 to fully cover the unfunded value of benefit commitments for service rendered prior to the current year over a period of not more than 30 future years b the city contribution amount shall be determined within the objective of subsection a of this section by annual actuarial valuations based on such mortality and other tables of experience and regular interest as the board shall adopt the city contributions so determined shall be certified to the city by the board and shall be appropriated and paid to the retirement system      9151999 investment of assets the board shall be the trustees of the assets of the retirement system and shall have full and unrestricted discretionary power and authority to invest and reinvest the assets of the system the board shall have full and unrestricted discretionary power and authority to hold sell assign transfer or otherwise dispose of any securities and investments in which any monies of the retirement system have been invested as well as the proceeds of such investments and monies belonging to the retirement system and may delegate this authority to one or more investment managers who shall acknowledge in writing that they are named fiduciaries with respect to the retirement system within the meaning of fs   and who shall invest the retirement systems assets in accordance with this article applicable federal and state laws and regulations and investment guidelines adopted by the board the board shall identify and publicly report any direct or indirect holdings it may have in any scrutinized company as defined in fs   and proceed to sell redeem divest or withdraw all publicly traded securities it may have in such company beginning  and shall thereafter be prohibited from purchasing or holding such securities the divestiture of any such security must be completed by  in accordance with ch 200997 laws of florida no person may bring any civil criminal or administrative action against the board or any employee officer director or advisor of such board based upon the divestiture of any security pursuant to this paragraph within the limitation of such standard investments may be made in specifically including but not by way of limitation obligations of the united states government and in obligations guaranteed as to principal and interest by the united states government in corporate notes bonds or debentures convertible or otherwise in equipment trust certificates and in loans secured by first mortgages or deeds of trust on real property and such investments may be made without limitation as to the percentage of the book value of the assets so invested investments may also be made in either common or preferred corporate stocks in no event shall more than five percent of the assets of the retirement system be invested in the securities of any one corporation nor shall the retirement system acquire or hold more than five percent of the outstanding stock or bonds of any one corporation      9151999   5192010 assets not segregated all assets of the retirement system shall be held in an irrevocable trust which is hereby created for the sole purpose of meeting disbursements for pensions and other payments authorized by the board pursuant to this article and shall be used for no other purpose      9151999 allowance of regular interest the board shall at the end of each fiscal year allow and credit regular interest to the members accumulated contributions      9151999 method of making payments all payments from monies of the retirement system shall be made by the finance director or by a custodian or funding agent designated by the board such payments shall be made only upon the written authority signed by two persons designated by the board a duly attested copy of a resolution designating such persons and bearing upon its face specimen signatures of such persons shall be filed with the finance director or the funding agent no such written authority to make payments from the monies of the system shall be executed unless the payments shall have been previously authorized by a specific or continuing resolution adopted by the board      9151999 assignments prohibited the right of a person to a pension to the return of accumulated contributions the pension itself any optional benefit any other right accrued or accruing to any person under this article and the monies belonging to the retirement system shall not be subject to execution garnishment attachment the operation of bankruptcy or insolvency law or any other process of law whatsoever and shall be unassignable except as is specifically provided in this article provided that the city shall have the right of setoff for any claim arising from embezzlement by or fraud of a member retirant or beneficiary      9151999 insurance coverage if a member of the retirement system is covered under a group insurance or prepayment plan participated in by the city and should be permitted to and elect to continue such coverage as a retirant the member may authorize the board to have deducted from any pension the payments required to continue coverage under such group insurance or prepayment plan which the system shall transmit on the members behalf to the city or its designee      9151999 errors should the board determine that any person is receiving from the retirement system more or less than they are entitled to receive the board shall correct such error and as far as practicable shall adjust the payment in such manner that the actuarial equivalent of the benefit to which the person was correctly entitled shall be paid      9151999 former plan minimum  offset a any section of this article to the contrary notwithstanding in no event shall the amount of level straight life pension of a retirant who was a participant in the former plan on  and who became a member of this system effective  be less than the amount of pension to which the retirant would have been entitled under the former plan had the retirant continued to be covered by such former plan at the 1972 rate of covered compensation b any section of this article to the contrary notwithstanding if a member or retirant or beneficiary is paid a benefit from a former plan the amount of any pension payable by this system shall be reduced by the amount of such former plan benefit      9151999 internal revenue the city intends the pension fund to be a qualified plan under section 401 of the internal revenue as amended and that the trust be an exempt organization under section 501 of the internal revenue board of trustees shall administer the pension fund so as to fulfill this intent including but not limited to the following a in the event the pension fund should terminate or contributions to the system were completely discontinued the rights of all employees to benefits accrued to the date of such termination or discontinuance shall not be forfeited the board shall determine the date of distribution and the asset value required to fund all nonforfeitable benefits after taking into account the expenses of such distribution the board shall inform the city or then current plan sponsor if additional assets are required in which event the city or then current plan sponsor shall continue to financially support the pension plan until all nonforfeitable benefits have been funded b maximum pension notwithstanding any provision of this plan to the contrary the annual pension that is accrued by or paid to a participant shall not exceed the dollar limitation set forth below if the benefit the participant would otherwise accrue in a limitation year would produce an annual pension in excess of the dollar limitation the benefit shall be limited to a benefit that does not exceed the dollar limitation 1 definitions used in this section annual pension means the benefits received by a participant under this plan expressed in the form of a straight life annuity in determining whether benefits payable exceed the dollar limitation set forth below benefits payable in any form other than a straight life annuity shall be adjusted to the larger of a the annual amount of the straight life annuity if any payable to the participant under the plan commencing at the same annuity starting date as the form of benefit payable to the participant  or b the annual amount of the straight life annuity commencing at the same annuity starting date that has the same actuarial present value as the form of benefit payable to the participant computed using a 5 percent interest assumption and the applicable mortality table described in  e1d2 of the internal revenue irc for that annuity starting date no actuarial adjustment to the benefit shall be made for benefits that are not directly related to retirement benefits such as a qualified disability benefit preretirement incidental death benefits and postretirement medical benefits  or the inclusion in the form of benefit of an automatic benefit increase feature provided the form of benefit is not subject to  417e3 of the irc and would otherwise satisfy the limitations of this section and the amount payable under the form of benefit in any limitation year shall not exceed the limits of this section applicable at the annuity starting date as increased in subsequent years pursuant to  415d of the irc for this purpose an automatic benefit increase feature is included in a form of benefit if the form of benefit provides for automatic periodic increases to the benefits paid in that form dollar limitation means $16000000 subject to the annual adjustments provided under d of the irc said amount shall be adjusted based on the age of the participant when benefits begin as follows a except with respect to a participant who is a qualified participant as defined in b2h of the irc for benefits except survivor and disability benefits as defined in b2i of the irc beginning before age 62 the ageadjusted dollar limitation is equal to the lesser of 1 the actuarial equivalent of the annual amount of a straight life annuity commencing at the annuity starting date that has the same actuarial present value as a deferred straight life annuity commencing at age 62 where annual payments under the straight life annuity commencing at age 62 are equal to the dollar limitation as adjusted pursuant to section 415d of the irc for the limitation year and where the actuarially equivalent straight life commencing straight life annuity means the annual amount of the immediately commencing straight life annuity payable to the participant computed disregarding the participants accruals after age 65 but including actuarial adjustments even if those actuarial adjustments are applied to offset accruals for this purpose the annual amount of the immediately commencing straight life annuity is determined without applying the rules of section 415 of the irc the adjusted age 65 straight life annuity means the annual amount of the straight life annuity that would be payable under the plan to a hypothetical participant who is 65 years old and has the same accrued benefit with no actuarial increases for commencement after age 65 as the participant receiving the distribution determined disregarding the participants accruals after age 65 and without applying the rules of section 415 of the irc 3 there shall be no age adjustment of the dollar limitation with respect to benefits beginning between the ages of 62 and 65 2 the limitations set forth in this section shall not apply if the annual pension does not exceed $1000000 provided the participant has never participated in a defined contribution plan maintained by the city 3 costofliving adjustments in the dollar limitation for benefits shall be limited to scheduled annual increases determined by the secretary of the treasury under subsection 415d of the irc 4 in the case of a participant who has fewer than ten years of participation in the plan the dollar limitation set forth in this section shall be multiplied by a fraction i the numerator of which is the number of years or part thereof of participation in the plan and ii the denominator of which is ten 5 any portion of a participants benefit that is attributable to mandatory employee contributions unless pickedup by the city or rollover contributions shall be taken into account in the manner prescribed in the regulations under section 415 of the irc 6 should any participant participate in more than one defined benefit plan maintained by the city in any case in which the participants benefits under all such defined benefit plans determined as of the same age would exceed the dollar limitation applicable at that age the accrual of the participants benefit under this plan shall be reduced so that the participants combined benefits will equal the dollar limitation 7 for a participant who has or will have distributions commencing at more than one annuity starting date the annual benefit shall be determined as of each such annuity starting date and shall satisfy the limitations of this section as of each such date actuarially adjusting for past and future distributions of benefits commencing at the other annuity starting dates for this purpose the determination of whether a new starting date has occurred shall be made without regard to  a20 q&a10d and with regard to  b1b1iiib and c of the income tax regulations 8 the determination of the annual pension under this section shall take into account in the manner prescribed by the regulations under of the irc social security supplements described in  411a9 of the irc and benefits provisions of section 415 of the irc as amended so that the maximum benefits provided by plans of the city shall be exactly equal to the maximum amounts allowed under section 415 of the irc and regulations thereunder if there is any discrepancy between the provisions of this section and the provisions of section 415 of the irc and regulations thereunder such discrepancy shall be resolved in such a way as to give full effect to the provisions of section 415 of the irc the value of any benefits forfeited as a result of the application of this section shall be used to decrease future
