participants required beginning date which is defined as the later of 1 april 1 of the calendar year that next follows the calendar year in which the participant attains or will attain the age of 7012 years  or 2 april 1 of the calendar year that next follows the calendar year in which the participant retires d required minimum distributions 1 required beginning date the participants entire begin a if the participant dies before distributions begin the participants entire interest will be distributed or begin to be distributed no later than as follows 1 if the participants surviving spouse is the participants sole designated beneficiary then distributions to the surviving spouse will begin by december 31 of the calendar year immediately following the calendar year in which the participant died or by december 31 of the calendar year in which the participant would have attained age 7012 if later 2 if the participants surviving spouse is not the participants sole designated beneficiary then distributions to the designated beneficiary will begin by december 31 of the calendar year immediately following the calendar year in which the participant died 3 if there is no designated beneficiary as of september 30 of the year following the year of the participants death the participants entire interest will be distributed by december 31 of the calendar year containing the fifth anniversary of the participants death b the participants entire interest shall be distributed as follows 1 participant survived by designated beneficiary if the participant dies before the date distribution of his or her interest begins and there is a designated beneficiary the participants entire interest will be distributed beginning no later than the time described in this section of the year following the year of the participants death distribution of the participants entire interest will be completed by december 31 of the calendar year containing the fifth anniversary of the participants death c death of surviving spouse before distributions to surviving spouse begin in any case in which i the participant dies before the date distribution of his or her interest begins ii the participants surviving spouse is the participants sole designated beneficiary and iii the surviving spouse dies before distributions to the surviving spouse begin subparagraphs 2a and 2b above shall apply as though the surviving spouse were the participant 3 requirements for annuity distributions that commence during participants lifetime a joint life annuities where the beneficiary is not under the uniform lifetime table set forth in a99 of the treasury regulations for the calendar year that contains the annuity starting date if the annuity starting date precedes the year in which the participant reaches age 70 the applicable distribution period for the participant is the distribution period for age 70 under the uniform lifetime table set forth in a99 of the treasury regulations accounts a general annuity requirements if the participants interest is paid in the form of annuity distributions under the plan payments under the annuity will satisfy the following requirements 1 the annuity distributions will be paid in periodic payments made at intervals not longer than one year  2 the distribution period will be over a life or lives or over a period certain not longer than the distribution period described in this section whichever is applicable  3 once payments have begun over a period certain the period certain will not be changed even if the period certain is shorter than the maximum permitted  4 payments will either be nonincreasing or increase only as follows i by an annual percentage increase that does not exceed the annual percentage increase in a costofliving index that is based on prices of all items and issued by the bureau of labor statistics  ii to the extent of the reduction in the amount of the participants payments to provide for a survivor benefit upon death but only if the beneficiary whose life was being used to determine the distribution period dies or is no longer the participants beneficiary pursuant to a qualified domestic relations order within the meaning of section 414p of the irc  iii to provide cash refunds of employee contributions upon the participants death  or iv to pay increased benefits that result from a plan amendment b amount required to be distributed by required beginning date the amount that must be distributed on or before the participants required beginning date or if the participant dies before distributions begin the date distributions are required to begin under this section whichever is applicable is the payment that is required for one payment interval the second payment need not be made until the end of the next payment interval even if that payment interval ends in the next calendar year payment intervals are the periods for which payments are received eg bimonthly monthly semiannually or annually all of the participants benefit accruals as of the last day of the first distribution calendar year will be included in the calculation of the amount of the annuity payments for payment year after the first distribution calendar year will be distributed beginning with the first payment interval ending in the calendar year immediately following the calendar year in which such amount accrues 5 for purposes of this subsection distributions are considered to begin on the participants required beginning date if annuity payments irrevocably commence to the participant or to the section c life expectancy life expectancy as computed by use of the single life table in section a99 of the treasury regulations e eligible rollover distributions 1 notwithstanding any provision of rollover distribution is any distribution of all or any portion of the balance to the credit of the distributee except that an eligible rollover distribution does not include any distribution that is one of a series of substantially equal periodic payments not less frequently than annually made for the life or life expectancy of the distributee or the joint lives or joint life expectancies of the distributee and the distributees designated beneficiary or for a specified period often 10 years or more  any distribution to the extent such distribution is required under section 401a9 of the irc beginning after  the egtrra annual compensation limit is $20000000 as adjusted by the commissioner for increases in the cost of living in accordance with section 401a17b of the irc the costofliving are less than 60 years of age as of  c to be eligible for the early retirement incentive the employee must apply for retirement between  and  and whose last working day must be no later than  d elect to participate in drop window as follows 1 eligibility a member of the system who is not a member of a certified collective bargaining unit and who has attained 30 or more years of credited service may enter into the drop on the first day of june july or august 2005 2 written election a member electing to participate in the drop must complete and execute the proper forms supplied by the system election in the drop is irrevocable once drop payments begin 3 limitation and disqualification for other benefits a member may participate in the drop only once after commencement of participation the employee shall no longer earn or accrue additional years of continuous service and shall not be eligible for disability or preretirement death benefits for purposes of calculating the members retirement benefit the members average monthly earnings in effect at the time the member begins to participate in the drop will be used 4 member contributions upon the effective date of a members commencement of participation in the drop the members contributions to the retirement system shall be deposited into the members drop account 5 benefit calculation for all retirement system purposes the continuous service of a member participating in the drop shall remain as it existed on the effective date of commencement of participation in the drop service thereafter shall not be recognized by the system or used for the calculation or determination of any benefits payable by the system the average monthly earnings of the member shall remain as they existed on the effective date of commencement of participation in the drop earnings or increases in earnings thereafter shall not be recognized by the system or used for the calculation or determination of any benefits payable by the system 6 payments to drop account the monthly retirement benefits that would have been payable had the member elected to cease employment and receive a normal retirement benefit upon commencing participation in the drop shall be paid into the members deferred retirement option account 7 drop account earnings a the members deferred retirement option account shall be credited at a rate equal to the actual net rate of investment return realized by the system from the short term investment fund or money market mutual fund in which the system shall invest the members drop account b a members deferred retirement account shall only be credited with earnings during the members participation in the drop and until payout 8 drop participation limit a member may participate in the drop for 84 months upon entering the drop the member shall irrevocably resign from city employment effective 84 months thereafter although the member may earlier resign at any time during the 84 month drop participation period upon resignation the member shall be shown as retired for city personnel purposes during drop participation the member shall in all other respects be a city employee and subject to all of the obligations and benefits of city employment 9 payout a upon the termination of a members employment for any reason whether by expiration of the maximum drop participation limit retirement resignation discharge disability or death the retirement benefits payable to the member or the members beneficiary if the member selected an optional form of retirement benefit which provides for payments to the beneficiary shall be paid to the member or beneficiary and shall no longer be paid to the members deferred retirement option account b within 120 days following the termination of a members employment the balance in the members drop account shall be paid 1 in full in a single lump sum payment less withholding taxes  2 as a direct trusteetotrustee transfer rollover to another eligible plan  or 3 a combination of the 2 above in case of death or disability the 120day payout deadline may be extended by the systems board of trustees until directions are received from the members guardian or estate regardless of the option selected by the member the board of trustees has the right to accelerate payments in order to comply with section 401a9 of the internal revenue the right to defer payments to comply with section 415 of the irc c balances in a members accounts after deduction of installment payments shall continue to be credited or debited with account earnings until the entire balance is paid out 10 death if a drop member dies before said members balances are paid out in full the participant members designated beneficiary shall have the same rights as the member to elect and receive the payout options set forth in subsection 9 of this section above drop payments to a beneficiary shall be in addition to any retirement benefits payable to the beneficiary under any optional form of retirement benefits elected by the member members who are or have been drop participants are not eligible for preretirement death or disability benefits 11 amendment the city can amend the drop at any time to comply with the internal revenue other federal or state requirements    542005   1032007   642008   10152008 secs 2913129150  reserved savings incentive plan under the provisions of section 401a of the internal revenue certain employees of the city effective as of  b the city had previously established a plan known as the deferred compensation plan also for the purpose of creating a retirement incentive plan under the provisions of section 401a of the internal revenue certain other employees c the defined contribution supplemental retirement plan is now amended to include the applicable provisions of the deferred compensation plan and the employees covered therein and to provide for additional investment options effective as of     311995   9151999 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning accumulated contributions means the value of the separate account established and maintained on behalf of each member which shall consist of such members employee contributions employer contributions and rollover contributions compensation means wages or salary paid within the plan year by the city to a member for personal services including paid holidays vacation pay longevity pay and pay while absent because of illness any amounts withheld from the members compensation pursuant to a cafeteria plan under internal revenue employee contributions that are picked up by a governmental employer under internal revenue h and elective deferrals under an internal revenue b plan or an internal revenue plan compensation shall not include overtime pay special pay over and above regular wages for holidays worked uniform allowances equipment allowances travel allowances severance payments redemption of unused sick leave or unused vacation leave and items of a similar nature in the event of any dispute the plan administrator shall determine whether a payment is compensation for the purposes of this article compensation taken into account under the plan shall be limited as required by internal revenue a17 disability means a members inability to engage in any substantial gainful activity by reason of a medically determinable physical or mental impairment which can be expected to result in death or to be of longcontinued and indefinite duration the permanence and degree of such disablement shall be supported by medical evidence in the event of any dispute the plan administrator shall determine whether a member has satisfied the requirements for disability for the purposes of this article employee contributions means the sum of all amounts deducted from the compensation of a member pursuant to section 29154 and credited to the members individual account together with all earnings credited on funds invested employer contributions means the sum of all amounts deposited by the city on behalf of a member pursuant to section 29154 and credited to the members individual account together with all earnings credited on funds invested accordance with the following 1 provided not excluded under subsection 2 of this section a management employee shall become a member on the date the employee waives participation in any defined benefit pension plan sponsored by the city provided not excluding under subsection 2 of this section a nonmanagement employee shall become a member on the date the employee irrevocably elects to participate in the plan 2 the following employees shall not become members a any person whose service to the city is rendered on a contractual or fee basis  b any person employed in a position normally requiring less than 30 hours work in a week parttime  c any person employed in a position normally requiring less than 6 months work in a year temporary and seasonal  d any person covered by a bargaining agreement between the city and the international association of firefighters and fire lieutenants local 2174 e any person covered by a bargaining agreement between the city and the fraternal order of police collier county lodge no 38 f any person covered by a bargaining agreement between the city and the fraternal order of police supervisors bargaining unit g any nonmanagement employee who has not completed 6 months employment with the city 3 should any member leave the employ of the city such member shall thereupon cease to be a member except for the limited purposes of of membership in the plan 2 50 percent after 2 years of membership in the plan 3 100 percent after 3 years of membership in the plan for purposes of determining vested percentage a member shall be credited with 1 year of membership in accordance with rules established by the plan administrator notwithstanding the above a member shall be 100 percent vested in employer contributions upon employment such forfeitures may be used to pay plan expenses or reduce future employee contributions    311995   9151999 distributions of accumulated contributions a loans loans from the plan shall be of a members benefits will begin the later of either april 1 of the calendar year following the calendar year in which the employee attains age 7012 or april 1 of the calendar year following the method of distribution used as of the date of a members death if distribution of a members benefits had not commenced prior to the members death any portion of benefits payable after the members death shall 1 if payable to the members surviving spouse begin no later than the end of the calendar year following the calendar year in which the member should have attained age 7012  2 if payable to the members designated beneficiary begin no later than the end of the calendar year following the calendar year in which the member died and extend over a period not extending beyond the life expectancy of the beneficiary  or 3 otherwise be distributed within 5 years of the members death d eligible rollover distributions notwithstanding any provision of the plan to the contrary that would otherwise limit a distributees election under this subsection a distributee may elect at the time and in the manner prescribed by the plan administrator to have any portion of an eligible rollover distribution distribution that is one of a series of substantially equal periodic payments not less frequently than annually made for the life or life expectancy of the distributee or the joint lives or joint life expectancies of the distributee and the distributees designated beneficiary or for a period of 10 years or more  any distribution to the extent such distribution is required under internal revenue a9 annuity distributee a distributee includes an employee or former employee in addition the employees or former employees surviving spouse and the employees or former employees spouse or former spouse be the trustee of the assets of the plan and shall enter into a trust agreement with the city describing the city managers duties and responsibilities as trustee except as provided under applicable law no part of the plans assets may be used for or diverted to purposes other than the exclusive benefit of the members of the plan or their beneficiaries prior to the satisfaction of all liabilities with respect to the members and their beneficiaries b investment of assets the plan administrator shall select from time to time investment providers and direct the trustee to enter into agreements with such investment providers provided however that the plan administrator shall not direct the trustee to and the trustee shall not enter into a contract with an investment provider that assesses any fees expenses or other charges against the city or the trust including members accounts within the trust upon any transfer of trust assets from such investment provider to another investment provider the plan administrator shall develop rules and procedures for the investment of trust assets provided such rules and procedures are consistent with the terms of the trust each member shall direct the investment of the members accumulated contributions in accordance with the rules and procedures established by the plan administrator c operation of plan the plan administrator shall be responsible for developing the operating rules and regulations of the plan soliciting and documenting membership in the plan and the periodic reporting to each member of each members funds on deposit and investment results    311995   9151999 qualified plan the city intends the plan to be a qualified plan internal revenue as amended and that the trust established hereunder be an exempt organization under section 501 of the internal revenue plan administrator shall administer the plan and the trustee shall administer the trust so as to fulfill this intent including but not limited to the requirement that in the event the plan should terminate or contributions to the system are completely discontinued the rights to the extent then funded of all employees to benefits accrued to the date of such termination or discontinuance shall not be forfeited  311995   9151999 secs 2915929190  reserved article iv  firefighters pension and retirement system footnotes  4  state law reference actuarial soundness of local government pensions fs  11260 et seq  municipal firefighters pensions fund fs ch 175 division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning actuarial equivalence or actuarially equivalent means that any benefit payable under the terms of this trust fund in a form other than the normal form of benefit shall have the same actuarial present value on the date payment commences as the normal form of benefit the determination of the actuarial present value of any form of benefit including lump sum distributions shall be based on 1 the rp2000 static mortality table h unisex 5050 for healthy lives projected to 2010 for healthy participants and the rp2000 static mortality table d unisex 5050 projected to 2010 for disabled participants  and 2 the interest discount of 75 percent per annum compounded annually credited service means that period of continuous employment with the city as a firefighter for which the firefighter receives compensation or is entitled to compensation from the date of employment to the date of termination time spent in military service of the united states by the firefighter will be credited provided the firefighter reenters the service of the city as a firefighter within the time period provided by state and federal law after date of release from such military service and returns to the retirement trust fund all amounts the firefighter might have withdrawn therefrom at the time the firefighter entered or while in such armed service during the period of such armed service and until reemployment by the city contributions to the retirement trust fund shall be waived and no payment of such contributions shall be required final average compensation means the final average monthly compensation of the firefighter for the period of the highest three consecutive years of contributing service preceding retirement or the career average as firefighter whichever is greater notwithstanding the preceding sentence effective  final average compensation means the final average monthly compensation of the firefighter for the period of the highest five years of the final ten years preceding retirement or termination of employment or the career average as a firefighter  provided in no event shall the final average compensation of any firefighter who is employed on  be less than the final average compensation determined in accordance with the preceding sentence as of that date firefighter means a fulltime state certified firefighter employed by the city as a member of the citys firerescue department including the chief of the firerescue department the assistant chief and other firefighters of the firerescue department who are state certified as firefighters prior service credit means a member may purchase service credit for service in the armed forces of the united states the united states merchant marine or service as a firefighter for the city or for any employer prior to employment by the city by depositing into the trust fund the full actuarial costs of such service credit that would have occurred had the member been employed by the city as a firefighter for the period of service credit purchased such payment for said service credit may be made as a lump sum or by payroll deductions not to extend beyond three years according to a schedule approved by the board of trustees payroll deduction payments shall require interest at the actuarial rate of return for the years purchased such purchase of service credit shall take effect upon attaining five years of credited service in the pension plan if a member terminates service prior to attaining five years of credited service and receives a refund of member contributions the amount paid for such prior service credit shall also be refunded subject to the following 1 prior service credit shall not be granted for service where the member is receiving or is entitled to receive a benefit from another governmental pension system 2 prior service credit under this section shall only be provided for service as a firefighter as defined in fs ch 175 with any firefighter service andor for service in the armed forces of the united states or the united states merchant marine voluntary or involuntary in accordance with fs ch 175 3 in determining prior service credit of any member for firefighter service or united states armed forces and merchant marine service service credit of up to four years shall be added to the years of actual service with the city 4 election to purchase credited service for prior service with the city prior service with any other firefighter agency or prior service in the united states armed forces or merchant marine shall be made in writing to the board of trustees the cost of credited service purchased for such prior service shall be the full actuarial cost of all credited service purchased hereunder computed as a lump sum payment into the plan actual payment may at the members option be extended over a period of time not to exceed three years and shall be subject to interest at the actuarial rate of return for the years purchased such payment may be by direct inservice transfer from a firefighters deferred compensation account 457 accounts pursuant to section 457e17 of the internal revenue payment of such purchased credited service must be completed prior to the members actual retirement salary means the base cash remuneration paid to the firefighter for services rendered exclusive of overtime pay holiday pay and fringe benefits for the purpose of applying the limitations set forth in sections 401a17 and 415 of the internal revenue irc compensation shall include any elective deferral as defined in code section 402g3 of the irc and any amount which is contributed or deferred by the employer at the election of the member and which is not includible in the gross income of the member by reason of sections 125 or 457 of the irc for limitation years beginning on and after  for the purposes of applying the limitations described in subsection a of section 29242 hereof compensation paid or made available during such limitation years shall include elective amounts that are not includible in the gross income of the member by reason of section 132f4 of the irc      9151999   9182002   312006   5192010   11172010   5222013  cross reference definitions generally  12 trust fund created there is created an irrevocable trust fund to be known as the city of naples firefighters retirement trust fund exclusively for the purposes provided in this article      9151999 maintenance of fund the retirement trust fund created in section 29192 shall be maintained in the following manner 1 by the net proceeds of excise or license tax which may be imposed by the city pursuant to law upon fire insurance companies on their gross receipts of premiums from holders of policies which policies cover property within the corporate limits of the city effective  the city and the union representing city firefighters have mutually agreed that all premium tax revenues received pursuant to fs ch 175 shall be used to offset the citys contributions to the trust fund 2 by five percent of the salary of each firefighter which shall be deducted by the city and paid over to the board of trustees of the retirement trust fund unless otherwise stated herein 3 by all gifts bequests and devises when donated for the fund 4 by all accretions to the fund by way of investment earnings 5 by all other sources of income authorized by law for the augmentation of such firefighters retirement trust fund      2 1131993   9151999   1012003   4212004   312006   8152007   1 522018 secs 2919429210  reserved division 2  board of trustees footnotes  5  cross reference boards and commissions  2401 et seq  appointments of staff members to boards and commissions of the city by the city manager  2407  board of trustees  29291 et seq creation  organization a there is created a board of trustees of the city firefighters retirement trust fund which shall be solely responsible for administering and operating the trust fund b the board of trustees shall consist of five members two of whom unless otherwise prohibited by law shall be legal residents of the city who shall be appointed by the city council and two of whom shall be firefighters as defined in fs  8a who shall be elected by a majority of the firefighters who are members of the pension plan the fifth member shall be chosen by a majority of the previous four members and such persons name shall be submitted to the city council upon receipt of the fifth persons name the city council shall as a ministerial duty appoint such person to the board of trustees as its fifth member the fifth member shall serve as trustee for a period of two years shall have the same rights as each of the other four members appointed or elected as provided in this section and may succeed themselves in office each resident member shall serve as trustee for a period of two years unless sooner replaced by the city council at whose pleasure they shall serve and may succeed themselves as trustee each firefighter member shall serve as trustee for a period of two years unless the member sooner leaves the employment of the city as a firefighter whereupon the members successor shall be chosen to fill the unexpired term in the same manner as an original appointment each firefighter may succeed themselves in office c the board of trustees shall meet at least quarterly each year d each board of trustees shall be a legal entity with in addition to other powers and responsibilities contained in this article the power to bring and defend lawsuits of every kind nature and description e the trustees shall by majority vote elect from its members a chairman and a secretary the secretary of the board shall keep a complete minute book of the actions proceedings or hearings of the board the secretary of the board shall also keep a record of all persons receiving pension payments under the provisions of this division which shall note the time when the pension was approved and when the pension shall cease this record shall include a list of all firefighters employed by the city showing the name address time of employment by the city and when they cease to be employed by the city f the board of trustees of the retirement system shall hold meetings regularly at least once in each calendar quarter and shall designate the time and place thereof it shall adopt its own rules of procedure and shall keep a record of its proceedings all meetings of the board shall be open to the public the trustees shall serve without compensation for their services as trustees but shall be entitled to reimbursement of reasonable and necessary expenses incurred subject to maximum amount and procedures established by the board g notwithstanding any other section of this but subject to any provisions of the florida constitution or general law members of this board shall be permitted to serve on any other board duly formed by the city h members of the board of trustees shall discharge all duties 1 solely in the interest of the participants and beneficiaries of the trust fund  2 for the exclusive purpose of providing benefits to participants and beneficiaries  3 with the care skill prudence and diligence that a prudent person acting in a like capacity and familiar with such matters would use in the conduct of an enterprise of a like character with like goals  4 by diversifying investments of the trust fund in a manner that minimizes the risk of large losses unless under the circumstances it is clearly not prudent to do so  and in accordance with documents instruments ordinances and statutes governing the trust fund a      9151999   4212004 powers the board of trustees established in section 29211 may in its discretion exercise any or all of the following powers 1 the board shall be the trustees of the assets of the retirement trust fund and shall have full and unrestricted discretionary power and authority to invest and reinvest the assets of the trust fund without regard to the limitations except as to foreign securities of fs ch 175 the board shall have full and unrestricted discretionary power and authority to hold sell assign transfer or otherwise dispose of any securities and investments in which any monies of the retirement trust fund have been invested as well as the proceeds of such investments and monies belonging to the retirement trust fund and may delegate this authority to one or more investment managers who shall acknowledge in writing that they are named fiduciaries with respect to the retirement trust fund within the meaning of fs   and who shall invest the retirement trust funds assets in accordance with this article applicable federal and state laws and regulations and investment guidelines adopted by the board the board shall identify and publicly report any direct or indirect holdings it may have in any scrutinized company as defined in fs   and proceed to sell redeem divest or withdraw all publicly traded securities it may have in such company beginning  and shall thereafter be prohibited from purchasing or holding such securities the divestiture of any such security must be completed by  in accordance with ch 200997 laws of florida no person may bring any civil criminal or administrative action against the board or any employee officer director or advisor of such board based upon the divestiture of any security pursuant to this paragraph 2 all payments from monies of the retirement trust fund shall be made by the finance director or by a custodian or funding agent designated by the board such payments shall be made only upon the written authority signed by two persons designated by the board a duly attested copy of a resolution designating such persons and bearing upon its face specimen signatures of such persons shall be filed with the finance director custodian or the funding agent no such written authority to make payments from the monies of the trust fund shall be executed unless the payments shall have been previously authorized by a specific or continuing resolution adopted by the board 3 any and all acts and decisions shall be by a majority of the board 4 finally decide all claims for benefits under the boards rules and regulations pursuant to this article 5 the board shall keep a complete record of all receipts and disbursements and of the boards acts and proceedings 6 the general administration of and the responsibilities for the proper operation of the retirement trust fund and for making effective this article are vested in the board of trustees who may employ such independent professional technical or other advisers it deems necessary at the trust funds expense the board of trustees shall keep in convenient form such data as shall be necessary for an actuarial valuation of the retirement trust fund for checking the actual experience of the fund at least once every three years the board of trustees shall retain a professionally qualified as defined in fs ch 175 independent consultant to evaluate the performance of existing professional money managers and make recommendations regarding the selection of money managers for the next investment term such recommendations shall be considered by the board of trustees at its next regularly scheduled meeting which shall be advertised in the same manner as for any meeting of the board of trustees b     9151999   5192010 secs 2921329230  reserved division 3  membership and benefits contributions the retirement trust fund created in section 29231 shall be maintained in the following manner 1 contributions to the firefighters pension and retirement trust fund shall be deducted in the amount of five percent from the salary of each firefighter hired prior to  and three percent from the salary of each firefighter hired on or after  so long as such firefighter shall be employed by the city any firefighter who enters the service of the city after the effective date of the ordinance from which this section derives shall be required to participate in the plan as a condition of employment except for firefighters first entering service of the city at the rank of fire chief who upon appointment to that position may make an election to participate in this plan or another retirement plan which does not require a greater contribution by the city  provided however any officer who elects to participate in any other pension plan shall not be entitled to receive any benefit under fs ch 175 for any service rendered while a participant in such other pension plan notwithstanding any section in this article any firefighter may contribute to a voluntary deferred compensation irc section 457 plan and may if eligible participate in the defined contribution supplemental retirement plan established by article iii division 4 of this chapter in addition to participating in this plan if the employer agrees to assume and pay member contribution in lieu of direct contributions by the member such contributions shall accordingly be paid into the fund in behalf of the members no member subject to such agreement shall have the option of choosing to receive the contributed amounts directly instead of having them paid by the employer directly to the fund all such contributions by the employer shall be deemed and considered as part of the members accumulated contributions and subject to all sections of this plan pertaining to accumulated contributions of members the intent of this language is to comply with section 414h2 of the internal revenue      1131993   3181998   9151999   8152007   922009   2 5222013   1 1252018 requirements for retirement 1 the normal retirement date of each firefighter hired prior to  will be the first day of the month coincident with or next following the date on which the firefighter has attained the age of 55 years or attained the age of 50 years with 20 years of credited service or who has completed 25 years of credited service and retires subsequent to  each member shall be 100percent vested in accrued benefit upon attainment of normal retirement date the normal retirement date for firefighters hired on or after  will be the first day of the month coincident with or next following the date on which the firefighter has attained age 55 with eight years of credited service or completed 25 years of credited service regardless of age 2 notwithstanding any other provision of this article effective  the accrued benefits of all firefighters who on that date are employed and have not attained age 55 or age 50 with 20 years of credited service or completed 25 years of credited service as of  shall be frozen such firefighters shall be fully vested in their frozen accrued benefit based on final average compensation and credited service as of  the base monthly retirement income of such firefighters shall be payable in two parts 1 the frozen accrued benefit based on credited service final average compensation and plan provisions as of   and 2 the accrued benefit based on credited service final average compensation and plan provisions on and after  3 the amount of the base monthly retirement income payable to a firefighter who retires before  on or after normal retirement date shall be an amount equal to the number of years and fractions thereof of credited service multiplied by three percent of final average compensation to a maximum of 75 percent the amount of the base monthly retirement income for normal retirement benefits payable to a firefighter who has credited service after  and retires on or after  shall be an amount equal to the number of the firefighters years and fractions thereof of credited service multiplied by four percent of average final compensation notwithstanding any other provision of this subsection 3 for credited service on and after  the amount of the base monthly retirement income payable to a firefighter after the normal retirement date shall be an amount equal to the number of years and fractions thereof of such credited service multiplied by three percent of final average compensation  provided any firefighter who is employed on  and as of that date has attained age 55 or age 50 with 20 years of credited service or has completed 25 years of credited service will continue to accrue benefits in accordance with the preceding sentence in no event shall the combined monthly retirement income payable to a firefighter pursuant to the preceding two sentences exceed 100 percent of average final compensation the maximums above shall not apply to any scheduled periodic or onetime costofliving benefit increases 4 the monthly retirement income payable for normal retirement will be payable on the first day of each month the first payment will be made on the firefighters normal retirement date or on the first day of the month coincident with or next following actual retirement if later and the last payment will be the payment due next preceding the firefighters death  except that if the firefighter dies after retirement but before the firefighter has received retirement benefits for a period of ten years the same monthly benefit to which the firefighter would have been entitled will be paid to the beneficiary as designated by the firefighter for a balance of such tenyear period or if no designated beneficiary is surviving then such payment shall be made in accordance with subsection 29238b if the firefighter continues in the service of the city beyond normal retirement date and dies prior to the date of actual retirement monthly retirement income payments will be made for a period of ten years to a beneficiary designated by the firefighter as if the firefighter had retired on the date on which death occurred or if no designated beneficiary is surviving then such payment shall be made in accordance with subsection 29238b 5 early retirement is retirement from the service of the city with the consent of the board of trustees as of the first day of any calendar month which is prior to the firefighters normal retirement date but subsequent to the date as of which the firefighter has attained the age of 50 for early retirement payment of retirement income will be governed as follows a the early retirement date shall be the first day of the calendar month coincident with or immediately following the date a firefighter retires from the service of the city under this section prior to normal retirement date b the monthly amount of retirement income payable to a firefighter who retires prior to normal retirement date under this section shall be an amount computed as described in subsections 2 and 3 of this section such amount of retirement income to be actuarially reduced to take into account the firefighters younger age and the earlier commencement of retirement income payments the actuarial reduction shall be equal to 025 percent per month for each month that early retirement precedes normal retirement for purposes of calculating the actuarial reduction normal retirement shall mean for firefighters hired prior to  the earlier of attaining the age of 55 or the date of completion of 20 years credited service with a minimum age of 50  and for firefighters hired on or after  the earlier of attaining age 55 with eight years of credited service or the date of completion of 25 years of credited service regardless of age c the retirement income payable for the early retirement will be payable on the first day of each month the first payment will be made on the firefighters early retirement date and the last payment will be the payment due next preceding the retired firefighters death except that if the firefighter dies before the firefighter has received retirement benefits for a period of ten years the same monthly benefit to which the firefighter would have been entitled will be paid to the beneficiary designated by the firefighter for the balance of such tenyear period or if no designated beneficiary is surviving the same monthly benefit for the balance of such tenyear period shall be payable to the person as set forth in section 29238b 6 deferred retirement is retirement from the service of the city as of the first day of any calendar month subsequent to the firefighters normal retirement date for deferred retirement payment of retirement income will be governed as follows a the deferred retirement date shall be the first day of the calendar month coincident with or next following the date a firefighter retires from the service of the city under this section b the monthly amount of retirement income payable to a firefighter who retires subsequent to normal retirement date under this section shall be an amount computed as described in subsections 1 2 and 3 of this section c the retirement income payable for deferred retirement will be payable on the first day of each month the first payment will be made on the firefighters deferred retirement date and the last payment will be the payment due next preceding the retired firefighters death except that if the firefighter dies before the firefighter has received retirement benefits for a period of ten years the same monthly benefit to which the firefighter would have been entitled will be paid to the beneficiary designated by the firefighter for the balance of such tenyear period or if no designated beneficiary is surviving such benefit shall be payable as provided in section 29238b 7 the pension formula and benefits provided for in this section and the boards recommendations for improvement thereto shall be reviewed in every oddnumbered year to determine whether changes in the cost of living indicate the need for revision to the pension plan for active or retired firefighters or both 8 in no event may a members retirement benefit be delayed beyond the later of the april 1 following the calendar year in which a member attains age 7012 or april 1 of the year following the calendar year in which a member retires distributions under this plan will be made in accordance with regulations under internal revenue a9 including the minimum distribution incidental benefit 922009   1132010   5222013  optional forms of retirement income a in lieu of the amount and form of retirement income payable for normal early or deferred retirement as specified in section 29232 a firefighter upon written request to the board of trustees and subject to the approval of the board of trustees may elect to receive a retirement income or benefit of equivalent actuarial value payable in accordance with one of the following options 1 a retirement income of larger monthly amount payable to the firefighter for lifetime only 2 a retirement income of a modified monthly amount payable to the firefighter during the joint lifetime of the firefighter and a joint pensioner designated by the firefighter and beginning on  following the death of the firefighter 100 percent 75 66 23 percent or 50 percent of such monthly amount payable to the survivor for the lifetime of the survivor 3 such other amount and form of retirement payments or benefit as the board of trustees in its sole discretion may approve the board reserves the right to require the retiring firefighter to pay the cost of actuarial services for computing an alternate benefit requested by the retiring firefighter 4 no form of benefit shall be permitted unless the present value of payment to be made to the participant is more than 50 percent of the present value of total payment to be made to the participant and the participants beneficiaries b if a firefighter has elected an option with a joint pensioner and retirement income benefits have commenced the firefighter may thereafter change designated joint pensioner up to two times as provided in fs   without the approval of the board of trustees or the current joint annuitant or beneficiary the member need not provide proof of the good health of the joint annuitant or beneficiary being removed and the joint annuitant or beneficiary being removed need not be living the amount of the retirement income payable to the member upon designation of a new joint annuitant shall be actuarially redetermined by the application of actuarial tables and calculations to ensure that the benefit paid is the actuarial equivalent of the present value of the members current benefit and that there is no impact to the plan      9151999   6 312006   8152007   4 5192010 disability retirement a a firefighter may retire from the service of the city under this section if prior to normal retirement date the firefighter becomes totally and permanently disabled as defined in subsection b of this section because of any cause other than a cause set out in subsection c of this section on or after the effective date of the plan such retirement shall be referred to in this section as disability retirement b a firefighter will be considered totally disabled if in the opinion of the board of trustees a firefighter is wholly prevented from rendering useful and efficient service as a firefighter and a firefighter will be considered permanently disabled if in the opinion of the board of trustees such firefighter is likely to remain so disabled continuously and permanently from a cause other than as specified in subsection c of this section c a firefighter will not be entitled to receive any disability retirement income if the disability is a result of 1 excessive and habitual use by the firefighter of drugs intoxicants or narcotics  2 injury or disease sustained by the firefighter while willfully and illegally participating in fights riots civil insurrection or while committing a crime  or 3 injury or disease sustained by the firefighter while serving in any armed forces d no firefighter shall be permitted to retire under this section until examined by duly qualified physicians psychologists andor other medical vocational and rehabilitation professionals to be selected by the board of trustees for that purpose and found to be disabled in the degree and in the manner specified in this section any firefighter retiring under this section shall be examined periodically by a duly qualified physician to be selected by the board of trustees for that purpose to determine if such disability has ceased to exist the physicians psychologists andor other medical vocational and rehabilitation professionals determinations hereunder shall not be binding e the monthly amount of retirement income payable to a firefighter who retires prior to normal retirement date under this section shall be an amount computed as described in section 29233b taking into account credited service to date of disability and final average compensation as of such date the full accrued benefit with no actuarial reduction will be paid no supplemental benefit as described in section 29233c shall be paid in connection with or as part of the disability retirement benefits f the monthly retirement income to which a firefighter is entitled for disability retirement will be payable on the first day of each month the first payment will be made on the first day of the month following the date the board of trustees approved the payment of such retirement income when the first payment is made however it will include benefits retroactive to the first day of disability the last payment will be if the firefighter recovers from the disability prior to normal retirement date the payment due next preceding the date of such recovery or if the firefighter dies without recovering from disability the payment due next preceding the firefighters death or the 120th monthly payment whichever is later any monthly retirement income payments due after the death of a disabled firefighter shall be paid to the beneficiary or if no beneficiary is surviving to the person provided in section 29238b g if the board of trustees finds that a firefighter who is receiving a disability retirement income is at any time prior to normal retirement date no longer disabled as provided in this section the board of trustees shall direct that the disability retirement income be discontinued recovery from disability as used in this subsection means the ability of the firefighter to render useful and efficient service as a firefighter h if a firefighter recovers from disability and reenters city employment as a firefighter service will be deemed to have been continuous for the purpose of computing normal and deferred retirement or death benefits but the period beginning with the first month for which the firefighter received a disability retirement income payment and ending with the date the firefighter reentered the service will not be considered as credited service for the purpose of this plan i any disability benefits payable to a firefighter at time of retirement shall be limited to an amount which when combined with appropriate federal government benefits will not exceed the salary paid to the firefighter at the time of the occurrence of disability j any firefighter who shall retire from the service of the city under this section as a result of a line of duty disability shall receive a minimum benefit equal to 42 percent of final average compensation and if as a result of a nonline of duty disability a minimum benefit equal to 25 percent of final average compensation k any permanent disability as defined in this section which is the result of or caused by tuberculosis hepatitis meningococcal meningitis hypertension heart disease or hardening of the arteries shall be presumed to have been incurred in the line of duty unless the contrary is shown by competent evidence or unless a physical examination of the member conducted upon initial hiring by the city revealed the existence of such condition at that time and provided that a firefighter claiming disability due to tuberculosis or meningococcal meningitis provides the affidavit required by fs  2      9151999 separation from municipal service  refunds a should any firefighter leave the service of the city prior to  before accumulating five years of credited service and before being eligible to retire under this article such firefighter shall be entitled to a refund of all of the firefighters contributions made to the firefighters retirement trust fund with interest at the rate of five and onehalf percent per annum less 12 of any disability payments made to the firefighter b should any firefighter who separates from city service prior to  with at least five years of credited service and has contributed to the firefighters retirement trust fund for at least five years elect to leave the firefighters accrued contributions in the firefighters retirement trust fund such firefighter upon attaining age 50 years or more may retire based upon the benefit level credited service and final average compensation which existed at the time of the firefighters separation c any firefighter who is employed on  and separates from city service after that date with less than eight years of credited service and has contributed to the firefighters retirement trust fund for less than eight years may elect to receive the frozen accrued benefit based on credited service final average compensation and plan provisions as of  upon attaining age 50  and a refund of all of the firefighters contributions made to the firefighters retirement trust fund on and after  with interest at the rate of five and onehalf percent per annum less 12 of any disability payments made to the firefighter in lieu of the frozen accrued benefit such firefighter may elect to receive a payment equal to the greater of the firefighters contributions made to the firefighters retirement trust fund prior to  or the actuarial present value of the frozen accrued benefit based on credited service final average compensation and plan provisions as of  d should any firefighter hired on or after  leave the service of the city before accumulating eight years of credited service and before being eligible to retire under this article such firefighter shall be entitled to a refund of all of the firefighters contributions made to the firefighters retirement trust fund with interest at the rate of five and onehalf percent per annum less 12 of any disability payments made to the firefighter e should any firefighter hired on or after  separate from city service with at least eight years of credited service and has contributed to the firefighters retirement trust fund for at least eight years elect to leave the firefighters accrued contributions in the firefighters retirement trust fund such firefighter upon attaining age 50 years or more may retire based upon the benefit level credited service and final average compensation which existed at the time of the firefighters separation f any forfeitures arising shall be applied to reduce future contributions to the plan no forfeited amount shall be applied to change benefit amounts for members      9151999   5222013  lump sum payment of small retirement income notwithstanding any section of this article to the contrary if the monthly retirement income payable to any person entitled to benefits under this article is $25000 or less or if the single sum of the accrued retirement income is less than $500000 as of the date of retirement or termination of service whichever is applicable the board of trustees in its sole discretion may specify that the actuarial equivalent of such retirement income be paid in a lump sum      9151999 death benefits a should any firefighter die prior to the earlier of the commencement of retirement benefits or normal retirement date refund of 100 percent with interest at the rate of 512 percent of the contributions made to the retirement trust fund by such deceased firefighter shall be paid to the beneficiary or if no designated beneficiary is surviving to the person as set forth in section 29238b b if a firefighter has completed at least 5 years of credited service at the time of the firefighters death the beneficiary or if no designated beneficiary is surviving the person as set forth in section 29238b shall have the option to elect a monthly benefit in lieu of the benefit outlined in subsection a of this section if such an election is made the benefit will commence on the first day of the month following the date of the firefighters death the monthly amount of the benefit shall be an amount computed as described in section 29233a2 with the recipient considered as a 100 percent joint pensioner taking into account credited service to the date of the firefighters death and final average compensation as of such date the benefit shall be actuarially adjusted to reflect the early commencement of the benefit and the age of the recipient of the benefits and shall be paid for the life of the recipient  however should the recipient die before receiving payments for 10 years the balance of the 10year certain benefit shall be paid to the recipients designated beneficiary      9151999 beneficiaries a each firefighter may on a form provided for that purpose signed and filed with the board of trustees designate a beneficiary to receive the benefit if any which may be payable for the firefighters death and each designation may be revoked by such firefighter by signing and filing with the board of trustees a new designation of beneficiary form b if there is no designated beneficiary living at the death of the firefighter when any benefit under this article shall be payable to a beneficiary such benefit shall be payable to the firefighters executors or administrators provided that the board of trustees may at its option but without any obligation to do so pay such benefit as follows to the firefighters wife or husband if living  if not living to the firefighters surviving children equally  if none survives to the firefighters surviving parents equally  if neither survives to the firefighters executors or administrators any survivors share however may be paid to such adult or institution as has in the boards opinion assumed the custody and principal care of such survivor provided that no such payment shall be made after a legal guardian of the property of such survivor shall have been appointed and the board shall have received due notice of such appointment the board reserves the right to assign any of its options rights or elections set forth in this section to any company providing an annuity contract for the benefit of the firefighter or beneficiary any payments made under this section at the option of the board shall not impose any liability whatsoever on the board or any member of the board      9151999 termination of plan upon termination of the firefighters pension and retirement plan for any reason or upon written notice to the board of trustees that contributions under the plan are being permanently discontinued the fund shall be apportioned and distributed in accordance with fs   for the termination or partial termination of this plan each participants accrued pension benefit shall become nonforfeitable ie 100 percent vested the board shall determine the date of distribution and the asset value required to fund all nonforfeitable benefits after taking into account the expenses of such distribution the board shall inform the city or then current plan sponsor if additional assets are required in which event the city or then current plan sponsor shall continue to financially support the pension plan until all nonforfeitable benefits have been funded      9151999   5192010 transfer of funds all assets of the firefighters retirement trust fund established by shall be transferred to the firefighters retirement trust fund created in this article    city attorneys representation of board of trustees the city attorney may give advice to the board of trustees in all matters pertaining to its duties in the administration of the firefighters retirement trust fund whenever requested and may represent and defend the board as its attorney in all suits and actions at law or in equity that may be brought against it and bring all suits or actions in its behalf that may be required or determined by the board however the board of trustees in its discretion may employ its own legal counsel for such purposes at the sole cost and expense of the board and may retain such other independent advisers such as investment advisers actuaries consultants auditors and accountants as it deems necessary if the board of trustees chooses to use the citys legal counsel or actuary or any of the citys other professional technical or other advisers it must do so only under terms and conditions acceptable to the board of trustees      6181997   9151999 internal revenue a maximum pension life annuity if any payable to the participant under the plan commencing at the same annuity starting date as the form of benefit payable to the participant  or b the annual amount of the straight automatic benefit increase feature provided the form of benefit is not subject to  417e3 of the irc and would otherwise satisfy the limitations of this section and the amount payable under the form of benefit in any limitation year shall not exceed the limits of this section applicable at the annuity starting date as increased in subsequent years pursuant to  415d of the irc for this purpose an automatic benefit increase feature is included in a form of benefit if the form of benefit provides for automatic periodic increases to the benefits paid in that form dollar limitation means $16000000 provided the participant has never participated in a defined contribution plan maintained by the city 3 costofliving adjustments in the dollar limitation for benefits shall be limited to scheduled annual increases determined by the secretary of the treasury under d of the irc 4 in the case of a participant who has fewer than ten years of participation in the plan the dollar limitation set forth in this section shall be multiplied by a fraction i the numerator of which is the number of years or part thereof of participation in the plan and ii the denominator of which is ten 5 any portion of a participants benefit that is attributable to mandatory employee contributions unless pickedup by the city or rollover contributions shall be taken into account in the manner prescribed in the participants combined benefits will equal the dollar limitation 7 for a participant who has or will have distributions commencing at more than one annuity starting date the annual benefit shall be include any distribution that is one of a series of substantially equal periodic payments not less frequently than annually made for the life or life expectancy of the distributee or the joint lives than they are entitled to receive the board shall correct such error and as far as practicable shall adjust the payment in such manner that the actuarial equivalent of the benefit to which the person was correctly entitled shall be paid    9151999 assignments prohibited the right of a person to a pension to the return of accumulated contributions the pension itself any optional benefit any other right accrued or accruing to any person under this article and the monies belonging to the retirement system shall not be subject to execution garnishment attachment the operation of bankruptcy or insolvency law or any other process of law whatsoever and shall be unassignable except as is specifically provided in this section and in fs   and section 8d of the state constitution which provide for the forfeiture of retirement benefits upon conviction of felonies involving breach of public trust and other specified offenses by public officers and employees the recipient of any monthly benefit may authorize the board of trustees to withhold from the monthly benefit those funds necessary to pay for any benefits being received city to pay the certified bargaining agent of the citys firefighters and to make any payments for child support or alimony the board of trustees may upon the written request of the retiree of the pension plan authorize the plan administrator to withhold from the retirement payment those funds that are necessary to pay for premiums for accident health and longterm care insurance for the retiree and the retirees spouse and dependents the pension plan and its board of trustees shall not incur any liability for participation in this permissive program should its actions be taken in good faith    322005   5192010 supplemental share plan retirement benefit 1 supplemental share plan retirement benefit effective  there is hereby created a defined contribution plan component supplemental share plan the supplemental share plan retirement benefit satisfies the requirements under fs  6 and shall consist of an individual share account for each active firefighter on or after the effective date hereof the supplemental share plan retirement benefit shall be funded solely by premium tax revenues received by the city pursuant to fs ch 175  however nothing herein shall be construed to require funding of or guarantee a benefit under this section the total initial amount to be allocated to the members share accounts as provided herein shall be $66371706 for plan years between  and  all premium tax revenues received by the city pursuant to fs ch 175 in excess of $166866200 shall be allocated to the members share accounts as provided herein for plan years beginning  and thereafter the city and the union representing city firefighters have mutually agreed that no premium tax revenues shall be allocated to the supplemental share plan or member share accounts at such time as the city and union mutually agree to allocate fs ch 175 premium tax revenues to the supplemental share plan the parties will negotiate the amount of the allocation members share accounts shall be credited with premium tax revenues and investment earnings or losses and interest and distributed as follows a initial crediting on or before  the share account of each active firefighter on the citys payroll as of  shall be credited retroactively an equally proportionate share of the accumulated excess premium tax revenues of $66371706 based upon a service based formula calculating each members remaining years of credited service prior to their attainment of 25 years of credited service as approved by the professional firefighters of naples iaff local 2174 membership and calculated by the fund actuary solely for purposes of calculating the initial crediting formula described in this section military or prior service credit purchased by members shall not be included b annual crediting effective  and each january 1 thereafter following a plan year in which fs ch 175 premium tax revenues are allocated to the supplemental share plan the share account of each active firefighter on the citys payroll as of the preceding september 30th shall be credited as follows each active firefighter who was employed on the preceding september 30th shall receive one share for each month of credited service as defined in section 29191 earned during the plan year ending on the same september 30th the total number of shares thus determined shall be divided into the premium tax revenues allocated to the supplemental share plan during that plan year or in the case of a supplemental distribution revenues applicable to that plan year even if received after the end of the plan year to determine the amount to be credited to the share account of each eligible share plan member c investment earnings and losses or interest effective  and each january 1 thereafter the share account of each active firefighter shall be credited or debited with earnings or losses based upon the amount in the share account at the close of the immediately preceding calendar year at a rate equal to the pension plans actual net rate of investment return for the preceding plan year members shall have the option to make up to three elections in writing to the board to have interest credited to their share account from a money market mutual fund selected by the board of trustees rather than credited or debited at the pension plans actual net rate of investment return all member share accounts will be credited with the pension plans actual net rate of investment return unless otherwise elected by a member as provided for herein d distribution of share accounts an active firefighter with five or more years of credited service upon termination of employment shall be eligible to receive a distribution of 100 percent of the balance in his or her share account together with all earnings and losses and interest credited to the share account date of termination of employment no benefit shall be payable to an active firefighter who terminates covered employment with less than five years of credited service the share account balances of such nonvested terminated members shall be redistributed among all eligible members share accounts in the same manner as premium tax revenues in the following calendar year the designated beneficiary of an active firefighter who has died shall receive the accumulated total of his share account balance an active firefighter awarded a disability pension from the pension plan shall receive the accumulated total of their share account balance there shall be no forfeiture of a members share account based on the members death disability or termination of employment with five or more years of credited service such payment of share account benefits shall be by lump sum which shall consist of the accumulated total balance of the active firefighters share account or at the members direction the share account balance may be rolled over to another qualified plan in accordance with section 227 of the internal revenue with an additional payment made for any amount credited in the year following termination of employment  1132010   2 522018 deferred retirement option plan 1 a deferred retirement option plan drop is established for eligible firefighters as provided in this section 2 eligibility and participation a firefighters shall be eligible to participate in the drop upon attaining the normal retirement date in accordance with section 29232 b a members election to participate in the drop shall be irrevocable c an eligible member may participate in the drop for a maximum of 60 months an eligible member who wishes to participate in the drop must provide at least 30 days advance written notice to the city of his or her election to participate in the drop an employee who elects to participate in the drop may elect to terminate drop participation and city employment sooner than the maximum drop period with 30 days advance written notice to the city 3 drop plan features a an eligible member who elects to participate in the drop will be considered to have retired for purposes of the plan the members monthly retirement benefit determined in accordance with section 29232 will be paid into his or her drop account every month during the drop period no member contributions shall be required after a member enters the drop and the member will not accrue any additional creditable service or any additional benefits under the plan after entering the drop b for eligible members who were employed on  and as of that date had not attained age 55 age 50 with 20 years of credited service or 25 years of credited service the applicable cost of living adjustment component of the members frozen accrued benefit based on credited service prior to  will be applied to the members monthly retirement benefit each october 1 after the member attains age 50 for eligible members who were employed on  and as of that date had attained age 55 age 50 with 20 years of credited service or 25 years of credited service the applicable cost of living adjustment will be applied to the members monthly retirement benefit each october 1 after the member attains age 50 no cost of living adjustment will be applied to the monthly retirement benefit of any member hired on or after  c a member who elects to participate in the drop shall not be eligible for disability or preretirement death benefits under the pension plan d as a condition of participating in the drop the member must agree 1 to separate from city employment at the conclusion of the drop period and to submit an irrevocable letter of resignation stating this prior to entering the drop 2 that participation in the drop is not a guarantee of employment and the members employment will be at will during the drop period a drop participant may be terminated at the discretion of the city manager upon receipt of an unsatisfactory performance evaluation the member shall sign an agreement acknowledging their at will employment status prior to entering the drop 3 to submit an irrevocable written drop election on forms provided by the city prior to entering the drop e during a members participation in the drop the members monthly retirement benefit will be paid into the drop account a members drop account will earn interest at the rate of 13 percent per annum compounded monthly f within 30 days following a drop participants termination of city employment or death the member or in the event of the members death the members designated beneficiary may submit a written election on a form approved by the board to receive the members entire drop account balance which shall be distributed to the member or in the event of the members death to the members designated beneficiary or estate in accordance with paragraph 3f below in a cash lump sum unless the member elects to have all or any portion of an eligible rollover distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the member in a direct rollover any such direct rollover shall be accomplished in accordance with subsection 29242d of the pension plan in the event a member or designated beneficiary does not submit a written election to receive a distribution of the members drop account balance within 30 days following the members termination of city employment or death the drop account shall be maintained but shall not earn interest g if a drop participant dies before his or her drop account is distributed the participants designated beneficiary shall have the same rights as the participant with respect to the distribution of the drop account if the member has not designated a beneficiary
