officers pension fund fs ch 185 division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning actuarial equivalence or actuarially equivalent means that any benefit payable under the terms of this trust fund in a form other than the normal form of benefit shall have the same actuarial present value on the date payment commences as the normal form of benefit the determination of the actuarial present value of any form of benefit including lump sum distributions shall be based on 1 the rp2000 static mortality table h unisex 5050 for healthy lives projected to 2010 for healthy participants and the rp2000 static mortality table d unisex 5050 projected to 2010 for disabled participants  and 2 the interest discount of 75 percent per annum compounded annually credited service means that period of continuous employment with the city as a police officer for which the police officer receives compensation or is entitled to compensation from the date of employment to the date of termination time spent in compulsory military service of the united states by the police officer will be credited provided the police officer reenters the service of the city as a police officer within the time period provided by state and federal law after date of release from such military service and returns to the retirement trust fund all amounts withdrawn therefrom at the time the police officer entered or while in such armed service during the period of such armed service and until reemployment by the city the police officers contributions to the retirement trust fund shall be waived and no payment of such contributions shall be required final average compensation means the final average monthly compensation of the police officer for the period of the highest three years of contributing service preceding retirement or the highest five of the last ten years of service whichever is greater notwithstanding the preceding sentence effective  final average compensation means the final average monthly compensation of the police officer for the period of the highest eight years of contributing service preceding retirement  provided in no event shall the average final compensation of any police officer who is employed on  be less than the average final compensation determined in accordance with the preceding sentence as of that date police officer means a fulltime statecertified police officer employed by the city as a member of the citys police department including the police chief captains and other officers and police officers of the police department who are statecertified as police officers prior service credit means a member may purchase service credit for service in the armed forces of the united states the united states merchant marine or service as a police officer for the city or any employer prior to employment by the city by depositing into the trust fund the full actuarial costs of such service credit that would have occurred had the member been employed by the city as a police officer for the period of service credit purchased such payment for said service credit may be made as a lump sum or at the members option by payroll deductions not to extend beyond three years according to a schedule approved by the board of trustees payroll deduction payments shall require interest at the actuarial rate of return for the years purchased such purchase of service credit shall take effect receives a refund of member contributions the amount paid for such prior service credit shall also be refunded 1 prior service credit shall not be granted for service where the member is receiving or is entitled to receive a benefit from another governmental pension system 2 prior service credit under this section shall only be provided for service as a police officer as defined in fs ch 185 andor and merchant marine service shall not exceed four years prior service credit purchased shall be added to the years of service with the city 4 election to purchase credited service for prior service with the city prior service with any other law enforcement agency or prior service in the united states armed forces or merchant marine shall be made in writing to the board of trustees the cost of credited service purchased for such prior service shall be the full actuarial cost of all credited service purchased hereunder computed as a lump sum payment into the plan actual payment may at the members option be extended over a period of time not to exceed three years and shall be subject to interest at the actuarial rate of return for the years purchased such payment may be by direct inservice transfer from a police officers deferred compensation account 457 account pursuant to section 457e17 of the irc full payment of such purchased credited service must be completed prior to the service rendered but not including any payments for extra duty or a special detail work performed on behalf of a second party employer notwithstanding the foregoing sentence effective  compensation or definitions generally  12 trust fund created there is created an irrevocable trust fund to be known as the city of naples police officers retirement trust fund exclusively for the purposes provided in this article      9151999 maintenance of fund the retirement trust fund created in section 29272 shall be maintained by 1 the net proceeds of excise or license taxes which may be imposed by the city pursuant to law upon certain casualty insurance companies on their gross receipts of premiums from holders of policies which policies cover property within the corporate limits of the city effective  the city and the union representing city police officers have mutually agreed that all premium tax revenues received pursuant to fs ch 185 shall be used to offset the citys contributions to the trust fund 2 five percent of the salary of each police officer hired before  and three percent of the salary of each police officer hired on or after  which shall be deducted by the city and paid over to the board of trustees of the retirement trust 3 as a local contribution to the plan the city shall compensate the fund for any shortfall in the annual funding of section 185 funds below the base level established to be the 1997 tax year paid in 1998 as required under fs  185351 for each plan year that the city receives premium tax revenue pursuant to fs ch 185 4 payment by the city of a sum equal  9151999   1012003   4212004   322005   6182008   372012   1 522018 secs 2927429290  reserved division 2  board of trustees footnotes  7  cross reference boards and commissions  2401 et seq  appointments of staff members to boards and commissions of the city by the city manager  2407  board of trustees  29111 et seq created  organization a there is created a board of trustees of the police officers retirement trust fund which shall be solely for administering and operating the trust fund b the board of trustees shall consist of five members two of whom unless otherwise prohibited by law shall be legal residents of the city who shall be appointed by the city council and two of whom shall be police officers as defined in fs  18502d11 who shall be elected by a majority of the police officers who are members of the pension plan the fifth member shall be chosen by a majority of the previous four members and such persons name shall be submitted to the city council upon receipt of the fifth persons name the city council shall as a ministerial duty appoint such person to the board of trustees as its fifth member the fifth member shall serve as trustee for a period of two years unless sooner replaced by the board of trustees and may succeed himself or herself as a trustee each cityappointed board member shall serve as trustee for a period of two years unless sooner replaced by the city each city appointed board member may succeed himself or herself in office and may serve on other city boards specifically the general employees and firefighter pension boards each police officer member shall serve as trustee for a period of two years unless the member sooner leaves the employment of the city as a police officer whereupon the members successor shall be chosen to fill the unexpired term in the same manner as an original appointment each police officer may succeed himself or herself in office c the board of trustees shall meet at least quarterly each year d each board of trustees shall be a legal entity with in addition to other powers and responsibilities contained in this article the power to bring and defend lawsuits of every kind nature and description e the trustees shall by majority vote elect from its members a chairman and a secretary the secretary of the board shall keep a complete minute book of the actions proceedings or hearings of the board the secretary of the board shall also keep a record of all persons receiving pension payments under the provisions of this division which shall note the time when the pension was approved and when the pension shall cease this record shall include a list of all police officers employed by the city showing the name address time of employment by the city and when they cease to be employed by the city f the trustees shall not receive any compensation as such but shall be entitled to reimbursement of reasonable and necessary expenses incurred subject to maximum amounts and procedures established by the board in accordance with fs   g notwithstanding any other section of this but subject to any provisions of the state constitution or general law members of this board shall be permitted to serve on any other board duly formed by the city h members of the board of trustees shall discharge all duties 1 solely in the interest of the participants and beneficiaries of the trust fund  2 for the exclusive purpose of providing benefits to participants and beneficiaries  3 with the care skill prudence and diligence that a prudent person acting in a like capacity and familiar with such matters would use in the conduct of an enterprise of a like character with like goals  4 by diversifying investments of the trust fund in a manner that minimizes the risk of large losses unless under the circumstances it is clearly not prudent to do so  and 5 in accordance with documents instruments ordinances and statutes governing the trust fund a     9151999   4212004 powers the board of trustees created in section 29291 may in its discretion exercise any or all of the following powers 1 the board shall be the trustees of the assets of the retirement trust fund and shall have full and unrestricted discretionary power and authority to invest and reinvest the assets of the trust fund without regard to the limitations except as to foreign securities of fs ch 185 the board shall have full and unrestricted discretionary power and authority to hold sell assign transfer or otherwise dispose of any securities and investments in which any monies of the retirement trust fund have been invested as well as the proceeds of such investments and monies belonging to the retirement trust fund and may delegate this authority to one or more investment managers who shall acknowledge in writing that they are named fiduciaries with respect to the retirement trust fund within the meaning of fs   and who shall invest the retirement trust funds assets in accordance with this article applicable federal and state laws and regulations and investment guidelines adopted by the board the board shall identify and publicly report any direct or indirect holdings it may have in any scrutinized company as defined in fs   and proceed to sell redeem divest or withdraw all publicly traded securities it may have in such company beginning  and shall thereafter be prohibited from purchasing or holding such securities the divestiture of any such security must be completed by  in accordance with ch 200997 laws of florida no person may bring any civil criminal or administrative action against the board or any employee officer director or advisor of such board based upon the divestiture of any security pursuant to this paragraph 2 all payments from monies of the retirement trust fund shall be made by the finance director or by a custodian or funding agent designated by the board such payments shall be made only upon the written authority signed by 2 persons designated by the board a duly attested copy of a resolution designating such persons and bearing upon its face specimen signatures of such persons shall be filed with the finance director custodian or the funding agent no such written authority to make payments from the monies of the trust fund shall be executed unless the payments shall have been previously authorized by a specific or continuing resolution adopted by the board 3 any and all acts and decisions shall be by at least 3 members of the board 4 finally decide all claims for benefits under the boards rules and regulations pursuant to this article 5 keep a complete record of all receipts and disbursements and of the boards acts and proceedings 6 the general administration of and the responsibilities for the proper operation of the retirement trust fund and for making effective this article are vested in the board of trustees who may employ such independent professional technical or other advisers it deems necessary at the trust funds expense the board of trustees shall keep in convenient form such data as shall be necessary for an actuarial valuation of the retirement trust fund for checking the actual experience of the fund at least once every 3 years the board of trustees shall retain a professionally qualified as defined in fs ch 185 independent consultant to evaluate the performance of existing professional money managers and make recommendations regarding the selection of money managers for the next investment term such recommendations shall be considered by the board of trustees at its next regularly scheduled meeting which shall be advertised in the same manner as for any meeting of the board of trustees b     9151999   5192010 secs 2929329310  reserved division 3  membership and benefits contributions contributions to the police officers pension and retirement system shall be deducted in the amount of five percent from the salary of each police officer hired before  and three percent from the salary of each police officer hired on or after  so long as such police officer shall be employed by the city any police officer who enters the service of the city after the effective date of the ordinance from which this section derives shall be required to participate in this plan as a condition of employment except to an officer first entering service of the city at the rank of chief who upon appointment to that position may make an election to participate in this plan or another retirement plan which does not require a greater contribution by the city  provided however any officer who elects to participate in any other pension plan shall not be entitled to receive any benefit under fs ch 185 for any service rendered while a participant in such other pension plan notwithstanding any part of this section any police officer may contribute to a voluntary deferred compensation irc section 457 plan and may if eligible participate in the defined contribution supplemental retirement plan established by article iii division 4 of this chapter in addition to participating in this plan the employer agrees to assume and pay member contributions in lieu of direct contributions by the member and such contributions shall accordingly be paid into the fund on behalf of the members no member subject to such agreement shall have the option of choosing to receive the contributed amounts directly instead of having them paid by the employer directly to the fund all such contributions by the employer shall be deemed and considered as part of the members accumulated contributions and subject to all sections of this plan pertaining to accumulated contributions of members the intent of this language is to comply with section 414h2 of the internal revenue      5201998   9151999   642003   6182008   372012 requirements for retirement any police officer hired prior to  who has attained the age of 50 or 25 or more years of credited service and has been a member of the retirement fund created in this article is eligible for normal retirement benefits any police officer hired on or after  who has attained the age of 60 with eight or more years of credited service or 30 or more years of credited service and who has been a member of the retirement fund created in this article is eligible for normal retirement benefits in such event payment of retirement income will be governed by the following 1 the normal retirement date of each police officer hired prior to  will be the first day of the month coincident with or next following the date on which the police officer has attained the age of 50 years or 25 years of credited service the normal retirement date of each police officer hired by the city on or after  will be the first day of the month coincident with or next following the date on which the police officer has attained the age of 60 with eight or more years of credited service or 30 or more years of service each member shall be 100 percent vested in accrued benefit upon attainment of normal retirement age 2 effective  the amount of the base monthly retirement income payable to a police officer who retires on or after normal retirement date shall be an amount equal to the number of years and fractions thereof of credited service prior to  multiplied by 363 percent of final average compensation notwithstanding any other provision of this article effective  the accrued benefits of all members who are employed and have not attained age 50 or 25 or more years of credited service excluding prior service credit purchased on or after  as of  shall be frozen such members shall be fully vested in their frozen accrued benefit based on final average compensation and credited service as of  the base monthly retirement income of members who are employed and have not attained age 50 or 25 or more years of credited service excluding prior service credit purchased on or after  as of  shall be payable in two parts 1 the frozen accrued benefit based on credited service and final average compensation as of   and 2 the accrued benefit based on credited service on and after  the base monthly retirement income of members who are employed and have not attained age 50 or 25 or more years of credited service excluding prior service credit purchased on or after  as of  shall be payable upon attaining age 50 or 25 years of credited service or with an early retirement reduction upon attaining age 45 with 20 years of credited service and separation from city employment if such member terminates employment prior to the normal retirement date heshe shall be eligible for a refund of contributions or benefit in accordance with section 29317 in lieu of any other benefit under the plan 3 effective  the amount of the base monthly retirement income payable to a police officer who retires on or after the normal retirement date shall be an amount equal to the number of years and fractions thereof of credited service on and after  multiplied by three percent of final average compensation notwithstanding the preceding sentence the amount of the base monthly retirement income payable to any member who has attained age 50 or 25 or more years of credited service excluding prior service credit purchased on or after  as of  shall be an amount equal to the number of years and fractions thereof of credited service multiplied by 363 percent of final average compensation 4 any vested police officer police officers hired prior to  with at least five years of credited service  and police officers hired on or after  with at least eight years of credited service shall be entitled to purchase an additional benefit of 726 percent of final average compensation or such lesser amount as the police officer may choose the police officer shall pay the full actuarial cost as determined by the retirement system actuary of such additional benefit purchased hereunder payment for this additional benefit must be completed prior to the police officers actual retirement and may be made in one or more of the following manners a cash lump sum payment  b direct transfer or rollover of an eligible rollover distribution from a qualified or eligible plan including direct inservice transfer from a police officers deferred compensation account 457 account pursuant to section 457e of the internal revenue   c installment payments bearing interest at the retirement systems actuarially assumed rate of investment return under such conditions and terms as the retirement systems board of trustees may prescribe 5 in order to provide extra benefits during the years before the age of 62 when social security benefits first become available a monthly cost of living adjustment cola benefit shall be paid to any police officer receiving a normal or early retirement benefit who retired on or after  and to the survivor of such a police officer who is receiving a survivors benefit the amount of the cola benefit shall be a three percent annual increase to the pension benefit effective on october 1st following the completion of at least one full year on retirement status and the attainment of age 55 and continuing each october 1st thereafter until the police officer attains or if deceased who would have attained age 62 the cola benefit shall not be payable on or after the date on which a police officer attains the age of 62 or if a police officers death occurs prior thereto the date on which a police officer would have attained the age of 62 in addition commencing  a onetime increase to the monthly benefits paid to all retirees and beneficiaries of retirees who have been receiving benefit payments for five or more years shall be paid in the amount of 05 percent for each full year of retirement subject to a maximum increase of five percent the city shall make deposits into the police officers pension and retirement system equal to the full annual actuarial cost of such increase in the cola benefit notwithstanding the preceding paragraph effective  there will be no cost of living adjustment cola applied to benefits based on credited service on and after that date 6 the monthly retirement income payable for normal retirement will be payable on the first day of each month the first payment will be made on the first day of the month subsequent to actual retirement or as soon thereafter as possible and the last payment will be the payment due next preceding the police officers death  except that if the police officer dies after retirement but before the police officer has received retirement benefits for a period of ten years the same monthly benefit to which the police officer would have been entitled will be paid to the beneficiary as designated by the police officer for the balance of such tenyear period or if no designated beneficiary is surviving such payment shall be made in accordance with section 29320b if the police officer continues in the service of the city beyond normal retirement date and dies prior to the date of actual retirement monthly retirement income payments will be made for a period of ten years to a beneficiary designated by the police officer as if the police officer had retired on the date on which death occurred or if no designated beneficiary is surviving such payment shall be made in accordance with section 29320b 7 early retirement is retirement from the service of the city with the consent of the board of trustees as of the first day of any calendar month which is prior to the police officers normal retirement date for police officers electing early retirement after  early retirement must be subsequent to the date as of which the officer has attained the age of 45 years or has completed 20 years of credited service whichever occurs earlier for early retirement payment of retirement income will be governed as follows a the early retirement date shall be the first day of the calendar month coincident with or immediately following the date a police officer retires from the service of the city under this section prior to the normal retirement date b the monthly amount of retirement income payable to a police officer who retires prior to the normal retirement date under this section shall be an amount computed as described in subsection 2 of this section taking into account credited service to the date of actual retirement and the final average compensation as of such date such amount of retirement income to be actuarially reduced to take into account the police officers younger age and the earlier commencement of retirement income payments for police officers electing early retirement subsequent to  the actuarial reduction shall be equal to 025 percent per month for each month that early retirement precedes the earlier of the age or credited service requirement for normal retirement notwithstanding the preceding sentence for police officers hired on or after  the actuarial reduction for early retirement shall be equal to  percent per month for each month 50 percent per year for each year that early retirement precedes the earlier of age 60 or 30 years of credited service c the retirement income payable for the early retirement will be payable on the first day of each month the first payment will be made on the police officers early retirement date and the last payment will be the payment due next preceding the retired police officers death  except that if the police officer dies before the police officer has received retirement benefits for a period of ten years the same monthly benefit to which the police officer would have been entitled will be paid to the beneficiary designated by the police officer for the balance of such tenyear period or if no designated beneficiary is surviving the same monthly benefit for the balance of such tenyear period shall be payable to the person as set forth in section 29320b 8 deferred retirement is retirement from the service of the city as of the first day of any calendar month subsequent to the police officers normal retirement date for deferred retirement payment of retirement income will be governed as follows a the deferred retirement date shall be the first day of the calendar month coincident with or next following the date a police officer retires from the service of the city under this section b the monthly amount of retirement income payable to a police officer who retires subsequent to the normal retirement date under this section shall be an amount computed as described in subsections 2 3 4 and 5 of this section taking into account credited service to the police officers date of actual retirement and the final average compensation as of such date c the retirement income payable for deferred retirement will be payable on the first day of each month the first payment will be made on the police officers deferred retirement date and the last payment will be the payment due next preceding the retired police officers death  except that if the police officer dies before the police officer has received retirement benefits for a period of ten years the same monthly benefit to which the police officer would have been entitled will be paid to the beneficiary designated by the police officer for the balance of such tenyear period or if no designated beneficiary is surviving such benefit shall be payable as provided in section 29320b 9 the pension formula and benefits provided for in this section and the boards recommendations for improvement thereto shall be reviewed in every oddnumbered year to determine whether changes in the cost of living indicate the need for revision to the pension plan for active or retired police officers or both 10 in no event may a members for members over age 44 see also the table optional forms of retirement income a in lieu of the amount and form of retirement income payable for normal or deferred retirement as specified in section 29312 a police officer upon written request to the board of trustees and subject to the approval of the board of trustees may elect to receive a retirement income or benefit of equivalent actuarial value payable in accordance with one of the following options 1 a retirement income of a larger monthly amount payable to the police officer for lifetime only 2 a retirement income of a modified monthly amount payable to the police officer during the joint lifetime of the police officer and a joint pensioner designated by the police officer and following the death of the police officer 100 percent 75 66 23 percent or 50 percent of such monthly amount payable to the survivor for the lifetime of the survivor 3 such other amount and form of retirement payments or benefit as the board of trustees in its sole discretion may approve the board reserves the right to require the retiring police officer to pay the cost of actuarial services for computing an alternate benefit requested by the retiring police officer 4 no form of benefit shall be permitted unless the present value of payment to be made to the participant is more than 50 percent of the present value of total payment to be made to the participant and the participants beneficiaries b if a police officer has elected an option with a joint pensioner and retirement income benefits have commenced the police officer may thereafter change the designated joint pensioner up to two times as provided in fs   without the approval of the board of trustees or the current joint annuitant or beneficiary the member need not provide proof of the good health of the joint annuitant or beneficiary being removed and the joint annuitant or beneficiary being removed need not be living the amount of the retirement income payable to the member upon designation of a new joint annuitant shall be actuarially redetermined by the application of actuarial tables and calculations to ensure that the benefit paid is the actuarial equivalent of the present value of the members current benefit and that there is no impact to the plan c  reserved       9151999   1182006   4 5192010 disability retirement a a police officer may retire from the service of the city under this section if prior to normal retirement date the police officer becomes totally and permanently disabled as defined in subsection b of this section because of any cause other than a cause set out in subsection c of this section on or after the effective date of the plan such retirement shall be referred to as disability retirement b a police officer will be considered totally disabled if in the opinion of the board of trustees a police officer is wholly prevented from rendering useful and efficient services as a police officer and a police officer will be considered permanently disabled if in the opinion of the board of trustees such police officer is likely to remain so disabled continuously and permanently from a cause other than as specified in subsection c of this section c a police officer will not be entitled to receive any disability retirement income if the disability is a result of 1 excessive and habitual use by the police officer of drugs intoxicants or narcotics 2 injury or disease sustained by the police officer while willfully and illegally participating in fights riots civil insurrection or while committing a crime 3 injury or disease sustained by the police officer while serving in any armed forces 4 injury or disease sustained by the police officer while working for anyone other than the city and arising out of such employment d no police officer shall be permitted to retire under this section until examined by a duly qualified physician psychologist andor other medical vocational and rehabilitation professionals to be selected by the board of trustees for that purpose and found to be disabled in the degree and in the manner specified in this section any police officer retiring under this section shall be examined periodically by a duly qualified physician to be selected by the board of trustees for that purpose to determine if such disability has ceased to exist the physicians psychologists andor other medical vocational and rehabilitation professionals determinations hereunder shall not be binding e the monthly amount of retirement income payable to a police officer who retires prior to normal retirement date under this section shall be an amount computed as described in section 29315b taking into account credited service to date of disability and final average compensation as of such date the full accrued benefit with no actuarial reduction will be paid no supplemental benefit as described in section 29315c shall be paid in connection with or as part of the disability retirement benefits f the monthly retirement income to which a police officer is entitled for disability retirement will be payable on the first day of each month the first payment will be made on the first day of the month following the date the board of trustees approved the payment of such retirement income when the first payment is made however it will include benefits retroactive to the first day of disability the last payment will be if the police officer recovers from the disability prior to normal retirement date the payment due next preceding the date of such recovery or if the police officer recovers from the disability subsequent to normal retirement date or dies without recovering from disability the payment due next preceding the police officers death or the 120th monthly payment whichever is later any monthly retirement income payments due after the death of a disabled police officer shall be paid to the beneficiary or if no beneficiary is surviving to the person provided in section 29320b g if the board of trustees finds that a police officer who is receiving a disability retirement income is at any time prior to normal retirement date no longer disabled as provided in this section the board of trustees shall direct that the disability retirement income be discontinued recovery from disability as used in this section shall mean the ability of the police officer to render useful and efficient service as a police officer h if a police officer recovers from disability and reenters city employment as a police officer the police officers service will be deemed to have been continuous for the purpose of computing normal and deferred retirement or death benefits but the period beginning with the first month for which the police officer received a disability retirement income payment and ending with the date the police officer reentered the service will not be considered as credited service for the purpose of this plan i any disability benefits payable to a police officer at time of retirement shall be limited to an amount which when combined with appropriate federal government benefits will not exceed the salary paid to the police officer at the time of the occurrence of the police officers disability j any police officer who shall retire from the service of the city under this section as a result of a lineofduty disability shall receive a minimum benefit equal to 42 percent of final average compensation and if as a result of a nonlineofduty disability a minimum benefit equal to 25 percent of final average compensation k any permanent disability as defined in this section which is the result of or caused by tuberculosis hepatitis meningococcal meningitis hypertension heart disease or hardening of the arteries shall be presumed to have been incurred in the line of duty unless the contrary is shown by competent evidence or unless a physical examination of the member conducted upon initial hiring by the city revealed the existence of such condition at that time and provided that a police officer claiming disability due to tuberculosis or meningococcal meningitis provides the affidavit required by fs  2      9151999 separation from municipal service  refunds a should any police officer hired prior to  leave the service of the city before accumulating five years of credited service before being eligible to retire under this article such police officer shall be entitled to a refund of all of the police officers contributions made to the police officers retirement trust fund with interest at the rate of five and onehalf percent per annum less 12 of any disability payments made to the police officer should any police officer hired on or after  leave the service of the city before accumulating eight years of credited service such police officer shall be entitled to a refund of all of the police officers contributions made to the police officers retirement trust fund with interest at the rate of five and onehalf percent per annum less 12 of any disability payments made to the police officer a police officer may voluntarily leave contributions in the fund for a period of five years after leaving the employ of the police department pending the possibility of being rehired by the same department without losing credit for the time participated actively as a police officer if the police officer is not reemployed as a police officer with the same department within five years the contributions shall be returned no interest shall be paid from the date of separation to the date of refund contributions b should any separated police officer hired prior to  who has at least five years credited service and has contributed to the police officers retirement trust fund for at least five years elect to leave the services of the city and elect to leave accrued contributions in the police officers retirement trust fund such police officer upon attaining age 50 years or more may retire based upon the benefit level credited service and final average compensation which existed at the time of the police officers separation should any separated police officer hired on or after  who has at least eight years credited service and who has contributed to the police officers retirement trust fund for at least eight years elect to leave the services of the city and elect to leave accrued contributions in the police officers retirement trust fund such police officer upon attaining age 60 years or more may retire based upon the benefit level credited service and final average compensation which existed at the time of the police officers separation c a refund of contributions under this section shall be in lieu of any other benefit under the terms of this trust fund      9151999   372012 lump sum payment of small retirement income notwithstanding any section of this article to the contrary if the monthly retirement income payable to any person entitled to benefits under this article is $25000 or less or if the single sum of the accrued retirement income is less than $500000 as of the date of retirement or termination of service whichever is applicable the board of trustees in its sole discretion may specify that the actuarial equivalent of such retirement income be paid in a lump sum      9151999 death benefits a should any police officer die prior to the earlier of the commencement of retirement benefits or normal retirement date a refund of 100 percent with interest at the rate of 512 percent per annum of the contributions made to the retirement trust fund by such deceased police officer shall be paid to the beneficiary or if no designated beneficiary is surviving to the person as set forth in section 29320b b if a police officer has completed at least 5 years of credited service at the time of death the beneficiary or if no designated beneficiary is surviving the person as set forth in section 29320b shall have the option to elect a monthly benefit in lieu of the benefit outlined in subsection a of this section if such an election is made the benefit will commence on the first day of the month following the date of the police officers death the monthly amount of the benefit shall be an amount computed as described in section 29315a2 with the recipient considered as a 100 percent joint pensioner taking into account credited service to the date of the police officers death and final average compensation as of such date the benefit shall be actuarially adjusted to reflect the early commencement of the benefit and the age of the recipient of the benefits and shall be paid for the life of the recipient  however should the recipient die before receiving payments for 10 years the balance of the 10year certain benefit shall be paid to the recipients designated beneficiary      9151999 beneficiaries a each police officer may on a form provided for that purpose signed and filed with the board of trustees designate a beneficiary to receive the benefit if any which may be payable if death occurs and each designation may be revoked by such police officer by signing and filing with the board of trustees a new designation of beneficiary form b if there is no designated beneficiary living at the death of the police officer when any benefit shall be payable to a beneficiary such benefit shall be payable to the police officers executors or administrators provided that the board of trustees may at its option but without any obligation to do so pay such benefit to the police officers wife or husband if living  if not living to the police officers surviving children equally  if none survives to the police officers surviving parents equally  if neither survives to the police officers executors or administrators any survivors share however may be paid to such adult or institution as has in the boards opinion assumed the custody and principal care of such survivor provided that no such payment shall be made after a legal guardian of the property of such survivor shall have been appointed and the board shall have received due notice of such appointment the board reserves the right to assign any of its options rights or elections set forth in this subsection to any company providing an annuity contract for the benefit of the police officers or beneficiary any payments made under this subsection at the option of the board shall not impose any liability whatsoever on the board or any member of the board      9151999 termination of the plan upon termination of the police officers pension and retirement plan for any reason or upon written notice to the board of trustees that contributions under the plan are being permanently discontinued the fund shall be apportioned and distributed in accordance with fs  18537 for the termination or partial termination of this plan each participants accrued pension benefit shall become nonforfeitable ie 100 percent vested the board shall determine the date of distribution and the asset value required to fund all nonforfeitable benefits after taking into account the expenses of such distribution the board shall inform the city or then current plan sponsor if additional assets are required in which event the city or then current plan sponsor shall continue to financially support the pension plan until all nonforfeitable benefits have been funded      9151999   5192010 transfer of assets all assets of the police officers retirement trust fund established by shall be transferred to the police officers retirement trust fund created in this article      9151999 city attorneys representation of board of trustees the city attorney may give advice to the board of trustees in all matters pertaining to its duties in the administration of the police officers retirement trust fund whenever requested and may represent and defend the board as its attorney in all suits and actions at law or in equity that may be brought against it and bring all suits and actions in its behalf that may be required or determined by the board however the board of trustees in its discretion may employ its own legal counsel for such purposes at the sole cost and expense of the board if the board of trustees chooses to use the citys legal counsel or actuary or any of the citys other professional technical or other advisers it must do so only under terms and conditions acceptable to the board of trustees      6181997   9151999 internal revenue a maximum pension notwithstanding any provision of this plan to the contrary the annual pension that is accrued by or paid to a participant shall not exceed the dollar limitation set forth below if the benefit the participant would otherwise accrue in a limitation year would produce an annual pension in excess of the dollar limitation the benefit shall be limited to a benefit that does not exceed the dollar limitation 1 definitions used in this section annual pension means the benefits received by a participant under this plan expressed in the form of a straight life annuity in determining whether benefits payable exceed the dollar limitation set forth below benefits payable in any form other than a straight life annuity shall be adjusted to the larger of a the annual amount of the straight life annuity if any payable to the participant under the plan commencing at the same annuity starting date as the form of benefit payable to the participant  or b the annual amount of the straight life annuity commencing at the same annuity starting date that has the same actuarial present value as the form of benefit payable to the participant computed using a five percent interest assumption and the applicable mortality table described in  e1d2 of the internal revenue irc for that annuity starting date no actuarial adjustment to the benefit shall be made for benefits that are not directly related to retirement benefits such as a qualified disability benefit preretirement incidental death benefits and postretirement medical benefits  or the inclusion in the form of benefit of an automatic benefit increase feature provided the form of benefit is not subject to  417e3 of the irc and would otherwise satisfy the limitations of this section and the amount payable under the form of benefit in any limitation year shall not exceed the limits of this section applicable at the annuity starting date as increased in subsequent years pursuant to  415d of the irc for this purpose an automatic benefit increase feature is included in a form of benefit if the form of benefit provides for automatic periodic increases to the benefits paid in that form dollar limitation means $16000000 subject to the annual adjustments provided under d of the irc said amount shall be adjusted based on the age of the participant when benefits begin as follows a except with respect to a participant who is a qualified participant as defined in b2h of the irc for benefits except survivor and disability benefits as defined in b2i of the irc beginning before age 62 the ageadjusted dollar limitation is equal to the lesser of 1 the actuarial equivalent annual amount of the straight life annuity under the plan to the annual amount of the straight life annuity under the plan commencing at age 62 with both annual amounts determined without applying the rules of section 415 of the irc b for benefits beginning after the age of 65 the ageadjusted dollar limitation is equal to the lesser of 1 the actuarial equivalent of the annual amount of a straight including actuarial adjustments even if those actuarial adjustments are applied to offset accruals for this purpose the annual amount of the immediately commencing straight life annuity is determined without applying the rules of section 415 of the irc the adjusted age 65 straight life annuity means the annual amount of the straight life annuity that would be payable under the plan to a hypothetical participant who is 65 years old and has the same accrued benefit with no actuarial increases for commencement after age 65 as the participant receiving the distribution determined disregarding the participants accruals after age 65 and without applying the rules of section 415 of the irc  3 there shall be no age adjustment of the dollar limitation with respect to benefits beginning between the ages of 62 and 65 2 the limitations set forth in this section shall not apply if the annual pension does not exceed $1000000 provided the participant has never participated in a defined contribution plan maintained by the city 3 costofliving adjustments in the dollar limitation for benefits shall be limited to scheduled annual increases determined by the secretary of the treasury under d of the irc 4 in the case of a participant who has fewer than ten years of participation in the plan the dollar limitation set forth in this section shall be multiplied by a fraction i the numerator of which is the number of years or part thereof of participation in the plan and ii the denominator of which is ten 5 any portion of a participants benefit that is attributable to mandatory employee contributions unless pickedup by the city or rollover contributions shall be taken into account in the manner prescribed in the regulations under section 415 of the irc 6 should any participant participate in more than one defined benefit plan maintained by the city in any case in which the participants benefits under all such defined benefit plans determined as of the same age would exceed the dollar limitation applicable at that age the accrual of the participants benefit under this plan shall be reduced so that the participants combined benefits will equal the dollar limitation 7 for a participant who has or will have distributions commencing at more than one annuity starting date the annual benefit shall be determined as of each such annuity starting date and shall satisfy the limitations of this section as of each such date actuarially adjusting for past and future distributions of benefits commencing at the other annuity starting dates for this purpose such a way as to give full effect to the provisions of section 415 of the irc the value of any benefits forfeited as a result of the application of this section shall be used to decrease future participants required beginning date which is defined as the later of 1 april 1 of the calendar year that next follows the calendar year in which the participant attains or will attain the age of 7012 years  or 2 april 1 of the calendar year that next follows the calendar year in which the participant retires c required minimum distributions 1 required beginning date the participants entire designated beneficiary as of september 30 of the year following the year of the participants death the participants entire interest will be distributed by december 31 of the calendar year containing participants death c death of surviving spouse before distributions to surviving spouse begin in any case in which i the participant dies before the date distribution of his or her interest begins ii the participants surviving spouse is the participants sole designated beneficiary and iii the surviving spouse dies before distributions to the surviving spouse begin subparagraphs 2a and 2b above shall apply as though the surviving spouse were the participant 3 requirements for annuity distributions that commence during participants lifetime a joint life annuities where the beneficiary is not the distribution period described in this section whichever is applicable  3 once payments have begun over a period certain the period certain will not be changed even if the period certain is shorter than the maximum permitted  4 payments will either be nonincreasing or increase only as follows i by an annual percentage increase that does not exceed the annual percentage increase in a costofliving index that is based on prices of all items and issued by the bureau of labor statistics  ii to the extent of the reduction in the amount of the participants payments to provide for a survivor benefit upon death but only if the beneficiary whose life was being used to determine the distribution period dies or is no longer the participants beneficiary pursuant to a qualified domestic relations order within the meaning of section 414p of the irc  iii to provide cash refunds of employee contributions upon the participants death  or iv to pay increased benefits that result from a plan amendment b begin the date distributions are required to begin under this section whichever is applicable is the payment that is required for one payment interval the second payment need not be made until the end of the next payment interval even if that payment interval ends in the next calendar year payment intervals are the periods for which payments are received eg bimonthly monthly semiannually or annually all of the participants benefit accruals as of the last day of the first distribution calendar year will be included in the calculation of the amount of the annuity payments for payment intervals ending on or after the participants required beginning date c additional accruals after first distribution calendar year any additional benefits accruing to the participant in a calendar year after the first distribution calendar year will be distributed beginning with the first payment interval ending in the calendar year immediately following the calendar year in which such amount accrues 5 for purposes of this subsection distributions are considered to begin on the participants required beginning date if annuity payments irrevocably commence to the participant or to the section c life expectancy life expectancy as computed by use of the single life table in section a99 of the treasury regulations d eligible rollover distributions 1 notwithstanding any provision of portion of an eligible rollover distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the distributee in a direct rollover 2 definitions a eligible rollover distribution an eligible rollover distribution is any distribution of all or any portion of the balance to the credit of the distributee except that an eligible rollover distribution does not include any distribution that is one of a series of substantially equal periodic payments not less frequently than annually made for the life or life expectancy of the distributee or the joint lives or joint life expectancies of the distributee and the distributees designated beneficiary or for a specified period often ten years or more  any distribution to the extent such distribution is required under section 401a9 of the irc retirement plan an eligible retirement plan is an individual retirement account described in section 408a of the irc an individual retirement annuity described in section 408b of the irc an annuity accruing to any person under this article and the monies belonging to the retirement system shall not be subject to execution garnishment attachment the operation of bankruptcy or insolvency law or any other process of law whatsoever and shall be unassignable except as is specifically provided in this section and in fs   and article ii section 8d of the state constitution which provide for the forfeiture of retirement benefits upon conviction of felonies involving breach of public trust and other specified offenses by public officers and employees the recipient of any monthly benefit may authorize the board of trustees to withhold from the monthly benefit those funds necessary to pay for any benefits being received city to pay the certified bargaining agent of the citys police officers and to make any payments for child support or alimony the board of trustees may upon the written request of the retiree of the pension plan authorize the plan administrator to withhold from the retirement payment those funds that are necessary to pay for premiums for accident health and longterm care insurance for the retiree and the retirees spouse and dependents the pension plan and its board of trustees shall not incur any liability for participation in this permissive program should its actions be taken in good faith    322005   5192010 deferred retirement option plan 1 effective  a deferred retirement option plan drop is established for eligible police officers as provided in this section 2 eligibility and participation a police officers hired prior to  shall be eligible to participate in the drop upon attaining age 50 or 25 years of credited service b a members election to participate in the drop shall be irrevocable c an eligible member may participate in the drop for a maximum of 60 months an eligible member who wishes to participate in the drop must provide at least 30 days advance written notice to the city of his or her election to participate in the drop an employee who elects to participate in the drop may elect to terminate drop participation and city employment sooner than the maximum drop period with 30 days advance written notice to the city 3 drop plan features a an eligible member who elects to participate in the drop will be considered to have retired for purposes of the plan the members monthly retirement benefit determined in accordance with section 29312 will be paid into his or her drop account every month during the drop period no member contributions shall be required after a member enters the drop and the member will not accrue any additional creditable service or any additional benefits under the plan after entering the drop the cost of living adjustment component of a members frozen accrued benefit based on credited service prior to  will be applied to the members benefit after one year of drop participation if the member has attained age 55 but has not attained age 62 b a member who elects to participate in the drop shall not be eligible for disability or preretirement death benefits under the pension plan c as a condition of participating in the drop the member must agree 1 to separate from city employment at the conclusion of the drop period and to submit an irrevocable letter of resignation stating this prior to entering the drop 2 that participation in the drop is not a guarantee of employment and the members employment will be at will during the drop period a drop participant may be terminated at the discretion of the city manager upon receipt of an unsatisfactory performance evaluation the member shall sign an agreement acknowledging their at will employment status prior to entering the drop 3 to submit an irrevocable written drop election on forms provided by the city prior to entering the drop d during a members participation in the drop the members monthly retirement benefit will be paid into the drop account a members drop account will earn interest at the rate of 13 percent per annum compounded monthly e within 30 days following a drop participants termination of city employment or death the member or in the event of the members death the members designated beneficiary may submit a written election on a form approved by the board to receive the members entire drop account balance which shall be distributed to the member or in the event of the members death to the members designated beneficiary or estate in accordance with paragraph 3f below in a cash lump sum unless the member elects to have all or any portion of an eligible rollover distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the member in a direct rollover any such direct rollover shall be accomplished in accordance with subsection 29324d of the pension plan in the event a member or designated beneficiary does not submit a written election to receive a distribution of the members drop account balance within 30 days following the members termination of city employment or death the drop account shall be maintained but shall not earn interest f if a drop participant dies before his or her drop account is distributed the participants designated beneficiary shall have the same rights as the participant with respect to the distribution of the drop account if the member has not designated a beneficiary the drop account balance shall be paid to the members estate g the forfeiture provisions of fs   shall apply to a members drop benefit  372012 nonapplication of certain benefit changes notwithstanding any other provision of this article the benefit changes contained in other than the provisions of section 29327 shall not apply to any police officer who as of  has attained age 50 or 25 years of credited service excluding prior service credit ch 367  water resources fs ch 373 article i  in general generally a compliance all water sewer andor reclaimed water service users are required to comply with all regulations and ordinances of the city governing such use b responsibility of city the city shall only be responsible for a good faith effort to provide reasonable water sewer and reclaimed water service water service is subject to the continuing availability of raw water supply and water sewer and reclaimed water service is subject to the availability of the respective treatment plants capacity and all requirements of the law c service not guaranteed location within the service areas of the city does not guarantee water or sewer service in the event that service or service capacity is not available for any reason the property affected may be removed by ordinance from the service area without any liability attaching to the city d standards and specifications water sewer and reclaimed water construction improvements rehabilitation and repairs shall meet or exceed the requirements of the utilities manual of standards and specifications adopted as a supporting document of this chapter the manual of standards and specifications will be updated as necessary at the discretion of the city manager a copy of this manual can be purchased for a fee as set forth in appendix a to this payable to the city    541994   372012 definitions the following words and phrases as used in this chapter shall have the following meanings building permit shall have the same meaning as that in of this reclaimed water customer agreement means an agreement between the city and a bulk reclaimed water customer for the purchase and sale of reclaimed water that has been or may be approved by the council bulk reclaimed water user classification means golf courses that enter into an agreement with the city for the use of reclaimed water commercial means an establishment dealing in wholesale or retail trades or services including but not limited to hotels motels apartment houses rooming houses and trailers renting furnished or unfurnished offices stores restaurants churches schools and other facilities which hold themselves out to the public as places of business this includes governmentalinstitutional users such as city and county facilities schools hospitals and nursing homes customer means any person firm corporation or government entity using or receiving water reclaimed water or wastewater collection services from the city development means any installation siting construction use of land or other activity or improvement or any additional square footage area of a then existing building or use or any net increase in the size or use of a then existing building or land in a manner that is deemed to increase the demand for or impact upon any water and wastewater facility discontinuation of service means the cessation of utility services provided by the city to a customer equivalency factor is a factor used to represent the relative relationship between service connections based on water meter size the equivalency factor is determined by dividing the continuous flow criteria per meter size by the continuous flow criteria of a 58 inch meter as published by the american water works association and incorporated in fac 25 equivalent residential unit eru or equivalent residential connection erc is a unit of water usage that represents an average usage for a living accommodation for a single family or a nonresidential user one equivalent unit for a singlefamily unit water service shall be equal to a connection served by a 58 inch or 34inch water meter for purposes of this chapter one eru for water service equals 600 gallons per day and one eru for sewer service equals 300 gallons per day for multifamily residential units one eru for water service shall be equal to 70 percent of one singlefamily residential unit and one eru for sewer service shall be equal to 78 percent of one singlefamily residential unit fees means charges applied to customers for water sanitary sewer and reclaimed water services general service reclaimed water user classification means reclaimed water provided to 1 singlefamily residential units  2 multifamily residential units  or 3 commercial entities living unit or unit means any place of abode which is suitable for permanent or transient family or individual residential use each such living unit shall be considered as single and separate lot means any place division or parcel of land master control valve means the manually operated valve located immediately downstream after the meter which controls total flow to the customers property monthly base charge means a fee intended and imposed to recover the cost of having the system in place and prepared to serve the customer this charge is designed to recover all those capital expenses that are not recovered from separate charges and the debt service to pay the bonds or other indebtedness issues this monthly base charge also recovers the costs associated with meter readings billings postage and related expenses monthly base charges are applicable whether or not the property is occupied monthly consumption charge means a fee intended and imposed to recover the cost of providing for the collection and treatment of water and sewage such as chemicals electricity labor and other related expenses this charge is variable and depends on consumption as determined by the potable and reclaimed water meters multifamily residences or multifamily means all places of dwelling other than singlefamily residences specifically including those having two or more living units nonresidential means any business including commercial industrial institutional enterprise domiciliary houses resident schools hotels motels and all uses that are not residential nonresidential structure means any structure or use for other than a single or multifamily residence rates means monthly charges for water sanitary sewer and reclaimed water services reclaimed or reuse water means water that has received at least secondary treatment and basic disinfection from a domestic wastewater treatment facility and is reused irrigation water distribution system such water may be combined with surface water including stormwater and may be stored in an aquifer storage and recovery system prior to distribution reclaimed water system means the reclaimed or reuse water utility system operated by the city residence with guesthouse occupying the same premises shall be considered as a singlefamily residence if served by a single water connection and meter sanitary sewer system means the sanitary sewer or sewer utility system operated by the city service line means that conduit for utility service directly after the meter or delivery box fittings singlefamily residence or singlefamily means any singlefamily dwelling  it is interchangeable with the word household utility service means the provision of potable water sanitary sewer and reclaimed water citys urban service area urban service area means the boundaries of the area lying within the city and certain areas lying in unincorporated collier county for which water or sanitary sewer services or both are provided by the city water system means the water utility system operated by the city    541994   2192003   4162008   372012   422014    5212014 eff 1012014  editors note it should be noted that section 7 of provides as follows this ordinance shall take effect immediately upon adoption at second reading however the rates provided herein shall take effect on  cross reference definitions generally  12 illegal water or sewer connections a it shall be unlawful to make or cause to be made any connection with any main service pipe or other pipe used by or in connection with the city water andor sewer system for providing water andor sewer service to users in a manner so as to use or be supplied with water from the city without the water passing meter provided by the city and used for measuring and registering the quantity of water passing in a manner so as to serve or connect any existing or additional dwelling units or commercial developments to an existing meter without paying all systems development charges and connection fees for said additional dwelling units or commercial development or in a manner so as to enable a user to discharge into the sewer collection system of the city without paying all system development charges and connection fees for said sewer service violators of this section shall upon conviction be punished in accordance with section 115 the phrase water andor sewer includes reclaimed water b any person firm contractor corporation association or partnership who is found by the city to have made or caused to have made any connection prohibited by subsection a above shall be required by the city in addition to any penalties imposed by this violation of the above to pay the following to the city 1 an amount equal to three times the unpaid system development charges connection fees and water andor sewer service charges imposed by the city for such connection and water andor sewer service provided said fees and charges shall be computed using the rates in effect at the time of the discovery of said illegal connection for residential connections the water andor sewer service charges shall be estimated by using the average water andor sewer use for similar types and sizes of residential users during the entire period from the date a certificate of occupancy was issued for any dwelling unit found illegally connected to the system until the date of collection for commercial connections water andor sewer service charges shall be estimated by using the average water andor sewer use for similar types and sizes of commercial users during the entire period from the date a certificate of occupancy was issued for any portion of the project served until the date of collection 2 all costs of investigation and collection including time labor material attorneys fees court costs and professional fees of any kind necessitated to determine that such illegal connection existed c all persons firms contractors corporations associations or partnerships making or causing said connection to be made andor receiving the benefit of the water service shall be jointly and severally liable for the payment of the abovedescribed amounts to the city water service shall be discontinued to such persons firms contractors corporations associations or partnerships until said amount is paid in full in the event that any corporation is found to be liable for such sums and is not solvent or is without assets to make appropriate payment the individual officers directors and shareholders of such corporation shall be liable for such payment to the city    541994   372012 planting trees or shrubbery in easements any persons planting shrubbery trees or other plants in dedicated easements within the city does so at their own peril tree plantings shall not be placed over or within six feet of any water reclaimed water or sewer utility lines whenever plantings obstruct the ingress andor egress for the purposes of the easement they shall be removed upon request by the city and in the event of failure by the owner to so move them the city shall do so and the expense of same charged to the property owner when plantings placed over utility lines cause damage to the utilities systems the property owner shall bear the cost of repair or replacement of the damaged utilities    541994   372012 excavation permit required no person shall make any excavation or fill any excavation in any public place without first obtaining a rightofway permit refer to 16182 rightofway     511968   372012 rightofway permit fees the fee for obtaining a rightofway permit required under this chapter shall be as set forth in appendix a to this    541994   372012 relocation and protection of utilities during excavations the permittee shall not interfere with any existing facility without the written consent of the administrative authority and the owner of the facility if it becomes necessary to relocate an existing facility this shall be done by its owner or otherwise authorized by the owner no facility owned by the city shall be moved without prior written approval to accommodate the permittee and the cost of such work shall be borne by the permittee the cost of moving privately owned facilities shall be similarly borne by the permittee unless it makes other arrangements with the person owning the facility the permittee shall support and protect all pipes conduits poles wires or other apparatus which may be in any way affected by the excavation work and do everything necessary to support sustain and protect them under over along or across said work the permittee shall secure approval of method of support and protection from the owner of the facility in case any of said pipes conduits poles wires or apparatus should be damaged and for this purpose pipe coating or other encasement or devices are to be considered as part of a substructure the permittee shall promptly notify the owner thereof all damaged facilities shall be repaired by the agency or person owning them and the expense of such repairs shall be charged to the permittee it is the intent of this section that the permittee shall assume all liability for damage to facilities and any resulting damage or injury to anyone because of such facility damage and such assumption of liability is a contractual obligation of the permittee the only exception will be such cases where damage is exclusively due to the negligence of the owning utility the city shall not be made a party to any action because of this section the permittee shall inform itself as to the existence and location of all underground facilities and protect the same against damage    541994   372012 emergency excavation work nothing in this article shall be construed to prevent the making of such excavations as may be necessary for the preservation of life or property or for the location of trouble in conduit or pipe or for making repairs provided that the person making such excavation shall apply to the administrative authority for such a permit on the first working day after such work is commenced    541994   372012 monthly rates monthly rates for water sewer and reclaimed water provided within the citys urban service area shall be applicable to all customers receiving such service the rate structure for potable water sanitary sewer and reclaimed water service is comprised of monthly base rates and monthly consumption rates as follows 1 monthly base rates a water base rates 1 singlefamily residential commercial and potable water irrigation meter customers shall pay a monthly water base rate as determined by the size of the installed water meter 2 multifamily residential customers shall pay a monthly water base rate for each dwelling unit b sewer base rates 1 singlefamily residential customers shall pay a monthly sewer base rate of one equivalent residential unit 2 multifamily residential customers shall pay a monthly sewer base rate for each dwelling unit 3 commercial customers shall pay a monthly sewer base rate based on the equivalent residential unit as determined by the size of the installed water meter c reclaimed water base rates 1 general customers connected to the reclaimed water system shall pay a reclaimed water base rate based on the equivalent residential unit as determined by the size of the reclaimed water meter serving the property 2 where the reclaimed water service is available but not connected to the property general customers shall pay a monthly reclaimed water base rate 3 where the reclaimed water service is available but not connected to the property and the customer has a separate potable water irrigation meter general customers shall pay a reclaimed water base rate for the equivalent residential unit as determined by the size of the irrigation water meter d the monthly base rate for water sewer and reclaimed water shall be applicable whether occupied or not occupied 2 monthly consumption rates a water consumption rates 1 singlefamily residential and commercial customers shall pay a water consumption rate based upon the usage and size of the installed potable water meter 2 multifamily residential customers shall pay the water consumption rate based upon the usage and the number of dwelling units 3 singlefamily residential multifamily residential and commercial customers receiving potable water provided potable water irrigation meter shall pay a water consumption rate based upon the size of the installed potable water irrigation meter b sewer consumption rates 1 singlefamily residential and commercial customers shall pay a sewer usage rate based upon potable water consumption 2 multifamily residential customers shall pay a sewer usage rate based upon potable water consumption and the number of dwelling units 3 sewer consumption rates for singlefamily residential customers without a potable water irrigation meter or reclaimed water meter or submeter shall be capped at 10000 gallons per month 4 sewer consumption rates for multifamily residential customers without a potable water irrigation meter or reclaimed water meter or submeter shall be capped at 10000 gallons per month per dwelling unit 5 sewer consumption rates shall not be applicable to the use as measured by a potable water irrigation or reclaimed water meter c reclaimed water consumption rates 1 general and bulk customers shall pay a reclaimed water consumption rate based upon usage as measured by the reclaimed water meter 3 residential and nonresidential properties within the boundaries of the city shall pay the rates fees and charges for service as provided in appendix a fees and charges schedule to this 4 the rates for water sewer and reclaimed water services outside the boundaries of the city shall be the same as for customers inside the municipal boundaries except that in addition thereto a surcharge equal to 25 percent of such rates fees and charges shall be levied as provided in appendix a fees and charges schedule to this 5 annual index adjustment the city hereby adopts automatic annual rate adjustments to all water sewer and reclaimed water rates to provide for increases in expenses due to inflation or other such factors so as to always ensure adequate net revenues to pay for inflationary increases in operations and maintenance of the system and to provide all utilityrelated debt service coverage requirements of the city the adjustment shall be equal to the then current index pursuant to the united states consumer price index to a maximum of three percent indexed rate changes are to become effective with the first billing cycle for service rendered on or after october 1st of each fiscal year indicated  372012   352014    5212014 eff 1012014  other fees and charges a rates fees and charges other than monthly user fees include but are not limited to the following and the actual charge shall be as provided in appendix a fees and charges schedule to this 1 new accountschange of ownership 2 turnoffturnon at owners request 3 meter reread 4 meter test 5 meter lock 6 unlock after hours 7 meter removal 8 illegal connection 9 temporary meter deposit 10 duplicate bill processing fee 11 nonsufficient funds nsf processing charge 12 late
