impractical  that it must be in recordable form  and must be capable of describing the property for title and underwriting purposes c as may be applicable submittal of a statement of unified property control c if a zoning change is required the applicant shall submit a rezone petition simultaneously with the application for preliminary plat approval the city manager shall review the preliminary plat and if the city manager determines the plat to be in order notice of public hearing before the planning advisory board shall be advertised in a newspaper of general circulation in the city at least 15 days prior to the public hearing setting forth the date time and place of the public hearing the city manager shall notify owners of property located within 500 feet of the property involved in the petition informing them of the date time place and reason for the public hearing failure to notify all owners of property located within 500 feet by mail will not render any action taken on such petition void d at the public hearing the planning advisory board shall hear the petitioner or the petitioners designated representative and all other interested parties who may appear and request to be heard following the public hearing and after review of the preliminary plat the recommendation of the departments of the city and the rezone petition if applicable the planning advisory board shall submit its recommendation together with the minutes of the hearing to the city council as soon as practicable if rezoning is involved the recommendation will be made simultaneously on the preliminary plat and the rezoning after public hearing on the rezone petition e after considering the recommendation of the planning advisory board the city council may after an advertised public hearing by a majority vote of the council members present approve or disapprove the preliminary plat by resolution action on any rezone petition submitted simultaneously with the preliminary plat shall be taken by ordinance in accordance with section 4632 f after city council has approved the preliminary plan the subdivider shall have the construction plans and specifications prepared and shall submit copies thereof to the city manager for review see section 5433 for required information to be submitted with the construction plans if the construction plans fully comply with all construction requirements the city manager shall approve them and the subdivider may thereafter proceed with subdivision development subdivisions which have received preliminary plan approval may proceed in accordance with development standards which were in effect at the time of preliminary plan approval with the following exceptions if construction plan approval has not been granted within one year of preliminary plan approval or if the subdivision has not been completely developed within five years of preliminary plan approval the plan approval shall expire and the plans must be submitted for review and reapproval plans thus submitted for review and reapproval shall comply with all regulations in effect at the time the plans are resubmitted g record plats will be approved by the city council either when all improvements are completed in accordance with the approved construction plans or when security has been posted guaranteeing completion of improvements satisfactory in form to the city attorney and city council and equal in amount to 110 percent of the cost of all uncompleted improvements a registered engineer shall prepare the cost estimate and the estimate must be approved by the city manager and city council h the subdivider shall have a record plat prepared and submitted to the city manager along with an application and make application for record plat approval i when the city manager reports that the plat fully complies with all city requirements the city council may grant final approval to the record plat      2161994   911999   612011 preliminary plan approval a in addition to the requirements in section 5431 the following standards and requirements apply b along with the application for preliminary plan approval the subdivider shall furnish evidence in writing from appropriate state and county agencies that the preliminary plan complies with all state and county laws applicable thereto pending site specific information submittal requirements may include master utility plans environmental impact statement traffic impact statement and related infrastructure reporting c it is recognized that some forms of property development are not conducive to formal platting methods as required by general law for example platting of units subject to a ground lease or of air rights such types of plats may be approved if they otherwise meet the standards in this chapter and if shown to create units that are marketable under title standards d the city may waive preliminary or final plat requirements that are not necessary for the protection of the public welfare      612011 construction plan approval construction plans shall be furnished by the subdivider to the city manager and utility providers conforming to the site plan or subdivision plat final plats shall conform to the approved preliminary plat the city manager may allow deviations to the extent that they do not substantially amend the development as approved by council      612011 required certificates and approvals on final plat required certificates and approvals on the first page of the final plat subject to site specific requirements and provisions of fs certification city approvals to include engineer for the city surveyor for the city and city attorney certificate of approval of city council and certificate of approval of clerk of circuit court the 612011 secs 54375460  reserved article iii  design standards and improvement requirements streets a conformance with master plan the street system shall conform and be properly related to the master street plan which is a part of the comprehensive plan of the city b street extensions the street system shall recognize and extend suitable existing streets and shall make possible the future extension of streets into adjacent undeveloped land where appropriate c intersections with arterial streets subdivisions bounded by an arterial street shall be planned with widely spaced collector streets as main subdivision entryways from the arterial street local residential streets shall avoid intersecting arterial streets if possible d driveway intersections local residential streets shall be planned so that residential lots will not have drives onto arterial streets e angle of intersections intersections shall be as nearly at right angles as possible f type of intersections in residential areas t intersections are preferable to 4way intersections g half streets and reserve strips half streets and narrow reserve strips on subdivision boundaries shall not be allowed except when the reserve strip is dedicated as public land or is an approved controlled access strip h offset intersections street jogs with centerline offsets of less than 125 feet are prohibited i radius of curves a tangent of at least 100 feet in length shall be provided between reverse curves on collector streets the minimum radius of centerline curvature on collector streets shall be 400 feet j radius of curvature at intersections radius of curvature at back of curbline of street intersections shall be a minimum of 20 feet k private streets private streets are prohibited unless specifically approved as part of a land development innovation see section 5474 l width of rightofway 1 the minimum width of street rightofway shall be as follows a arterial streets 100 feet b collector i streets 100 feet c collector ii streets 80 feet d local residential streets 60 feet e turnaround diameter on deadend streets culsdesac 100 feet 2 subdivisions that adjoin existing streets which do not meet the minimum rightofway requirements shall provide the following additional rightofway a the entire rightofway shall be provided where any part of the subdivision is on both sides of the existing street b when the subdivision is located on only 1 side of an existing street 12 of the required rightofway shall be provided 3 engineering requirements may result in greater rightofway requirements than the minimums stated in this subsection for standard street cross sections refer to the city development specifications m curbs cement concrete curb curb and gutter or valley gutter as approved by the city shall be constructed along both sides of all streets except in the case of temporary street construction in which case the city council may waive the requirement for curb construction details refer to the city development specifications n pavement width minimum street pavement width measured from face to face of standing curb or pavement edge to pavement edge of valley gutter shall be as follows 1 arterial streets rightsofway for arterial streets which fall within new subdivisions shall be dedicated by the developer of that subdivision arterial streets are always state primary or secondary streets and construction participation by the developer is not required a developer who wishes to build a temporary street in the rightofway of a planned arterial street shall meet such requirements as the city council determines to be proper in that special case 2 collector i streets two 20foot pavements with a 12foot landscaped median strip are required for collector i streets the 12foot strip includes curbs at the edges of the median 3 collector ii streets minimum width of collector ii streets is 26 feet 4 local residential streets minimum width of local residential streets is 20 feet 5 deadend streets the paved turnaround diameter of deadend streets culsdesac shall be 80 feet minimum a landscaped cutout in the center of the turnaround is required pavement width around the turnaround shall be consistent with the pavement width leading up to the turnaround o construction specifications all streets in new subdivisions shall consist of a properly prepared subgrade an approved road base and an asphaltic concrete wearing surface for street construction details refer to the city development specifications    alleys alleys shall be provided at the rear of commercial and industrial properties except waterfront properties where utilized alleys shall be designed and constructed to accommodate their use by service vehicles alley rightofway width shall be a minimum of 20 feet    blocks a block lengths shall not normally exceed 1500 feet exceptions may be made when blocks border arterial streets or the waterfront or in other unusual design situations b corner lots shall be at least 15 percent wider at the front building lines than the minimum width permitted in the zoning district in which they are located c through lots and flag lots shall be avoided except where essential to provide separation of residential development from major streets or to overcome specific development disadvantages d side lot lines shall be substantially at right angles to or radial to street lines where practicable      422008 drainage an adequate storm drainage system including necessary curbs pipes culverts drop inlets bridges swale ditches ponds lakes and their outlets subsurface drains etc shall be provided for the proper drainage of surface water for construction details refer to the city development specifications    canals canal bottoms shall be a minimum of 5 feet below mean low water throughout the city mean low water is considered to be 109 feet below mean sea level canal depth at the seawall or base of riprap shall be a minimum of 1 foot below mean low water canal bottom side slopes shall be 3 horizontal to 1 vertical seawall tops or top of riprap shall be a minimum of 55 feet above mean low water the city council shall approve any riprap or seawall for seawall riprap and canal construction details refer to the city development specifications    sidewalks sidewalk locations shall be established by the city and indicated on the approved plat sidewalks may either be installed by the developer or left for later installation by lot owners the city may install sidewalks assessment sidewalk construction programs or if determined by the city council to be for the protection of the health safety and general welfare of the public the city may install or repair sidewalks and the cost of such construction may be paid from the revenues of the city    utilities a water service the city water system supplies water to all portions of the city no private potable water supplies will be permitted water distribution lines sized and placed in accordance with the city development specifications shall be installed and dedicated by the subdivider if water service to other areas will be facilitated by installing larger mains than necessary to serve the developers subdivision the city may require that the larger pipes be installed in this event the city shall pay the difference between the actual cost and the cost which would have been incurred had larger pipes not been required b sewer service most but not all of the city is served by the city sewerage system when city sewers are too remote for practical hookup waste disposal facilities acceptable to the county health department may be installed regardless of whether the subdivision will be initially connected to the city sewer system a subdivision sewage collection system sized and placed in accordance with the standards of the city development specifications connected to every building lot and suitable for future connection to the city sewer system shall be installed and dedicated by the developer the developer may connect the subdivision sewage collection system to a temporary sewage disposal plant until such time as the system is connected to the city sewerage system at which time city maintenance of the subdivision collection system shall begin c electric telephone and television cable service electric telephone and television cable service shall be provided to each building lot in accordance with the city development specifications all wiring including primary and secondary power lines street lighting circuits telephone lines and television cables shall be underground in zones r1e c1 and c1a an exception to the underground wiring requirement may be made by the city council in the case of temporary service installation or when the city council determines that underground installation is not economically or technically feasible    recreation areas and facilities each subdivision shall be served by recreation lands and facilities appropriate to the needs of the subdivisions future residents appropriate recreation areas and facilities will vary with the size and nature of the subdivision subdivision developers may either dedicate recreation lands to the city for public recreation areas or create recreation areas and facilities for the exclusive use of future residents of the subdivision gulffront subdivisions shall also contain public beach access parking facilities and beach area sufficient in size to accommodate future subdivision residents no specific recreation area or facilities requirement is made but the planning board and city council shall ensure that an appropriate amount of recreation land and facilities are included in each new subdivision    planting of street trees in rightofway  grassing of unpaved portions of rightofway street trees shall be installed along both sides of all subdivision streets all unpaved portions of rightsofway shall be seeded or sprigged    street numbers and names a street numbers street numbers shall be assigned by the city manager numbering shall be coordinated with the postal service emergency services property appraiser and other affected agencies b street names 1 the city council may approve the name of a platted rightofway and dedicated public easements platting process or when approving the subdivision of property abutting both sides of the rightofway a petition to name or rename an existing rightofway may also be initiated by the following a by direction of the city council  b by request of the county emergency services united states postal service or property appraisers office  c by submittal of a petition signed by the owners of 51 percent of the property fronting the rightofway as measured along the linear feet of the private property fronting the rightofway 2 upon receipt of a petition or direction of the city council to name or rename a platted rightofway the city manager shall process the request obtain clearance from the county emergency services the united states postal service and the property appraisers office and provide notice to all owners of property abutting the rightofway 30 days prior to consideration of the request by the city council the city council may approve a new name provided it has been cleared by all relevant agencies and meets the criteria outlined in subsection b3 of this section after approval by the city council all appropriate agencies shall be notified of the change and all maps plats and addressing shall be amended to be consistent with the change andor deemed amended for all official purposes 3 proposed streets which are obviously in alignment with others existing and named shall bear the assigned name of the existing streets in no case shall the name for a proposed street duplicate or be phonetically similar to existing street names and the fact that the name is sought to be distinguished only by employing a different designation of the type of public way such as street avenue boulevard drive place court and the like shall not suffice      282006   2192014  street name signs cityapproved street name signs shall be placed at each street intersection by the developer or upon request by the city with the cost payable by the developer    vehicular access to beaches in gulffront subdivisions access to the beach shall be provided at intervals of approximately 12 mile for the purpose of giving beach access to beach cleaning and maintenance equipment    permanent reference monuments permanent reference monuments shall be placed within the subdivision and on the exterior boundaries thereof so as to provide definite reference points from which may be located any points lines or lots shown on the plat    land development innovations a the standards of this chapter are matched to typical city subdivision development if a unique land development project is proposed incorporating design features which do not fully comply with all requirements of this chapter the project may be approved under the following conditions 1 an application for approval of a unique land development plan shall be submitted and processed in the manner set forth in this chapter if the proposed land development will require a change of zoning the rezone application shall be submitted along with and processed simultaneously with the subdivision plan 2 physical development quality of the proposed development must be equal to or better than that required by this chapter 3 adjacent properties must not be adversely affected 4 the spirit and intent of this chapter must be met and the proposed development must be an asset to the city b if the city council determines to approve the unique land development it may do so even though the development plans fail to meet all the requirements of this chapter in such event the city council may make such alternate or additional requirements as it finds to be necessary in the particular case c upon approval of a unique land development by the city council the development plans shall meet all requirements of this chapter except as modified by the terms of the city councils approval all approved variations from this chapter shall be clearly shown either on the approved development plans or shall be spelled out by the city council in its approval action    security guaranteeing completion of improvements a where the required improvements have not been completed prior to the submission of the record plat the approval of the plat shall be subject to the subdivider guaranteeing the installation of the improvements by filing a performance bond cashiers check or other security acceptable to the city attorney and city council in the amount of 110 percent of the construction cost as approved by the city manager whenever security guaranteeing performance is posted the security instrument may provide that portions of the security deposit proportionate to the work completed may be released to the subdivider as work progresses the amount to be released shall be determined by the city manager in accordance with the provisions of this subsection subject to the approval of the city council the cost of any state and federal documentary stamps and any other fees for recording security instruments shall be paid in cash to the city by the subdivider b amounts given as security in cash or by certified or cashiers check may at the option of the subdivider and with the approval of the city be deposited in an interestbearing account or invested in some other manner any interest which may be earned on such security furnished by a subdivider shall be due and payable to the subdivider upon satisfaction of the requirements and conditions of the bond    maintenance of improvements for a period of 1 year following city certification of completion and acceptance of the required subdivision improvements of each unit the subdivider shall be responsible under a performance or maintenance bond for performing any maintenance work deemed by the city to be the result of defective construction materials or installation    vacation of streets alleys easements and subdivision plats see section 4638      612011 supplemental standards article i  in general secs 5615630  reserved article ii  standards applicable to all districts applicability of article except as otherwise specifically provided the standards set out in this article shall be applicable to all districts  accessory structures construction of accessory structures may not precede construction of the principal building no accessory structure including boat docks and swimming pools shall be constructed upon a lot until the construction of the principal building has started comp dev    annexation classification a all territory which may hereafter be annexed to the city shall be automatically classified in accordance with the following table until otherwise changed by ordinance county zoning city zoning pud pd estates re rsf3 r110 rsf4 r175 rmf6 r36 rmf12 r312 rmf16 r315 c1 office o c2 convenience commercial hc highway commercial c3 intermediate commercial hc c4 general commercial hc c5 industrial hc il light industrial c3 ro recreationopen space ps public service gc golf course ps a2 rural agricultural re st special treatment c conservation b any county zoning not specifically identified in this chart will convert to re zoning until rezoned pursuant to fs   c the citys conservation designation is a zoning district not an overlay as is the countys special treatment district comp dev    boats on the beach a purpose the purpose and intent of this section is to establish regulations governing the storage of small boats on the city beach b definitions for the purposes of this section unless otherwise stated the following terms or words used herein shall be interpreted as follows boat means a vessel as defined in general law  however for purposes of this section boat is synonymous with small boat as defined below boats on the beach program means a program established by the city which has limited availability to allow small boats to be stored on the city beach on sand locations dinghy pavilions or rack locations dinghy pavilion means a shelter or a series of racks provided by the city for storing small boats located on city property program license means registration of small boats with the city for participation in the program license sticker means a sticker issued by the city location means a space assigned to a properly licensed boat program means the boats on the beach program public property means property owned by the city within the citys rightofway or over which the city or a public entity has jurisdiction resident means an individual whose residence is within the city whether fulltime or parttime regardless of domicile sand location means beach locations where small boats primarily sailboats may be stored program seasonal space means spaces in the program provided on city property that are available for licensed use small boat means a sailboat rowboat or similar small boat without a motor which does not require licensing or registration by the state of florida yearround space means spaces in the program provided on city property that are available for licensed use on an annual basis c availability of program locations the city manager will attempt to provide up to 31 yearround sand locations and 11 seasonal sand locations for sailboats 16 feet or less in overall length and 18 locations at dinghy pavilion and rack locations combined  however the city manager will attempt to increase the number of combined dinghy pavilion and rack locations to 52 over time failure to do so does not create a cause of action on behalf of any person d rules and regulations the following rules and regulations shall apply to boats in the program the city manager is authorized to revoke any program license should the boat owner fail to adhere to any of the following regulations 1 all boats placed on the beach for longer than 24 hours and boats stored at a dinghy pavilion or rack location shall be licensed annually with the city manager in accordance with the published licensing process and the licensing sticker visibly displayed on the rear left side of the boat yearround licensing stickers shall be effective from october 1 of the year issued of the following year and seasonal licensing stickers shall be effective from november 1 of the year issued of the following year or as otherwise established by the city manager 2 unless otherwise approved by the city manager licensing and storage of more than one boat in any space is prohibited 3 licenses shall be limited to one person per household and are nontransferable 4 boat owners shall notify the city manager of the sale of their licensed boat within five days of the transaction and if the boat occupies a publicly owned program location it shall be removed from that location within five days of the transaction unless the city assigns the same space to the buyer failure to do so will prohibit the seller and buyer from obtaining future program licenses 5 for boats stored at any of the citys public beach access points dinghy pavilions or rack locations the boat owner shall license the boat with the city at which time the following items shall be required and the owner shall provide the following a a signed license agreement for storage on the beach including indemnification of the city for the right to place the boat on the beach b a certificate of insurance with $10000000 minimum liability coverage naming the city of naples florida as additional insured c proof of residence to confirm local notification ability and local availability and to confirm eligibility for the program two forms of proof shall be required d a picture of the boat e a name and telephone number for emergency contact 6 if the boat is stored on private property by property owners or lessees of property adjacent to the beach the boat owner may store the small boat on the sandy beach immediately seaward of the vegetated dune on the property or on public property immediately seaward of their property provided the boat is licensed with the city in accordance with program requirements at which time the following items shall be required and the owner shall provide the following a a signed license and indemnification of the city for the right to place the boat on the beach b proof of residence to confirm local notification ability and local availability d a picture of the boat e a name email address and telephone number for emergency contact f documentation of permission from the owner of private property if applicable 7 boats must always be maintained in good repair and kept seaworthy and in operating condition 8 boats must be used quarterly 9 halyards must be tied to prevent them from banging against the mast and creating noise 10 boats must be anchored at sand locations or secured at dinghy pavilions and racks in accordance with the published anchoring requirements 11 no boat shall encroach upon the vegetated dune even on a temporary basis 12 no boat trailers or other boat storage devices shall be stored on the beach even on a temporary basis 13 when a boat owner licenses a boat and receives a licensing sticker for participation in the program the boat owner agrees to a abide by all sections of this adhere to the following storm and emergency condition notifications for the removal of boats from the beach 1 during condition 1 72 hours prior to storm landfall the boat owner must immediately check the boat to ensure that the tiedown is properly attached the boat owner is required to check the boat each morning prior to  am 2 during condition 2 48 hours prior to storm landfall the boat owner must immediately remove the boat from the beach but is licensed to store the boat on the paved parking areas of the beach ends owned by the city once condition 2 has passed the boat owner is required to place the boat back on the beach area within 48 hours 3 during condition 3 24 hours prior to storm landfall the boat owner is required to remove the boat from the general beach area due to a projected storm the boat cannot be returned to the beach area until city staff notifies boat owners or public announcements have been issued stating that condition 3 has ended if a boat is not removed during condition 3 the city shall cause a private towing service to remove and store the vessel the boat owner shall be responsible for all towing and storage fees c follow the storm and emergency conditions upon the broadcast of an emergency identified by the city manager or hurricane watch or warning from the national weather service by the city the city manager will issue a news release to local radio and television stations informing residents of the need to remove boats stored on the beach during an emergency high tides or severe weather however if the city does not issue such news release or the local radio and television stations do not broadcast the news release the boat owner is responsible for removing the owners boat from the beach during extremely high tides or severe weather and is responsible for any damage to or any damage caused by the boat under any conditions d assume total responsibility for any damage to the boat or caused by the boat e refrain from dragging a boat upon or across a vegetated dune or placing or maintaining a boat upon a vegetated dune under no circumstances may boats be permanently or temporarily placed on the vegetated dune 14 boats licensed for storage at sand locations on publicly owned beach access points shall be stored as follows a boats shall be only on the public rightofway which extends seaward of the beach access points authorized by the city manager and shall be placed in the specific location authorized by the license b all boats shall be stored on the sandy beach immediately seaward of these beach access points within the rightofway c the beach access points selected by the city manager have been identified as appropriate for the storage of boats because at the time of adoption of the ordinance from which this section is derived sufficient sandy beach existed during normal conditions to provide for the storage of boats without interfering with the safe use of the beach by the public should beach conditions change over time or following a storm event where sufficient sand no longer exists at licensed sand locations the city manager shall have the authority to relocate boats to beach access points where sufficient sand exists to restrict the program or to reduce the number of sand locations available for licensed public use d the storage of any boat seaward of any other beach access point not identified in the program publication provided by the city manager is specifically prohibited e any boat found on property not approved by the city manager as an approved beach access point and which does not meet the provisions of this be considered to be in violation of this enforcement shall be as provided in subsection e of this section f no boat shall be located in front of or in such a way as to interfere with the pedestrian or dune crossovers or other pedestrian accessways g all boats shall be located in such a way as to allow for and not interfere with pedestrians walking on the beach above the normal high tide line h no boat trailers or other boat storage devices shall be stored on the beach even on a temporary basis i anchor boats in accordance with the published anchoring requirements 15 boats licensed for storage at dinghy pavilions and racks shall be stored as follows a dinghy pavilions and racks are intended to provide storage locations for boats licensed with the program that are singlehulled boats with unstayed masts and less than 15 feet long lasers sunfish phantoms kayaks paddleboards and similar nonmotorized types that do not require registration by the state b boats must be secured in accordance with the published anchoring requirements c boats may not be beached for extended periods at the waters edge and such beaching will be in the course of active use of the boat d all license holders using the storage rack will cooperate with each other in use of this facility e enforcement the department designated by the city manager shall enforce this section of the following mechanisms 1 if the owner of a licensed boat violates any part of this section the city manager may cancel or revoke the license and require the removal of the boat by the boats owner 2 if the owner of a licensed boat violates any part of this section the city may remove the boat the city shall not be responsible for the condition of or any damage to the boat upon removal of the boat the city shall impound the boat for 30 days after which the city shall have full authority to sell or dispose of the boat the owner of the boat shall be responsible for boat removal and towing charges in addition to a fee as set forth in appendix a to this each day or part thereof that the boat is impounded the city may place a lien on the boat owners property if the costs are not paid with interest at the legal rate in florida 3 prior to revocation nonrenewal or removal the city manager will provide for an informal hearing a hearing is not required in emergency circumstances f storage other than on beach this section does not apply to boats stored on private property and not on the beach see section 5685 pertaining to boat and trailer storage in dwelling districts for regulations regarding boats stored on private property and not on the beach g reassignment of spaces if a licensed space is vacant for 60 days the space will be considered abandoned by the owner and the space may be reassigned if a boat owner is out of the area for more than 60 days the boat owner shall notify the city manager of the time period the boat owner will be gone the space may be reassigned during the duration of the boat owners leave the boat owner will have the space returned to the boat owner upon the boat owners return h licensing available only to city residents licensing of boats on the beach as provided in this section shall only be available to city residents to participate in the program a parttime resident must live within the city at a residential property i fees a nonrefundable fee structure adopted by resolution of city council shall be as set forth in appendix a to this j licensing of boats  duties of owner interested small boat owners may apply for an annual license for the program by submitting an application form to the city manager in accordance with the published licensing process small boat owners may renew their license in accordance with the published licensing process provided the boat owner has complied with all program rules and regulations if all program locations are licensed at the time of application the boat owner may elect to pay the wait list fee and be placed on the program wait list k program termination and restrictions the city may cancel or terminate the program with a 30day notice to license holders with a prorated refund to be given to the boat owner in the event of a natural disaster the city may terminate the program with less than a 30day notice and may also restrict licensed boat owners from returning their boat to its licensed location for a period to be determined by the city manager if necessary comp dev      942002   12152004   1 262019 building dimensions maximum permitted a single building no multifamily or transient lodging building shall exceed 200 feet in width or length in any residential district office district or pd district intended for residential transient lodging or office use no such building shall extend beyond the boundaries of an imaginary square of 200 feet in length and 200 feet in width the dimensional restriction shall apply to the entire building and shall not be limited to any individual building facade b attached buildings the maximum dimension of any group of attached structures shall not exceed 200 feet in any residential district office district or pd district intended for residential transient lodging or office use no such group of attached structures shall extend beyond the boundaries of an imaginary square of 200 feet in length and 200 feet in width the dimensional restriction shall apply to the entire group of attached buildings and shall not be limited to any individual building facade comp dev      4192006 fallout shelters fallout shelters are permitted as principal or accessory uses and structures in any district subject to the minimum yard requirements of the district such shelters may contain or be contained in other structures or may be constructed separately  and in addition to shelter use may be used for any principal or accessory use permitted in the district subject to the district regulations on such use fallout shelters may not be placed in front yards and shall not be used for principal or accessory uses prohibited expressly or by implication in the district comp dev    fences and walls a definitions as used in this section building envelope means the buildable area of a parcel as determined by the applicable setbacks fence and wall mean a vertical structure placed on a property to serve as an enclosure barrier boundary screen or ornamental feature walls are typically solid opaque structures constructed of stone or masonry fence types include solid split rail picket and chain link and are typically constructed of wood vinyl aluminum or wrought iron finished grade means the contours of a land area altered by human intervention natural grade means the natural contours of a land area generally unaltered by human intervention b standards for all zoning districts except for r115a residence see section 58124 c commercial i industrial and d downtown 1 height the maximum permitted fence or wall heights are as follows a side rear yards and adjacent building envelope six feet b front yard within building envelope six feet including appurtenances gate posts gates and other architectural embellishments except that fence posts are permitted to be six feet six inches with a minimum spacing of six feet between posts except for gates c front yard outside building envelope three feet maximum fence or wall height fence or wall height shall not exceed three feet except as follows 1 fence posts shall not exceed six inches above the fence they are supporting fence posts that extend above the allowable fence height must maintain a minimum spacing of six feet between posts except for gates 2 in addition to the three feet decorative metalwork or materials providing a similar appearance not to exceed 18 inches is permitted 3 gates shall not exceed a height of six feet including architectural embellishments gate posts shall not exceed a width of two feet four inches and may extend six inches taller than the gate they are supporting 4 on properties with more than one front yard a fence meeting the minimum requirements necessary to comply with the florida building pool safety may extend into the required front yard 5 pool safety fences may be built to the minimum height necessary to meet florida building in required side and rear yards d barbed wire fences shall not be permitted in the front rear or side yards excluding cityowned property e the height of a retaining wall is measured from the average elevation of the crown of road along the property frontage to the top of the finished grade and shall be governed by section 5654 yards the total height of walls extending above finished grade shall be governed by this section 2 maximum opening maximum fence or wall opening width shall not apply if a gate is not installed 3 driveways the maximum number of driveways per fence or wall is two the width of a driveway on a fence or wall with one driveway shall not exceed 20 feet a single fence or wall that accommodates two driveways may be permitted two gates and four gate posts under the following conditions a no appurtenances other than gate posts and gates shall be allowed on the fence or wall that accommodates two driveways b each driveway shall not exceed 15 feet in width 4 openings without a driveway fences or walls that do not accommodate a driveway shall be permitted a maximum of two wall openings per single fence or wall fence or wall openings shall be limited to ten feet in width and shall be spaced at a minimum of 30 feet 5 base point for measurement the base point for measurement of fence or wall height shall be determined as follows a within building envelope finished grade at the fence or wall location b outside building envelope the lower of a the natural grade at the fence or wall location  or b the crown of the road ground level may not be altered for purposes of allowing a higher fence or wall c for residential properties abutting nonresidential uses or zoning including mixed use the base point of measurement for fences and walls along the abutting side and rear property lines may be the higher finished grade either inside or outside the fence or wall measurement is taken one foot from the fence or wall 6 determination of base point the city manager is hereby authorized to determine the base point for the fence or wall height measurement based onsite conditions and site elevations provided on a certified survey 7 exceeding height of adjacent fence or wall new fences or walls along property lines shall not exceed the tallest point of an existing adjacent fence or wall by more than six inches 8 landscaping property owners are encouraged to screen walls and fences from street view and adjacent properties with landscaping 9 chainlink fences chainlink fences are prohibited in front yards except on a temporary basis as elsewhere expressly permitted in this 10 exceptions for those properties located west of gulf shore boulevard and gordon drive which abut a platted public beach access the city manager may approve a fence or wall up to six feet in height in the required front yard setback along such platted public beach access in such circumstances unless special conditions do not permit the fence or wall shall be set back a minimum of 18 inches from the property line abutting the street rightofway or beach access and planted with sufficient landscaping material to buffer the fence or wall the landscaping material shall be planted on the street side of the wall or fence entirely within the private property if the fence or wall provides openings so that visibility fence or wall is unobstructed by less than 50 percent density such as a picket fence the landscaping requirement may be waived in addition the city manager may approve a fence or wall up to four feet in height in the required front yard along gulf shore boulevard or gordon drive upon determination that such fence or wall does not interfere with the required corner visibility and that it provides openings so that visibility fence or wall is unobstructed by less than 50 percent density c commercial downtown and industrial districts 1 maximum height the maximum fence or wall heights are as follows a side and rear yards six feet b front yard within building envelope six feet c front yard outside building envelope 3 feet d barbed wire fences shall not be permitted in the front rear or side yards 2 height measurement the base point for measurement of fence or wall height shall be determined as follows a within building envelope finished grade at the fence or wall location b outside building envelope the lower of a the natural grade at the fence or wall location  or b the crown of the road ground level may not be altered for purposes of allowing a higher fence or wall c the city manager is hereby authorized to determine the base point for the fence or wall height measurement based onsite conditions and site elevations provided on a certified survey d new fences or walls along property lines shall not exceed the tallest point of an existing adjacent fence or wall by more than 6 feet e for properties with nonresidential uses or zoning including mixed use that abut residential zoning or properties the base point of measurement for fences and walls along the abutting side and rear property lines may be the higher finished grade either inside or outside the fence or wall measurement is taken one foot from the fence or wall 3 chainlink fences no chainlink or similar type fence is permitted in any front yard area in any zone district except c commercial and i industrial zone districts chainlink fences are prohibited in the d downtown district in front yards except on a temporary basis as elsewhere expressly permitted in this 4 walls walls built within the permitted building envelope as determined by the applicable setbacks shall be permitted to be constructed to a height consistent with the permitted height of the principal structure provided the wall is architecturally structurally and substantially integrated with the principal structure by a roof or other physical connection walls that are not architecturally and structurally integrated with the principal structure by a roof or other physical connection shall be limited to the wall height as specified in subsections c1a and c of this section d additional regulations 1 dumpster enclosures are regulated by section 5652a b and c 2 horticultural growth and support therefor such as arched arbors or trellises are regulated by section 5654a2 and 3 e waivers 1 administrative waiver the city manager may grant administrative waivers up to 6 inches above the permitted fence or wall height upon documentation that a the fence or wall was completed under a valid building permit  b the approved plans include the permitted fence or wall height properly dimensioned  and c the city manager determines that unusual site conditions exist to support the request that the fence or wall be permitted to exceed the permitted height 1 if any of the above criteria are not met the city manager shall require the waiver process be followed as described in subsection e2 of this section 2 an administrative waiver shall only apply to an existing fence or wall and shall not apply to any reconstruction or future construction 2 standard waiver a applicability certain fence and wall requirements may be waived due to special factors related to but not limited to the following 1 lot size  2 lot orientation  3 lot location  4 orientation and design of structures on the lot  5 orientation and design of the fence or wall b standards for approval when determining a waiver to fence and wall requirements the city council shall consider the following 1 safety in regard to the subject property adjacent properties streets alleyways and water bodies  2 visual impact on adjacent properties streets alleyways and water bodies  3 design in relation to other structures on the same lot adjacent properties and the neighborhood  4 impact on ingress and egress if applicable  and 5 screening buffering or separation of any nuisance or hazardous feature 6 compatibility with adjacent properties c method of approval a waiver from fence and wall requirements may be approved by resolution of the city council after a petition for such waiver has been submitted to the city manager 3 review and approval procedure a petitions for waiver from fence and wall requirements may be obtained from the city manager and may be initiated by the owner of the property or the owners designated representative this petition must be completed and returned to the city manager along with the fee set forth in appendix a to this the necessary supportive materials as required by the city manager including the following 1 site plan  2 architectural elevations of the proposed fence or wall and facade of the principal structure on the lot b the city manager shall notify owners of property located within 500 feet of the property involved in the petition informing them of the date time place and reason for the public hearing failure to notify all owners of property within 500 feet by mail will not render any action taken on such petition void c the city council may by resolution grant or deny the waiver or grant it with certain conditions such conditions when required by city council shall be made a part of the approving resolution violation of such conditions which are made a part of the terms under which the waiver is granted shall be considered a violation of this waiver from fence and wall requirements may be approved by a majority vote of the councilmembers present and voting comp dev      8181999   11192001   12182002   9192007   232010 gate houses no gate house shall be constructed with a floor area greater than 100 square feet gate houses may encroach on the front yard required of a principal structure but shall have a minimum front yard requirement of 20 feet in any district and shall meet the normal minimum side yard requirements for the district in which the gate house is located comp dev    height requirements exceptions thereto a chimneys elevator shafts or overruns stair tower roofs rooftop heating ventilating and air conditioning equipment ornamental screening for such equipment energy producing devices such as solar panels and wind turbines and architectural embellishments may extend 7 feet above the peak of the building roof  however in no case shall the maximum commercial building height limit of 42 feet as measured from the required 1st floor elevation be exceeded to accommodate such structure or equipment rooftop heating ventilating and air conditioning equipment and ornamental screening for such equipment are not exempt in singlefamily residence districts see fences walls and screening regulations flat roof areas that are at or above the maximum allowable height or enclosed by a railing parapet architectural embellishment or ornamental screening that extends above the maximum allowable height may not be made accessible by means of a fixed ladder stairway or elevator  however hatches may be provided for maintenance purposes b in singlefamily residence districts exemptions to the maximum height requirement may only extend a maximum of 5 feet above the maximum height requirement in singlefamily zoning districts c for any building the aggregate area of the bases of architectural embellishments and ornamental screening shall not exceed 10 percent of the buildings roof area comp dev      532000   952001   232010 lot coverage maximum permitted a generally within districts r36 r312 r3t12 r315 r3t18 r318 and hc and pd for multifamily residences and transient lodging facilities or nursing group or rest homes the combined area of a lot or parcel of land occupied by all principal and accessory buildings and roofed structures except for covered motor vehicle parking structures shall not exceed the percentage given in the following table for various heights of buildings such height of building being the height of the highest principal building on the lot height of building percent of lot area 300 feet or less 25 301 feet to 400 feet 24 401 feet to 500 feet 23 501 feet to 600 feet 22 601 feet to 700 feet 21 701 feet to 800 feet 20 801 feet to 870 feet 19 b buildings utilizing ground floor parking for buildings not subject to the coastal construction control line wherever a minimum of 34 of the ground floor is to be devoted to enclosed motor vehicle parking and wherever there are to be no dwelling units located on the ground floor except for 1 managers dwelling unit such ground floor area shall not be counted in the determination of the building height relative to the permitted lot coverage specified in subsection a of this section c additional lot coverage 1 separate singlelevel garage structures in addition to the percentages of maximum lot coverage specified in subsection a of this section an area not to exceed 10 percent of the combined area of a lot or parcel of land may be devoted solely to singlelevel structures used exclusively for motor vehicle parking 2 parking within principal building a the basic permitted lot coverage by all principal and accessory buildings and roofed structures except for covered motor vehicle parking structures may be increased by 5 percent if at least 23 of the minimum required parking in r36 r312 and r3t12 districts and pd districts designated for multifamily or transient lodging use or 12 of the minimum required parking in r315 and r318 districts is located within the applicable principal building and the applicable principal building is not subject to the coastal construction control line b the basic permitted lot coverage by all principal and accessory buildings and roofed structures except for covered motor vehicle parking structures may be increased by 5 percent if at least 12 of the minimum required parking in the r3t18 district is located within the applicable principal building d definition for purposes of this section lot coverage is defined as that percentage of a lot or parcel of land that is covered or occupied by all buildings including accessory buildings under the terms of this land development code 1 fences shuffleboard courts swimming pools barbecue pits terraces and other structures not roofed over shall not be included in computing coverage 2 balconies and means of egress shall be included in determining building coverages if either of the following conditions exists and to the extent that such conditions exist a balconies and means of egress project more than 6 feet from the building wall of any floor b the combined length of balconies and means of egress on any 1 floor level along a building wall measured parallel to the building wall exceeds 50 percent of the length of the wall e exception for public parking garages located in commercial zoning districts the maximum lot coverage allowed in the district may be exceeded as approved by the city council required conditional use process comp dev      952001 mechanical equipment a mechanical equipment installed with new construction or with additions or alterations exceeding 50 percent of the assessed value of the existing structure may not be located in a required yard regardless of the height or projection of the equipment air conditioning and pool equipment permitted and installed prior to the effective date of this ordinance may be maintained and replaced provided the new equipment does not encroach more than 36 inches into any required yard new generators may be installed adjacent to existing single family homes permitted and constructed prior to the effective date of this ordinance provided that the new equipment does not encroach more than 36 inches into any required side yard all new and replaced mechanical equipment must be screened from view to the full height of the equipment consistent with all applicable fencing and landscaping requirements and manufacturers specifications screening walls and fences around replacement equipment may exceed the allowable height limitations provided the height is the minimum required to screen from view to the full height of the equipment and the projection into the required yard is the minimum encroachment necessary per manufacturers specifications b in all zone districts except c3 c4 and i heating ventilating and air conditioning equipment and ductwork and the like located on building rooftops shall be shielded from ground level view within 1000 feet of the building if shielding cannot be accomplished by judicious placement of the equipment ornamental screening visually compatible with the building is required c permanently installed generators within 15 feet of a property line shall use propane natural gas or fuel with similar exhaust impacts gasoline or diesel powered generators shall be prohibited within 15 feet of a property line d automatic cycling of generators shall take place between  am and  pm monday comp dev      12202006 mobile homes and travel trailers a except as provided in this section no mobile home travel trailer travel camper or other vehicle which may be regularly or periodically utilized for dwelling purposes or temporary or mobile units intended for a commercial use shall be parked overnight in the city unless parked in an area specifically designated for this purpose by the city manager unless a temporary use permit has been granted by the city council or unless unoccupied and parked or stored in a completely enclosed building a mobile home or other such vehicle parked in the same location for more than 1 hour between the hours of  pm and  am is presumed to have parked overnight b in residentially zoned districts unoccupied motor homes travel trailers travel campers or other vehicles utilized for dwelling purposes may receive approval from the city manager for a permit to park overnight for a period of no more than 2 consecutive nights and only on private property with the permission of the private property owner and only on a noncommercial basis c unoccupied motor homes travel trailers travel campers or other vehicles utilized for dwelling purposes and used for transportation of visitors to the city to visit friends or members of the visitors family residing in the city may obtain a permit from the city manager to park upon the premises of the visited family or friends for 2 nights d the city manager may approve a permit for a motor home of a visitor for a longer period of time if such vehicle has handicapped facilities and such facilities are a necessity for a person visiting comp dev    motor vehicles unlicensed or inoperable no wrecked junked or inoperable motor vehicles or motor vehicle without a valid license tag shall be parked or stored in any zoning district unless expressly permitted by this land development code or unless stored in a completely enclosed building comp dev    ornamental buffers ornamental buffers shall be a minimum of 6 feet high unless a different height is established by the city council for a particular situation and shall be composed of structural or plant materials within 1 year of installation and at all times thereafter ornamental buffers shall be at least 75 percent opaque and shall be maintained in a neat attractive condition failure to meet the standard of opaqueness or appearance set out in this section shall constitute a zoning violation details of the ornamental buffer shall be shown on the building plans which are submitted to the city manager as a part of the application for a building permit and must be approved by the city manager prior to the issuance of a building permit for the development of the site comp dev    pools a singlefamily and multifamily residential lots all swimming pools enclosures or decks constructed or erected on any singlefamily or multifamily residential lot except in the re rural estates zoning district shall be subject to the following regulations 1 location generally unroofed pools or pools enclosed only with open mesh screening may be placed in a required rear yard subject to the limitations of subsection a2 of this section but shall not be placed in a required front or side yard unscreened and unroofed pool decks may extend into required yards provided they comply with the height restrictions listed in this section 2 distance from rear lot line unroofed pools or pools enclosed only with open mesh screening may be located in rear yard setback areas but may not be closer than 15 feet to any rear lot line provided that no pool or pool enclosure shall be placed within a utility or drainage easement 3 setback measurement the minimum setback requirement from any lot line shall be measured from the exterior of the screen enclosure of a screenenclosed pool or from the outer edge of the pool for an unroofed or unenclosed pool 4 roofed or enclosed pools if any part of a pool is covered by a roof or enclosed by walls over 6 feet in height then such covered or walled section of the pool shall be subject to the limitations regarding location of any building or structure and shall not be placed in any required yard 5 construction on vacant lot other sections of this comprehensive development code prohibit the construction of a swimming pool on a vacant lot 6 height pools and pool decks extending into required primary structure rear yards and unscreened and unroofed pool decks extending into required side yards may not exceed a height of 30 inches above the crown of the road with an additional 6 inches of height for every 12 inches of horizontal distance permitted from either the side or rear property lines whichever is closer up to a maximum height of 6 feet b other property all swimming pools and enclosures constructed or erected on any lot other than a singlefamily or multifamily residential lot shall meet the minimum yard requirements as specified for buildings or structures in the zoning district in which the pool or enclosure will be constructed or erected the minimum setback requirements from any lot line shall be measured from the exterior of the screen enclosure of a screenenclosed pool and from the outer edge of the pool for an unroofed or unenclosed pool c compliance with other regulations it shall be unlawful for any person to erect construct or cause to be installed a private swimming pool upon any property located in the city without conforming to this section or without conforming to the florida building the zoning ordinance of the city d permit 1 no permit shall be issued for a private swimming pool unless the requirements are adhered to as set forth by the application for permit and permits sections of the florida building together with all provisions of this 2 no permit shall be issued for a private swimming pool unless the name of a registered architect or structural engineer shall appear on the face of the drawing submitted 3 no permit shall be issued for a private swimming pool unless the sanitary operation of such pool shall be of a recirculation type system employing a disinfectant fill and drain or continuous flow systems will not be accepted as a method of sanitary operation 4 this subsection d is hereby declared to be in the interest of the public welfare and health of the general public comp dev      12202006   342015  private clubs private clubs are permitted in all zone districts except the singlefamily zone districts provided that the particular use and purpose of the club is permitted in the zone district in which it is to be located comp dev    property numbering a system established property abutting upon the streets of the city shall be numbered as follows 1 property abutting on streets crossing central avenue or running at right angles thereto shall be numbered north and south from central avenue beginning with the numbers 1 and 2 respectively and numbering away from central avenue the numbers north from central avenue shall be designated as number 1 north or number 2 north and the numbers south from central avenue shall be designated as number 1 south or number 2 south etc the numbering upon those streets so crossing central avenue shall be made so as to place all odd numbers upon the lefthand side of the street going away from central avenue in each direction as the numbers increase and the even numbers on the righthand side of the street crossing central avenue going away from central avenue in either direction 100 numbers shall be allowed for each block 50 odd numbers on the lefthand side and 50 even numbers on the righthand side in the residential sections of the city 3 feet of street frontage shall be allowed for each number and in the business section 2 feet of street frontage shall be allowed for each number 2 property abutting on all streets running east and west shall be numbered from the gulf of mexico beginning with the numbers 1 and 2 respectively and numbering away from the gulf of mexico the numbers on the lefthand side going away from the gulf of mexico shall be odd numbers 100 numbers shall be allowed for each block 50 odd numbers on the lefthand side and 50 even numbers on the righthand side in the residential sections of the city 4 feet of street frontage shall be allowed for each number and in the business section 3 feet shall be allowed for each number b assignment of numbers the city manager is hereby required to furnish to all property owners or occupants upon request the proper number of their property and is authorized to fix the correct number wherever the occupancy of the property is such as to render doubtful the correct numbering c posting of numbers 1 the owners of all houses stores and other improved property are hereby required to have their premises properly numbered for 1 or 2family dwellings properly numbered shall mean the conspicuous placement of arabicstyled reflective numerals at least 4 inches high on the main structure or 2 inches high on both sides of a mailbox or a separate post in such a manner and of such a size as to be readily visible and legible from the street for multifamily and all commercial occupancies properly numbered shall mean the placement of arabicstyled reflective numerals at least 6 inches high in such a manner and of such a size as to be readily visible and legible from the street 2 owners of commercial property that have rear access doors that are accessible from either an alley parking lot driveway or sidewalk shall also place the required numerals at least 6 inches high on the rear access doors 3 owners of waterfront property shall also place the required numerals on a dock seawall or separate post adjacent to the waterway 4 any owners of such premises failing to properly number their improved property as required herein shall be cited with a notice to appear before the city code enforcement board 5 prior to issuance of a certificate of occupancy or final inspections whichever is applicable all occupancies must be numbered in accordance with this section comp dev      331999 satellite antennas towers and masts a purpose this section is hereby declared remedial and is enacted to secure the public safety health and general welfare strength and stability and for safety to life and property from fire or other hazards incident to the construction repair and use of television masts and antennas  to maintain and enhance the attractive appearance of the city  to carry out the community goals and objectives expressed in the comprehensive plan  to protect and enhance the citys appearance and the citys natural amenities  and in recognition of the open extensive lawn areas which are not conducive to the indiscriminate placement of antennas b definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning antenna means any device or array of elements used in the reception or distribution of television signals including without limitation microwave and satellite earth station dish antennas tower means any upright support or mast for an antenna whether using selfsupporting or guyed construction c materials and structure towers masts and antennas shall be of noncombustible and corrosionresistant material  shall not be bright shiny garish or reflective of light  and shall be designed and installed to withstand a wind load of 110 miles per hour all applications for the installation of satellite dish antennas shall include certification from an engineer licensed in the state that such installation will meet this structural requirement d insurance for installers liability and property damage insurance in the minimum amount of $30000000 combined single limit liability shall be carried by any person licensed to install antennas in the city to cover any losses occasioned by the licensees e stop work orders upon notice from the building official that work on any structure is being done contrary to the provisions of this section or in a dangerous or unsafe manner such work shall be immediately stopped such notice shall be in writing and shall be given to the owner of the property or to the owners agent or to the person doing the work and shall state the conditions under which work may be resumed where an emergency exists no written notice shall be required to be given by the building official f correction of unsafe conditions all towers masts and antennas which are unsafe or which constitute a fire hazard or are otherwise dangerous to human life by reason of inadequate maintenance dilapidation or abandonment are hereby declared illegal and shall be abated by repair or demolition in accordance with the following procedure 1 a 10day notice shall be given to the owner of the tower mast or antenna which is in violation of this section to correct the violation within the 10day period or to remove it from the property 2 failure to do this will subject the owner to the penalties provided in section 4640 in addition thereto the city may forthwith declare the structure to be a nuisance and proceed to abate the nuisance as provided by law g location 1 no antenna shall be installed or replaced on the street or beach side of any lot 2 no dish antenna larger than 3 feet in diameter shall be mounted on a roof in any singlefamily residential zone district 3 a dish antenna larger than 3 feet in diameter may only be mounted on a roof in a commercial or multifamily residential zone district if it is shielded from ground level view within 1000 feet of the building 4 all components of an antenna shall conform to the building setbacks required in the zone district in which it is located h advertising advertising or identification on an antenna shall be limited to a manufacturers nameplate not to exceed 18 square inches in area i screening an antenna including supporting structures accessory equipment and the like shall be located and designed so as to minimize the visual impact on adjacent properties and from public streets rightsofway beaches canals and bodies of water the antenna shall be screened by the use of landscaping or architectural features which harmonize with the elements and characteristics of the lot or parcel on which it is located and the adjacent properties 1 all antennas and support structures shall be completely screened from groundlevel view from adjacent water bodies canals beaches rightsofway and properties when such screening will not prevent signal reception lowprofile screening material or landscaping shall be utilized along those reception axes where complete screening would interfere with reasonable signal reception 2 when landscaping material is used as a screening device hedges shrubs and trees shall be provided as appropriate in such quantity so as to form a continuous unbroken solid visual screen within 1 year from the date of installation 3 all antennas shall be a flat nonreflective color which blends with their background 4 no screening requirements shall be imposed upon an antenna installation which will act to prevent reasonable signal reception j height 1 no antenna shall be higher than the minimum height necessary for it to function 2 in no case shall a dish antenna be higher than the highest point of the principal structure on the subject property in a residential zone district 3 dish antennas in commercial and multifamily zone districts and all other antennas in any zone district may only extend a maximum of 10 feet above the highest point of the main building but in no case shall the antenna extend more than 10 feet above the maximum permitted height in any particular zone district k permit for construction or alteration any owner authorized agent or contractor who desires to construct or alter any mast tower antenna or related structure which is regulated by this section shall first make application to the building official and obtain the required permit therefor application for a permit with the required fee shall be filed with the building official on a form furnished by the building official and shall contain a general description of the proposed work its location and sufficient information to determine compliance with the requirements of this section l enforcement responsibility for the enforcement of this section shall be the duty of the building official m location permit in those instances where compliance with the location or height requirements of this section will prevent reasonable signal reception an exception to the regulations of this section may be requested submission of an antenna location permit exceptions to the height and location requirements of this section shall be considered only when it is demonstrated that reception will be impaired across a broad range of transmission sources the inability to receive signals from a specific source shall not be considered adequate justification for an exception from this section 1 required submittals all antenna location permit applications shall include a a completed application form b a site plan indicating the location of the antenna as well as all structures and vegetation both on and off the site which have an impact on the antenna location requirements c a landscape and screening plan indicating materials sizes and location of plantings or shielding material in sufficient detail to determine compliance with the complete shielding requirements of this section d a description of the height style color and orientation requirements of the proposed antenna e the required application fee 2 public hearing required following the submittal of a complete application package the city manager shall schedule a public hearing regarding the antenna location permit for the next available planning advisory board meeting a notice of the public hearing shall be published in a newspaper of local circulation not less than 15 days in advance of the meeting date b in addition letters shall be sent to all adjacent property owners and applicable property owners associations not less than 15 days in advance of the meeting date notifying them of the purpose date time and location of the public hearing 3 method of approval following the public hearing the planning advisory board may vote to deny approve or approve with conditions any application for an antenna location permit majority vote of the members present the planning advisory board action shall be final unless an appeal is filed by the applicant or a neighboring property owner with the city manager within 10 days of the planning advisory board action 4 appeal in the case of an appeal the city council shall hold a public hearing to review the planning advisory boards decisions regarding antenna location permits and render a final decision in case of such an appeal notification letters in accordance with subsection m2b of this section shall be sent to all adjacent property owners 5 criteria for approval an antenna location permit shall be granted only in those instances where the applicant demonstrates that a reasonable reception cannot be achieved within the height and location requirements contained within subsections g and j of this section  b the reasons why reasonable reception cannot be achieved within the required height and location requirements of this section are beyond the control of the applicant  c the exception from location and height requirements is the minimum required for reasonable reception and produces the least visual intrusion on adjacent properties public rightsofway canals and water bodies of all technically acceptable alternatives  and d the proposed installation is safe antenna location permits shall be issued for specific antennas in specific locations such permits may be revoked if circumstances change so as to negate the need for exceptions to location and screening requirements to facilitate adequate reception comp dev    street frontage required except as may be permitted by other provisions of this no building permit shall be issued for any structure unless the site thereof abuts for at least 20 feet on a city councilapproved vehicular access easement or on a public street rightofway a site that fronts only on a public alley shall also require city council approval comp dev    temporary buildings and structures except for the constructionrelated uses permitted under the temporary use permit provisions of this no temporary building or structure not permanently affixed to cityapproved foundations and utilities and in compliance with all other city requirements shall be permitted in any zone district unless specifically approved by the city council comp dev    timeshare lodging facilities in addition to the regulations stated elsewhere in this the following requirements are specifically applicable to timeshare lodging facilities 1 development standards maximum lot coverage offstreet parking minimum floor area and maximum building dimensions shall be the same as the subject requirements for a transient lodging use in the applicable zone district except that parking shall be provided on the basis of 112 spaces per unit and the minimum floor area shall be 600 square feet 2 onsite sales promotional activity notwithstanding other applicable provisions of this the following provisions shall apply a the original sale of the timeshare lodging units may be conducted on site in a sales office and in up to a maximum of 2 model units b onsite sales activity shall be limited to original developer sales c the sales activity shall be conducted inside the sales office and model units so as not to be noticeable from the outside except for permitted signs d onsite sales activity shall be terminated upon completion of original sales e a minimum of 1 parking space for each 2 proposed units shall be provided on site for the sales staff and potential purchasers use during the marketing sales promotional and construction phases 3 change of transient lodging use to timeshare use a change in a transient lodging use to a timeshare use is hereby legislatively declared to be a change in use subject to the approval process and all other applicable regulations in this comp dev    trash and garbage container enclosures a general in each zoning district except singlefamily residential districts each separate complex or business shall provide and maintain solid wood or masonry trash and garbage container enclosures pierced concrete block is acceptable for enclosures
